story:
After donating, leave a comment with your dedication so that it can be posted on HSCforSBC.


Sweet Briar College

Considered to be the most beautiful college campus in America, Sweet Briar has educated and enriched the minds and lives of young women for over a century.

If you have ever met a Sweet Briar alumna or current student, then you know the intelligence, character, and grace that is the signature of a Sweet Briar woman.

Now Sweet Briar faces a mounting challenge to remain open and we must act now to save her. 

Our goal is to dedicate roses to every Sweet Briar alumna. 
A Rose for a Vixen is dedicated to mobilizing the thousands of individuals around the world who did not attend Sweet Briar College but have been profoundly affected by Sweet Briar women. 

  • If your life has been positively affected by a Sweet Briar alumna, dedicate a rose to her. 
  • If your friend, relative, significant other, or great-great grandmother went to Sweet Briar, dedicate a rose to her.  
  • If you bumped into a Sweet Briar lady on the street and smiled, dedicate a rose to her.
  • If you support the mission of educating young women and want to help a future Vixen have this experience, dedicate a rose to her.
  • If you have a fond memory of time spent with a Sweet Briar woman, dedicate a rose to her.
*Please note the rose is symbolic and no physical roses will be delivered. All proceeds will be donated to Saving Sweet Briar, Inc., a 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation formed of Sweet Briar alumnae dedicated to saving the school and preserving the mission.

About A Rose for a Vixen


A Rose for a Vixen was started by HSC for SBC, a community of Hampden-Sydney College alumni, students, faculty, and friends. Hampden-Sydney College, located near the Sweet Briar campus, is a historic liberal arts college for men nestled in the foothills of the Blue Ridge mountains. 

The students of Sweet Briar and Hampden-Sydney become fast friends and are frequent guests to each others campuses. Together they enjoy mixers, boathouse parties, football games, concerts, and memories that always bring them back to some of the best years of their lives.

story:
How You Can Help and What You Get!

Our goal is to raise $15,000.00 during this campaign.  The funds will be used to provide scholarships for teachers to attend the 2015 Delaware Educators' Technology Boot Camp;  www.DelawareEdTech.org 

Early Bird Registration for each teacher:    $325.00

  • For every $10.00 contribution you get a Thank You in a Twitter Tweet
  • For every $25.00 contribution you get a mention in a Twitter Tweet and a posting of your picture on our Facebook page.  
  • For every $50.00 contribution you get all of the above along with your name published on our website as a Contributor. 
  • For every $100.00 contribution you get all of the above including an autographed copy of the Event Journal by one of our world-class educational technologist and your name published in the Event Journal.  
  • For every contribution over $100.00 you get all of the above as well as an invitation late summer 2015 to attend our Fall Gala (Venue TBA)
Oh, by the way did I mention that all Contributions are Tax Deductible.  Yes, we are a nonprofit 501C (3) organizations with tax except status.  So every dollar raised will be used to host this event and register as many teachers as possible so they can attend the Delaware Educators' Technology Boot Camp free.  

Short Summary

This campaign is intended to accomplish two (2) goals.  First, it will help or agency raise funds that will be used to sponsor and host an event that trains educators how to become effective educational technologist capable of adopting technology broadly for use in schools and classroom; administratively, practically and for professional development.   Second, the funds will be leveraged to help us attract other event attendees where the residual revenue will be used to underwrite our education and workforce development training programs.  

You may ask why this Campaign is so important...I am glad you asked.   In our small State of Delaware, certain communities are trying to understand why youth are loosing interest in school and dropping out at an alarming rate.  There are several studies that speak to the issue of young people dropping out of school and various reports offer recommendations that show the use of technology in classrooms and in after school environments has led to longer engagement, higher grades, better test scores and retention of young people in the education process. 

But, our campaign is not simply about helping kids finish school as much as it is also concerned with preparing and empowering educators to adopt new teaching methods and class engagement strategies that leverage the power of technology.  Our business is educational technology and we want to share our knowledge and resources with educators who may have certain bureaucratic and or economic constraints that prevent them from adopting technological tools and solutions that can help them achieve greater success in teaching.  

We realize that many of our schools, teachers and administrators would love to have access to all of the latest and most sophisticated technology resources available to deploy in classrooms and to use professionally as another tool to ensure that every young person learns at the highest level of achievement.  But, in far too many cases the financial resources just are not there to allow procurement of such technology let alone to provide for the Professional Development an educator would need to fully adopt all of the technological resources that they felt would work best in their class setting and among their student population groups.    

As a member of the community we feel that everyone must do their part to help our schools and teachers become better equipped with the best technology resources available that will help our children learn and prepare for the 21st Century.  Our after school and out-of-school programs must also be equipped with the best technological solutions, coaches and instructors that provide our children and families with access right in the neighborhoods and communities where they live.  

The magnitude of raising the contributions we are seeking is significant.  With your contribution we will be able to help 50 classroom teachers gain free access to 3-days of intensive educational technology training that will expose them to a host of experts, access to possible grant funding to help outfit classrooms and or school buildings as well as linkages to a global network of practitioners that can provide future collaboration.  

These funds will be used to register educators from the neediest schools and classrooms where thousands (1,000s) of young people will be impacted tremendously by the newly inspired teachers we empower during this hands-on Boot Camp learning experience and the subsequent new classroom resources that are sure to follow.  Your contribution will help to make some school or classroom in our community "Future Ready",  and well equipped to prepare our children for the 21st Century and beyond.   The contributions we receive will also be used to fund The E-House programs which will restart in the Fall of 2015.  


The Impact

In every place in America hundreds of educators, teachers and instructors are trying to educate our youth, many faced with not having enough resources.  This campaign will help us send a message to those who serve in this capacity that we do care not only about educating our kids, but we care about our educators.   

It does not matter where you are in your social/economic, political and or cultural ethnicity, ensuring that every member of our society receives a great education should be our common goal.  Technology has a way of leveling the playing feel for many.  This campaign to help educators and teachers learn new skills will prove to invaluable for our communities and our nation.  

We have a successful track record introducing young people to the power of technology for learning and developing skills.  Every trainer that has participated in our programs has been able to build their resume and expand their marketability in a world that demands that we all have the highest technology literacy in order to compete effectively in a global and competitive world.  

Help us to help our Educators and Teachers to become the world class leaders we need to keep our nation competitive and innovative.  

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

Risks & Challenges

This campaign is one of many we will use to raise the necessary funds to provide free registration scholarships to any educator/teacher not able to pay the fee while raising funds to support our various education/workforce training programs.   We would like to achieve 100% of our funding goal through this campaign, but realize that our mission is critical and we must do all that we can to ensure our goal is met to first provide a way for 50 of our teachers to attend this impactful Boot Camp this summer and secondly, raise enough funds to support delivering quality programs.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign on your Twitter, Facebook and other social media accounts.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

Thank you for your generous support!

story:
...Because You Love Sex Down South....

Sex Down South was born out of a desire for a space in the Southeast where folks could explore sex and sexuality. Our focus is intentionally broad, catering to a diverse range of people: from those who are curious but not quite committed, to those who have been around the block…and then some! Our mission is to create a sex-positive space for people of all walks of life to come together, explore, connect, and share knowledge and skills. It’s your exploration destination for all things sex and erotic.

This is the first of its kind, and we need your support to make it happen!

An essential part of Sex Down South is our commitment to diversity. Rooted in the idea of sexual liberation, it is vital to us that we cover a wide range of topics that are led and spearheaded by voices that are often unheard or marginalized. We are dedicated to having a diverse range of presenters and audience members, and are especially committed to highlighting and centering the voices of women of color, trans* and gender non-conforming folks, sex workers, queer people, and differently-abled individuals.

With your support, we'll be able to bring the sex celebrities you love and present the workshops that you all have been waiting for!

What We Need & What You Get

If you contribute to our campaign, your dollars will go to the following:

  • The hotel conference rooms, including the private sectioning of our conference (5 conference rooms, ball room and vendor area).
  • Marketing materials
  • Swag bags
  • Technological needs, including projectors, screens and everything that presenters need to make sure they have great presentations
  • Lodging & travel expenses
  • Office supplies
  • Entertainment
  • And all the behind-the-scenes stuff that goes into building a conference from the ground up!
When you contribute, you have the option to receive all sorts of perks, including social media shout-outs, a Velvet Lips sexy ebook, Big Bang tickets, conference tickets, personal sex coaching, Rock Boxes and more!

The Impact of Sex Down South

If you're looking at this, chances are you've noticed that the sexuality industry is not dominated by people of color.  We are striving to change that.  Marla and Tia (our co-founders) and our amazing crew (Roan, Natanya, Ari & Estee) want to make Sex Down South accessible to all people, no matter their background.  If you don't have the money to come, volunteer!  If you have the money to support, we would love it!  

Have you ever been to a conference and felt a little out of place because of who you are? (Think about your background, identity and other factors that make you unique.) At Sex Down South, we are committed to creating a respectful, welcoming, and accountable space for folks from all different backgrounds and identities, where people are free to bring their full selves in an environment that's loving, encouraging, empowering and educational.  We are striving to create a judgment-free zone where you can learn more ways to embrace your sexuality!

Making This Happen

We started this project with $200.  We have to get to $50,000.  We have a long way to go! Our team of 6 is working hard to put this together and get the funds we need in time for the conference to start,and we are not ones to back down.  We've gotten this far, and we're determined - with your help - to create a conference that can change and advance the landscape of the sexuality field, expanding its reach and being a prototype for education, as well as fun. 

We need your help to do this! Any amount you can donate will help us get closer to our goal of bringing Sex Down South to Atlanta.

We have sponsorship opportunities as well as chances for you to advertise in our program if you want to contribute in other ways as well!

Other Ways You Can Help Sex Down South

If you're not able to contribute money, you can still help:

  • We need folks to help us with the conference.  Email us at sexdownsouthatl@gmail.com or marla@sexdownsouth.com if you want to be a part of our crew!
  • You can volunteer to get a discounted ticket!
  • If you can't contribute, share this with your family, friends and folks who would love to contribute to our campaign.

Sex Down South...Your Exploration Destination...

story:
Summary

ARS Arts & Culture Center is a local community art center, offering cultural & fine arts adult and children classes, summer art camps, and workshops. ARS teaches at-risk youth, and assists them in assessing their strengths, and determining goals.  These young teens learn through lessons about community, public art, and overcoming adversity by studying the history and life of Muhammad Ali. They also learn to express themselves through introspective writing, creating their own sculpture, and expressing their thoughts and feelings through artistic media. Educational documentaries about the IATG project are created to raise awareness and help to educate people throughout the community and beyond about the work we are doing in Benton Harbor.  

What You Help us Accomplish

WHAT YOUR DOLLARS PROVIDE

By giving, you will help us to reach more youth and to help give them not only an art experience, but a safe place to create after school.  However this project is about  much more than creating art.  Community is a big topic of discussion and how to become more involved, as well as lessons in writing, creating your own sculpture, and receiving positive attention, support, nourishment and art therapy.  You will also help us to get the word out to a broader audience about our I Am the Greatest Project through film. Our goal is to enlighten more communities and beyond about the work we are doing here in Benton Harbor .  

The Impact

ARS realizes that this project does not just educate our local at-risk youth, but it also advances the broader goals of our community. We see where this program may serve as part of the solution to social issues not directly related to our youth or the arts - but how art can be the catalyst to educate our youth in such a way that it effects how they approach their community in the future. We also envision how this project could fit in our communities overall vision. By offering an arts based education program, and giving our youth the tools to help them model values, experience personal growth, and accomplishments, as well as developing self esteem,  We also teach skills such as concept to finish product, a transferable skill that can be used in any aspect of life.

ARS has a past experience of youth participating in IATG workshops, and as a result, we see this project develop their confidence and leadership abilities. We see evidence in their participation in schools, clubs and after school programming that these teens are taking a lead role in lots of areas.  In fact, ARS sees students each year being selected as student of the year, graduating high school and attending colleges.  

Risks & Challenges

Without your support, we will not reach as many at-risk youth as we would like. We also need to bring our teens a dinner each evening of the project, which could be their only hot meal of the day.  Without proper funding this may end up being a snack.  We run the risk of shortening our program by not including field trips to museums, plays and musicals or colleges, which is crucial for our teens in helping them see opportunities out side of their community.

Without your support, ARS will not be able to get the documentary finished, and previewed in various venues to enlighten our community about the work we are doing here in Benton Harbor.  These documentaries are valuable to gain even more financial support throughout the year.  Whats more, they share what our after school project is doing and how valuable these workshops are to our future citizens. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help if you are unable to make a financial donation. We are always in the need of meals/dinners, art supplies and paper. It is also just as important for you to spread the word about the IATG Project, so make some noise about what we do here at ARS!

story:
About the project:

This project aims to help a small community school called ADE (Avenir et Dévelopement de l'Enfant) in the ghetto of Thiaroye, Sénégal.

By installing solar panels, the primary school will be able to overcome its expensive electricity bills and use this money for further resources.

Due to its extensive electricity and rental bills, the school is often on the verge of closing down. The school's closure would remove any possibility for primary education for the poorest children of Thiaroye, as the only other primary schools in the area are private and thus expensive.

The installation of solar panels would also allow the school to use air-conditioning during the heat season. In summer the classrooms get extremely hot and make it difficult for the students to concentrate in class. Often the teachers have to take the children outside because of the heat. Some students even fall unconscious.

Furthermore, the project aims to create a digital classroom. This will not only allow the students to become familiar and study with computers, but it will also allow the teachers to widen their resources, materials and projects. ADE also aims to use the digital classroom for the benefit of the whole community: IT classes, health seminars (e.g. about AIDS), English language classes, and alphabet classes for illiterate women and young girls; so this project will allow this school to have some financial autonomy.



Who we are:

Ecole A.D.E.

ADE is a primary community school  based in the suburb Pikine near Dakar, Senegal.  The school offers education for disadvantaged children, such as those living in poverty or those unable to attend public schools due to illegal immigration.

Ecole ADE was founded in 2003. It was established to provide an educational opportunity for the children of Thiaroye. As a community school, Ecole ADE does not charge school fees, and relies on the generosity of the local community and philanthropic donations to operate.


DIGITALSCHOOL TECHNOLOGIES

DigitalSchool Technologies is an ICT for Education Catalyst, empowering Education with Technologies in West and Central Africa. Our offer consists of leading learning technology tools at lower cost with educators and students focus solutions-oriented. Our aim is to make learning and teaching easier, affordable and accessible to all.  


STATION ENERGY


Station Energy is a social enterprise specializing in the development of access to energy and basic services to remote areas. We use solar energy to address issues related to energy and basic uses (lighting, agriculture, telecommunications and cold chain).Established in Senegal, Ivory Coast and Burkina Faso, the company Energy Station offers solutions to socio-economic and climatic realities of each of its projects.


WHERE DOES YOUR FUNDING GO?

Total cost of the project:

7 030 621 FCFA (12 086 USD)


IT and Pedagogical proposal (provided by DigitalSchool Technologies):

10 monitors+keyboards+mouse = 

855 000 FCFA 

 

(1 459 USD)


10 thin clients  =   855 000 FCFA (1 459USD)
1 Server =  410 400 FCFA (700 USD)
Digital Library = 883 500 FCFA (1 507 USD)
Website for the school: FREE
Deployment of a collaborative platform: FREE


Energy Proposal (provided by Station Energy):

Solar Kit SES-PV-3000+ = 3 363 000 FCFA(5 740 USD)

4 'Canadian Solar' solar panels with 250Wc Support 

1 regulator Victron 150V-35A

2 Victron batteries 220Ah

1 inverter Victron MultiPlus 24/800
Cables and accessories
Solar accessories total =216 600 FCFA (369 USD)
Delivery / Installation = FREE


EN FRANCAIS:

Le projet:

Ce projet vise à aider une petite école communautaire, ADE (Avenir et Développement de l'Enfant), situé dans la banlieue de Thiaroye, Sénégal.

En installant des panneaux solaires, l'école primaire va pouvoir surmonter les frais immenses d'électricité et donc aura l'occasion d'utiliser cet argent pour d'autres ressources plus importantes.

Avec des frais de location et d'électricité trop élevés, l'école rencontre de nombreuses difficultés. Si l'école ADE ferme ses portes, ces enfants  n'auront plus accès à l'éducation car les autres écoles primaires qui sont aux alentours  ne sont pas à la portée de tous.

L'installation des panneaux solaires permettra aussi à l'école d'avoir un système de ventilation quand il fait chaud. En été les salles de classes sont extrêmement chaudes ce qui empêche les élèves de suivre convenablement les cours. Souvent il y a des évanouissements et l'enseignant est obligé d’arrêter le cours.

De plus, le projet vise à créer une salle numérique. Cela  permettra aux élèves de se familiariser et d'étudier avec les ordinateurs, mais  aussi les enseignants pourront élargir leurs ressources matériaux. Grace à ADE, la communauté pourra bénéficier de la salle informatisée en suivant des cours d'informatique, des séminaires sur la santé (par exemple le SIDA), des cours d'anglais, des cours d'alphabétisation pour les jeunes femmes; donc ce projet permettra à l'école communautaire d'avoir une certaine autonomie financière.



Qui on est: -Ecole ADE

L'école ADE est une école communautaire de Pikine en banlieue de dakaroise. Elle offre un enseignement de qualité pour palier les manques du secteur public sénégalais et prendre en charge l'éducation des plus défavorisés.

L’école cible prioritairement les enfants issus de familles défavorisées ou handicapées par diverses situations particulières (enfants n’ayant pas été inscrits à l’école formelle faute de bulletin de naissance, adultes désirant bénéficier de cours d’alphabétisation, immigrés clandestins…).


DIGITALSCHOOL TECHNOLOGIES

Digitalschool Technologies est une entreprise spécialisée dans les TIC appliqués à l'éducation. Nous œuvrons par une offre de services complète et spécialisée, et par la recherche et développement des applications et solutions logicielles, à l'accélération de l'usage des TICE en Afrique et notamment dans la région d'Afrique de l'Ouest et du Centre.


STATION ENERGY


Station Energy est une entreprise sociale spécialisée dans le développement de l’accès à l’énergie et aux services de base pour les zones isolées. Nous utilisons l’énergie solaire afin de répondre aux problématiques liées à l’énergie et aux usages de base (éclairage, agriculture, chaîne du froid et télécommunications).Implantée au Sénégal, en Côte d’Ivoire et au Burkina Faso, l’entreprise Station Energy propose des solutions adaptées aux réalités socio-économiques et climatiques de chacun de ses projets.


Ou va votre financement?

Coût total du projet) = 7 030 621 FCFA (12 086 USD)


Proposition informatique et pédagogique

10 moniteurs + clavier + souris   =   855 000 FCFA (1 459 USD)

10 Clients Légers   =   855 000 FCFA (1 459 USD)

1 Serveur   =   410 400 FCFA (700 USD)

Déploiement bibliothèque numérique =   883 500 FCFA (1 507 USD)

Création d’un site internet = OFFERT

Déploiement de plate-forme collaborative = OFFERT


Proposition Energie

Kit solaire SES-PV-3000+ = 3 363 000 FCFA (5 470 USD)

4 panneaux solaires Canadian Solar avec support 250 Wc

1 régulateur Victron 150V-35A

2 batteries Victron 220Ah

1 onduleur Victron Multiplus 24/800

Câbles et accessoires

Accessoires solaires = 216 600 FCFA (369 USD)

Livraison/Installation = OFFERT
story_txt:
About the project: This project aims to help a small community school called ADE (Avenir et Dévelopement de l'Enfant) in the ghetto of Thiaroye, Sénégal. By installing solar panels, the primary school will be able to overcome its expensive electricity bills and use this money for further resources.Due to its extensive electricity and rental bills, the school is often on the verge of closing down. The school's closure would remove any possibility for primary education for the poorest children of Thiaroye, as the only other primary schools in the area are private and thus expensive.The installation of solar panels would also allow the school to use air-conditioning during the heat season. In summer the classrooms get extremely hot and make it difficult for the students to concentrate in class. Often the teachers have to take the children outside because of the heat. Some students even fall unconscious.Furthermore, the project aims to create a digital classroom. This will not only allow the students to become familiar and study with computers, but it will also allow the teachers to widen their resources, materials and projects. ADE also aims to use the digital classroom for the benefit of the whole community: IT classes, health seminars (e.g. about AIDS), English language classes, and alphabet classes for illiterate women and young girls; so this project will allow this school to have some financial autonomy.Who we are:Ecole A.D.E.ADE is a primary community school  based in the suburb Pikine near Dakar, Senegal.  The school offers education for disadvantaged children, such as those living in poverty or those unable to attend public schools due to illegal immigration.Ecole ADE was founded in 2003. story:
TASHI DELEK!

Tashi Lhunpo Monastery is seat to the Panchen Lama, the second most important spiritual leader of Tibet. It is one of the four great monasteries of Central Tibet and was supervised and looked after by the Dalai Lamas and Panchen Lamas of the Gelugpa, or Yellow Hat tradition. It has the glory of producing thousands of renowned scholars in the field of Mahayana Buddhist Philosophy and Tantra.

The Communist Chinese invasion of Tibet in 1959 and the Cultural Revolution from 1966-80 both wreaked destruction on Tibet's monastic institutions, which lost many precious scriptures, statues and images. In 1972, under the patronage of His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama, Tashi Lhunpo Monastery was re-established in Bylakuppe, the Southern Indian state of Karnataka. The monastery has monks coming from Tibet and the Himalayan regions of Spithi, Khunu, Ladakh and Arunachal. Occupying a central position in the Tibetan settlement of Bylakuppe, there are over 350 monks including many Tulkus (reincarnate lamas) studying and performing various religious practices.The influx of new refugees is putting a strain on the re-established monasteries-in-exile, many of which are poor and having difficulties supporting the existing monks-in-exile.

Tashi Lhunpo Monastery is a nonprofit charitable organization which imparts various aspects of the Buddhist religion while maintaining a school of modern education. In recent years it has matured into a reputable full-fledged monastery, performing a vital role in the preservation of Buddhism. One aspect of a monastery is the parental-like responsibility of looking after the physical, mental and spiritual well-being of all the monks, throughout their lives. The modern school is at the budding stage and faces enormous daily hurdles. Yet, there is faith in divine help as the school moves along.

Tashi Lhunpo Monastery seeks to provide the best possible modern education, along with a deep and intimate understanding of the heritage of Tibet and Buddhism. We aim to become a contributing member in spreading the virtues of honesty, compassion and sacrifice, as taught by Lord Buddha. But, we are somehow lacking from a financial and infrastructural point of view. So, we appeal for your help to realize some our most cherished projects.

“Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.” - The Buddha

Tashi Lhunpo Bylakuppe Library Project (ENCOURAGE * EDUCATE * INSPIRE * BUILD) is one such endeavor. Our monastery lacks basic traditional library infrastructure and hopes to develop some facilities to create a full fledged working library in the months to come. As of the now, the young monks study and memorize their books under trees, in passageways, huddled in their teachers quarter,in playgrounds and sorely miss the presence of a central library facility with chairs, tables and bookshelves dedicated for this very purpose. Also, the lack of furniture and electronic equipment means that the number of books and the limited facility is always overextended for large the number of students. The monastery library also has some rare ancient scriptures which need to be restored, transcribed and published as paperback volumes so that the wisdom can be more readily accessed. In all this, we need your compassionate understanding and generous material support, by helping the preservation and dissemination of this ancient wisdom, you are not only accumulating great karmic merit but also, are playing a role to facilitate the teachings of the great enlightened sages and masters! 

Today's eager, bright young students are tomorrow's kind, wise teachers!

WHAT WE NEED

We need to raise money - $30,000 to pay the costs of buying library needs like furniture - bookshelves, racks, tables, chairs and electronic equipment like computers, scanners & printers. Also, a part of the budget is earmarked for transcribing of ancient Tibetan scriptures into new paperback books.

PROJECT FUNDING GOALS 

> First $7,500 will be spent buying basic library infrastructure like furniture - chairs, tables, bookshelves and racks.
>Additional $7,500 will spent on restoration, transcription and publication of ancient scriptures into paperback volumes.
>Another $12,000 will spent on buying equipment - like computers, printers, scanners and related technology accessories so that the library can also function in a contemporary way and make digital education easily accessible to the young monks.
>About $3,000 will be spent in creating and distributing quality souvenirs and gifts to all our INDIEGOGO patrons to reflect our gratitude for their enormous goodwill and support! Excess quantity of the souvenirs produced will be further used in fundraising for the library, during the monastery celebrations and teaching events.

WHAT YOU GET

Apart from earning much good karma, you have a wide array of custom made gifts with eye catching design and artwork that will make your contribution memorable and tangibly beautiful! Custom designed Postcards, Posters,Tote Bags and T-Shirts are worthy souvenirs and reflect you goodwill for us and our gratitude for you! 

HELP MAKE IT HAPPEN

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can help us with a donation - however small - towards our goal, that would be wonderful.  If it is not possible, then please 

  • Spread the Word! If you can't donate, please let others know we are here! 
  • Share this page on your Facebook page share our updates with your family and friends!
  • Like us on https://www.facebook.com/people/TashiLhunpo-BylakuppeLi... and share our updates!

ENCOURAGE * EDUCATE * INSPIRE * BUILD

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0wC03gLq2Bk

TASHI DELEK & THANK YOU!

for Tashi Lhunpo Bylakuppe Library Project and the team!

story:
The money is being raised to help cover the costs of the Thesis Show itself. So far the graduating class has put on an Art Auction, Bake Sale, and we will be having a Pub Night event and a raffle at the college . The students have also donated personally to this cause to get the fund raising started. In general there has been contact with sponsors in the community from different companies, but I would like to open up our avenue of donations to include our families and peers.

Any amount donated will be a great help to the fourth year students in the Humber College BID program. No amount is to small or too great, anything and everything is appreciated!

We are getting close to our deadline but there is still so much funding needed.

Help the students successfully put on an amazing show!!

Check out our website!!! 

www.2015evolve.com

THANK YOU!

Ashley Sutherland

Humber College BID Student

story:
Help werkzoekenden naar een nieuwe baan en toekomst!

Last van ontslag? Het project “Ontslag, En Nu?!” beoogt effectieve tools en middelen bij mensen te brengen die last hebben van ontslag. Zodat deze mensen persoonlijk effectiever worden. Hierdoor creëren ze zelf kansen voor nieuw werk, met zekerheid en meer vervulling.

Ik ben Victoria Waney, loopbaancoach en schrijver van het boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!” en presenteer deze campagne om de effectieve tools en middelen bij mensen brengen in SwitchCafés, WerkCafés en In-Between-Cafés.

De effectieve tools bestaan uit een boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!”, professionele loopbaancoaching en een gedegen mind-set training door middel van cutting edge Theta-Mind Setting.

Mijn passie is om mensen te helpen een nieuwe toekomst te bouwen. Dit gaat makkelijk door uit hun niet meer helpende overtuigingen te vervangen met een nieuwe mind-set. Omdat een goeie mind-set tegen economische recessies op kan!

Jij kan ook anderen helpen een nieuwe toekomst te bouwen na gedwongen ontslag . Hun helpen om weer in hun kracht te staan. Nieuwe kansen te kunnen creëren. En dit is goed voor ons allemaal.

++++++++++++++++++++++

Help job seekers find a new future!

The project “Laid-off, What’s Next?!” wants to bring effective tools and resources to the people who suffer from their job loss. To help them become more effective and personal motivated. This helps them to create new opportunities for new employment with security and more fulfillment.

My name is Victoria Waney and I am a certified career coach and writer of the published book titled “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (in Dutch) (or “Made Redundant, and What’s Next?!”) and am running this campaign to bring the effective tools and resources to the people through SwitchCafés, WorkCafés and In-Between-Cafés.

The effective tools and resources consist of my book “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (in Dutch for now), professional career coaching (in Dutch & English) and mind-set training using the cutting edge Theta-Mind Setting (in Dutch & English).

It is my passion to help people build a new compelling future. This is easy when we address their hindering old convictions and replace these by a new mind-set. Because a great mind-set is recession-proof!

You too can support people who want a better future after their redundancy laid-off and job loss. Help them empower again. This is for the good of the whole community.

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Het project heeft minstens 3000 euro nodig om 2 SwitchCafés te ondersteunen om de effectieve tools bij de mensen te brengen. De volgende stap is om een on-line training te ontwikkelen om nog meer mensen te kunnen bereiken.

Jij krijgt waardevolle perks & rewards bij een donatie. Geweldige pakketten voor jezelf, of om cadeau te doen aan iemand die in een ontslag zit! En dat je bijdraagt aan de toekomst.

Hoe meer je kunt geven, hoe meer wij kunnen doen in het project. Help ons!

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++


This project seeks 3000 euro’s to support 2 SwitchCafés to bring the effective tools to the people. Next, the project will develop an on-line training to reach even more people.

You will receive valuable perks & rewards for your donation. Amazing packages to keep or give to somebody who lost his/her job, while knowing you are helping your community too.

The more you give, the more miles the project gets. Help us make it happen!


+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Perks!

50 euro  
Boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 exemplaar);
+ Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind” (link).

Book “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 copy);
+ Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind” (link).



240 euro
Boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 exemplaar);

story_txt:
Help werkzoekenden naar een nieuwe baan en
toekomst!
Last van ontslag? Het
project “Ontslag, En Nu?!” beoogt effectieve tools en middelen bij mensen te
brengen die last hebben van ontslag. Zodat deze mensen persoonlijk effectiever
worden. Hierdoor creëren ze zelf kansen voor nieuw werk, met zekerheid en meer
vervulling. 
Ik ben Victoria Waney,
loopbaancoach en schrijver van het boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!” en presenteer deze
campagne om de effectieve tools en middelen bij mensen brengen in SwitchCafés,
WerkCafés en In-Between-Cafés.
De effectieve tools
bestaan uit een boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!”, professionele loopbaancoaching en een
gedegen mind-set training door middel van cutting edge Theta-Mind Setting.
Mijn passie is om mensen
te helpen een nieuwe toekomst te bouwen. Dit gaat makkelijk door uit hun niet
meer helpende overtuigingen te vervangen met een nieuwe mind-set. Omdat een goeie
mind-set tegen economische recessies op kan!
Jij kan ook anderen
helpen een nieuwe toekomst te bouwen na gedwongen ontslag . Hun helpen om weer
in hun kracht te staan. Nieuwe kansen te kunnen creëren. En dit is goed voor ons allemaal.
++++++++++++++++++++++
Help
job seekers find a new future!
The project “Laid-off, What’s Next?!” wants
to bring effective tools and resources to the people who suffer from their job
loss. To help them become more effective and personal motivated. This helps
them to create new opportunities for new employment with security and more
fulfillment.
My name is Victoria Waney and I am a
certified career coach and writer of the published book titled “Ontslag, En
Nu?!” (in Dutch) (or “Made Redundant, and What’s Next?!”) and am running this
campaign to bring the effective tools and resources to the people through
SwitchCafés, WorkCafés and In-Between-Cafés.
The effective tools and resources consist
of my book “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (in Dutch for now), professional career coaching (in
Dutch & English) and mind-set training using the cutting edge Theta-Mind
Setting (in Dutch & English).
It is my passion to help people build a new
compelling future. This is easy when we address their hindering old convictions
and replace these by a new mind-set. Because a great mind-set is
recession-proof!
You too can support people who want a
better future after their redundancy laid-off and job loss. Help them empower
again. This is for the good of the whole community.
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++


Het project heeft
minstens 3000 euro nodig om 2 SwitchCafés te ondersteunen om de effectieve
tools bij de mensen te brengen. De volgende stap is om een on-line training te
ontwikkelen om nog meer mensen te kunnen bereiken.
Jij krijgt waardevolle
perks & rewards bij een donatie. Geweldige pakketten voor jezelf, of om
cadeau te doen aan iemand die in een ontslag zit! En dat je bijdraagt aan de
toekomst.
Hoe meer je kunt geven,
hoe meer wij kunnen doen in het project. Help ons!+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++This project seeks 3000 euro’s to support 2
SwitchCafés to bring the effective tools to the people. Next, the project will
develop an on-line training to reach even more people.
You will receive valuable perks &
rewards for your donation. Amazing packages to keep or give to somebody who
lost his/her job, while knowing you are helping your community too.
The more you give, the more miles the
project gets. Help us make it happen!+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++Perks!50 euro  Boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 exemplaar);+ Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind” (link).Book “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 copy);+ Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind” (link).240 euro Boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 exemplaar);+ Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind (link);+ 45 minuten skype loopbaancoaching (op afspraak en te gebruiken in 2015).Book “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 copy);+ Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind” (link).+ 45 minutes skype career coaching (by appointment and valid in 2015).600 euro Boek “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 exemplaar);+ Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind” (link);+ 45 minuten skype loopbaancoaching (op afspraak en te gebruiken in 2015).+ gratis deelname aan Theta-Mind Workshop voor 1 persoon geldig in 2015.Book “Ontslag, En Nu?!” (1 copy);+ Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind” (link).+ 45 minutes skype career coaching (by appointment and valid in 2015);+ one free ticket to Theta-Mind Workshop (valid in 2015).9 euro Whitepaper “De 3 Grootste Geheimen over Persoonlijke Effectiviteit met Theta-Mind”(link).++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++SkyWalker Coaching, Utrecht

story:
Wale Wale Kenya

We are Wale Wale Kenya and we run a youth center in Kibera. Through this campaign, we want to establish an art & media center where youths will be able to study, write and produce music, film and other forms of art and media. 



Kibera

Kibera is one of the largest slum areas in Africa. Poverty, unemployment, lack of sanitation and security are issues people struggle with every day.  On top of this, boredom and the lack of something meaningful to do is often an enemy as threatening as poverty itself. In combination with the close access to crime and drugs, it is hard for young people to sidestep these destructive activities and to stay on the right track. 


Who are we?

The fundamental idea behind Wale Wale Kenya is to give young people access to a meaningful spare time and a chance to explore and develop interests and talents. At Wale Wale Youth Center youths come to engage in dance, film making, music and other forms of art and media. The youths receive support for high school and post high school education. On top of this the center is their own place where they can hang out and get a break from the stress of their daily struggles. Our mission is to provide tools with which young people can build the life and future they desire.



Why are we unique?

Participation, ownership and transparency are essential elements in Wale Wale Kenya. We are well aware that we are not the only organisation expressing these ideals. Sadly enough though, and according to our experience, few organisations in Kibera and Nairobi actually manage to implement them. Wale Wale Kenya is built upon the involvement of the youths and they play important roles both in the everyday work as well as in managing the organisation.


Our Campaign

Now we want to build an art & media center. A place where music, film, photography and texts are produced and spread for the world to see. The art & media center will be a way to explore and develop creativity. But also a unique opportunity for the youths of Kibera to participate in debates and discuss issues that concern them. The access to social media, internet and the global community that many take for granted but is limited in Kibera, will be an indirect but important effect of the art & media center.   

More specifically, the art & media center will be a place for:

- Music - through a basic recording studio and a few instruments give youth the opportunity to study, write, produce and distribute music.

- Film - by gathering equipment and knowledge, enable youth to learn and practice script writing, filming, editing, distributing and other parts of filmmaking. 

- Writing - For instance through blogs encourage and inspire youth in different forms of writing and at the same time take an active part in the global media society.

- Photography - providing equipment to explore and learn photography  


The Goal

The budget for  the art & media center is $6000. All of the funds will be put into equipment such as cameras, microphones, computers, recording devices, music instruments etc. 


The Perks

$1 - A Mental high five!

$5 - Recognition on social media
We will thank you for your contribution to our campaign on social media.

$25 - Electronic thank you card 

For your contribution you will receive an electronic thank you card.

$50 - Your name on our painting
We plan to put the names of all the people who donate $50 on a painting which will be on display in our youth center.

$100 - Personal thank you video
If you donate $100 you will receive a video made and produced by our youths made for you personally.

$500 - Wale Wale goodie bag
If you contribute with $500 you will receive a fantastic goodie bag with products which are produced by our youths, including but not limited to an album by Omentality, jewelry, a personal letter from our youths and a personal video.

$1000 and up - VIP pass to heaven
The contributor who has the heart (and wallet) of gold will by giving $1000 or more, will receive a VIP pass to heaven!!! You will skip all the queues leading up to the Pearly Gates and you can also skip the evaluation of your soul with St. Peter. Just go straight in and hang with all your old buddies!........ You will also receive a goodie bag with personal messages from the youths, even better than the $500 one.


If we don't reach our goal

Wale Wale Kenya is an organisation with a clear vision. If we do not raise the funds through this campaign we will continue to work towards our goal. The art & media center will one day be built. It will be an important step towards our vision to make the young voices of Kibera heard. 


The Impact

The project is primarily targeting the 40 youths in the center with whom we have been working for over two years. We have developed ways of working that include and encourage initiative and creativity amongst our youths. We started off with 15, now about 40 young people come to our center daily. Our youths have proven capable of utilising the responsibility and opportunities provided. We are confident that if we manage to raise the $6000 we will carry out the project successfully. 
Through the art & media center we will empower young people in one of the largest slums in Africa. The people who come to our center are individuals with tremendous energy and creativity, it's only the lack of opportunities holding them back. Our goal to give the youths tools, with which they can create the future they desire, will enable them in their progress towards becoming strong and confident and successful individuals. 

Working in Kibera - risks and challenges

Lack of security, mistrust, corruption and exploitation are some of the issues that all Kibera based organisations in one way or another have to deal with.
The vast knowledge and connection to the local community that the youths naturally possess helps in handling and avoiding issues connected to insecurity, crime and violence. 
Corruption and mistrust is prevented through heavy efforts in implementing transparent and democratic organisational structures where all members have insight and a say in every aspect and level of the organisation. The youths of Wale Wale Kenya have seats in the board, they run committees and they carry out the day to day work in the youth center. 

Life Story

The video below is recorded on a borrowed camera in a raw and unplugged version of Life Story - a song written and performed by Geoffrey Omenta, 19 years old and a member of Wale Wale Kenya. 


Other ways to contribute

If you don´t have the opportunity to support us this time, don´t feel guilty! Spread our word on your Facebook page, tell family and friends, help us get our story out there! You can also volunteer for the organisation.

 Thank you! Asante Sana!

story:
"The plea of Torba's Provincial President" 

    Vanuatu's Disaster Relief

Mar 20, 2015

Vanuatu President Baldwin Lonsdale told CNN that the cyclone's destruction was the worst his country had ever experienced. He described the storm as a "monster." "Decimation is the only word for what has happened here." 

Covenant Energy and associates are preparing to deploy an expedition to the Province of Torba located in the Republic of Vanuatu in the South Pacific Ocean at the request of a friend.

Cyclone Pam has slammed into the south Pacific archipelago of Vanuatu leaving "complete devastation" in its wake, aid agencies say.

We have been invited by a dear friend to assist in the recovery of a true devastation level disaster in the Republic of Vanuatu. Mr. Tony Hosea President at Provincial Government of Torba has asked us under the plea of the people of Torba Province and really the Island Nation of Vanuatu as a whole, to bring immediate relief and long term sustainable Telecommunications, Power, Clean Water and 365-Agriculture for Torba citizens.

This effort plans to provide a roadmap to self reliability and self sustainability for all the people of the Torba province and to teach the people of Vanuatu whom wish to learn. They will become an Economic Development example for the country to follow, as well as an example for the International Community that the people of Vanuatu have the foundation and are self empowered to promote Economic Development from within.

Tony and I were on Skype at 2:10AM EST US chatting about telecommunications and how he was working with Vanuatu Telecom LTD that night assisting the troubleshooting of the Australian submarine fiber optic cable. We even played around with testing texting (say that 3x real fast) Verizon US and Vanuatu via SMS platform. Then back to the ugly reality of his other life...he told me he was walking home because the Cyclone destroyed his car and the company truck was for working hours only.


The next morning (Vanuatu is 15hrs later) I woke up and ran to my laptop and got on Skype and checked my LinkedIn for any word from Tony. Soon after I logged on my friend Tony said he had to go do his other job today and off he went to see the Prime Minister. My friend Tony Hosea is the President of the Province of Torba. A very rural northernmost region of Vanuatu.

His people need Economic Development and oh yes there is Pam and the 98% devastation. English, French, Bislama...what language does he has to use for his cry and plea can be heard by my peers? I struggle with knowing that my resources and I can provide the greatest of impact if our expedition would finish getting funded, sponsored by a Philanthropist, a Humanitarian with financial resources, or a Corporation that can spare a few marketing dollars on a humanitarian sponsorship donation.

All schools in Vanuatu have been destroyed or damaged by Tropical Cyclone Pam, the United Nations says.
Aid agencies said conditions in cyclone-ravaged Vanuatu are among the most challenging they have ever faced with the severe storm tearing through the island nation, wiping out villages and displacing thousands. 

Vanuatu president urges world help to rebuild 'everything'

The president of cyclone-lashed Vanuatu makes a plea for financial help from the world community to rebuild 'everything' on his South Pacific island nation after it was smashed by one of the most powerful storms ever recorded. 

Video of President Asking for help...click here

Video of President Asking for help...click here


Immediate Relief Requests

  The initial efforts as Covenant states on the communications, website and crowdfunding platforms is “Phase-1”. That effort phase should be no more than 30-days (thirty) to establish a base of operations, the immediate relief scope of work and asses the next phase efforts. This first phase is the disaster relief sponsored donation aid effort referenced.

We wish to convey that private funding of your small non-government and non-not-for profit status is as in any nation, your responsibility as a business. However, we will make concessions and form specific Purchase Order Requests to Covenant vis-à-vis the DEVAN-VANUATU (Registered Vanuatu NGO).

Covenant Development will have a “Board of Directors & Advisors” and on this board will sit either DEVAN-Vanuatu or Proxies that will represent the voice of the people and what type of direction and funding this organization will receive outside of any private humanitarian or philanthropic initial funding.

A revised reconstruction plan for Vanuatu will require financial resources and time. We strongly urge you to make a long-term commitment to Vanuatu by supporting this emergency supplemental request and consider provisions that allow for a two-five year window to designate and disburse funds based on the revised development plan created mutually.  As more information becomes available, we will provide further recommendations on the type of fund that should be created with oversight mechanisms for the long term. 

We appreciate the immediate bipartisan concern that the Covenant executive management and all its associates have demonstrated towards the immense scope of the natural disaster in Vanuatu. It will take the efforts of a great many people and a great many resources, to fully recover and in the manner that we need to. We understand that every little bit counts, and we are appreciative as always. However, this effort will be used as a Model by which to work with private, small and nimble business and organizations throughout the globe.

Statement of Work and Direct Impact

  1. Establish a “new” “Emergency Disaster Communications System”, a Local Area and Wide Area Network for the use of Vanuatu NGOs and Government Ministries on Efate and outlying rural islands. This network will be an “Intranet” for our Disaster Relief and long term permanent private network for Ni-Vanuatu support and self-reliability.
    1. At this moment and current time,  the Government is using 60% of TVL Network, 45% of Digicel Network and EGOV which hosted by Huawei from the Chinese Government has got the rest. This has proven to be complex and costly, and after Pam…a mess to restore and use applicably for Government & NGO purposes.
  2. Establish clean water purification systems or desalination systems. This is one of the most important things other NGOs are not doing at this time. We do not want more bottled water. We wish self-sustainability with new equipment and training.
  3. We ask for your Project Management and Consulting capabilities to asses and establish our needs for “Cyclone-Resilient or Hurricane-Proof” housing and other structures. We wish to start a new facility that will create a great many jobs to fabricate, build and install these low cost structures.
    1. Immediately needed are over 3300 new homes on Efate alone and an unknown amount throughout the Island Nation. Estimates are all over the place and not yet reliable. However, everyone agrees that the numbers are staggering.
  4. Solar PV and other off-grid micro-grid technologies at low cost need be established immediately. We need 4kW -8kW DC systems for small homes and small business, village centers, etc. Please bring sample systems for relief, which we can use in our long term restoration and ongoing self-sustainability. Currently we pay approximately AU$0.35-AU$0.39 per kilowatt-hour of electricity. It is not stable and it is not available on any rural islands throughout over 70% of our Nation. This is a plea of help to stop the cycle of International gouging of Ni-Vanuatu by Utility and Telecom owners.

Please help us help ourselves. Covenant and all its scientific and engineering can be a great help to our Vanuatu Island Nation. We applaud all the efforts of all the UN and International aides. But we want to stand up for ourselves. We will help you at any capacity once you have arrived on our sovereign soil.

 -


About Us - A Vanuatu NGO

The government and development partners recognize the importance of Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs) for improving the well-being of human society. While they acknowledge the expertise of several NGOs in improving the socioeconomic conditions of disadvantaged people in Vanuatu, however, they are concerned over the capabilities of these NGOs to implement development projects.

There is a growing recognition among development partners that it is almost impossible to lead a development project to realistic and sustainable success without a capable partner. In order to fulfill this emerging demand, we have established DEVAN VANUATU, a Vanuatu-based NGO, in bringing project benefits closer to communities and mobilizing people’s participation. The establishment of DEVAN VANUATU is in direct response to the need for a dynamic and resourceful organization to deliver high-quality services to meet the emerging needs of disadvantaged people of Vanuatu.

We have assembled a core team of excellent and competent professionals with the capacity of producing outputs that add value to our clients and partners operations. They are drawn from a variety of disciplines including health, education, water supply and sanitation, engineering, information technology, environmental management, community development, marketing, accounting and finance. Our multidisciplinary professionals are committed to assist our clients and partners to achieve their short- and long-term goals and objectives. We are trying to establish a network of cooperation among DEVAN VANUATU and universities, educational establishments, research organizations, consulting firms and NGOs. We believe that if provided an opportunity, we have the capacity and capability to develop innovative, efficient and cost-effective solutions for improving the socioeconomic conditions of disadvantaged people in Vanuatu.

Our Main Areas of Work

  • Health
  • Disaster and Humanitarian Relief
  • Education
  • Economic Empowerment
  • Environment
  • Good Governance
  • Water Supply and Sanitation
  • Information Technology
  • Community Development

 Our Vision

Our vision is to become a leading Vanuatu Non-Governmental Organization acknowledged for our contribution to make Vanuatu a happiest country in the League of Nations by providing health, education and employment to every citizen of Vanuatu.

Our Mission

Our mission is to work with clients and partners for improving the socioeconomic conditions of disadvantaged people in Vanuatu.

We exist to provide high-quality services consistent with the needs and priorities of disadvantage people of Vanuatu.

We shall conduct our activities in accordance with the highest professional and ethical standards, providing services that add value to our clients and partners operations.

Our Core Values

Our core values are embodied in our commitment to build hope, respect and trust among disadvantage people of Vanuatu. We accordingly offer efficient and quality services on terms that are cost-effective with fidelity.

Our Approach

Consistent with our values and philosophy, our approach to service delivery involves:

  • Responding to the varied but specific needs and expectations of disadvantaged people of Vanuatu
  • Working systematically with our clients and partners to identify and correct procedures and practices that inhibit performance improvement
  • Upholding firmly the principles of partnership in all our relations with clients, partners, employees and volunteers

story_txt:
"The plea of Torba's Provincial
President"     Vanuatu's Disaster ReliefMar 20, 2015Vanuatu President Baldwin Lonsdale told CNN that the cyclone's destruction was the worst his country had ever experienced. He described the storm as a "monster." "Decimation is the only word for what has happened here." Covenant Energy and associates are preparing to deploy an expedition to the Province of Torba located in the Republic of Vanuatu in the South Pacific Ocean at the request of a friend.Cyclone Pam has slammed into the south Pacific archipelago of Vanuatu leaving "complete devastation" in its wake, aid agencies say.We have been invited by a dear friend to assist in the recovery of a true devastation level disaster in the Republic of Vanuatu. Mr. Tony Hosea President at Provincial Government of Torba has asked us under the plea of the people of Torba Province and really the Island Nation of Vanuatu as a whole, to bring immediate relief and long term sustainable Telecommunications, Power, Clean Water and 365-Agriculture for Torba citizens.This effort plans to provide a roadmap to self reliability and self sustainability for all the people of the Torba province and to teach the people of Vanuatu whom wish to learn. They will become an Economic Development example for the country to follow, as well as an example for the International Community that the people of Vanuatu have the foundation and are self empowered to promote Economic Development from within.Tony and I were on Skype at 2:10AM EST US chatting about telecommunications and how he was working with Vanuatu Telecom LTD that night assisting the troubleshooting of the Australian submarine fiber optic cable. We even played around with testing texting (say that 3x real fast) Verizon US and Vanuatu via SMS platform. Then back to the ugly reality of his other life...he told me he was walking home because the Cyclone destroyed his car and the company truck was for working hours only.The next morning (Vanuatu is 15hrs later) I woke up and ran to my laptop and got on Skype and checked my LinkedIn for any word from Tony. Soon after I logged on my friend Tony said he had to go do his other job today and off he went to see the Prime Minister. My friend Tony Hosea is the President of the Province of Torba. A very rural northernmost region of Vanuatu.His people need Economic Development and oh yes there is Pam and the 98% devastation. English, French, Bislama...what language does he has to use for his cry and plea can be heard by my peers? I struggle with knowing that my resources and I can provide the greatest of impact if our expedition would finish getting funded, sponsored by a Philanthropist, a Humanitarian with financial resources, or a Corporation that can spare a few marketing dollars on a humanitarian sponsorship donation.All schools in Vanuatu have been destroyed or damaged by Tropical Cyclone Pam, the United Nations says.Aid agencies said conditions in cyclone-ravaged Vanuatu are among the most challenging they have ever faced with the severe storm tearing through the island nation, wiping out villages and displacing thousands. 
Vanuatu president urges world help to rebuild 'everything'The president of cyclone-lashed Vanuatu makes a plea for financial help from the world community to rebuild 'everything' on his South Pacific island nation after it was smashed by one of the most powerful storms ever recorded. Video of President Asking for help...click hereVideo of President Asking for help...click here

Immediate Relief
Requests

  The
initial efforts as Covenant states on the communications, website and
crowdfunding platforms is “Phase-1”. That effort phase should be no more than
30-days (thirty) to establish a base of operations, the immediate relief scope
of work and asses the next phase efforts. This first phase is the disaster
relief sponsored donation aid effort referenced. 
We wish to convey that
private funding of your small non-government and non-not-for profit status is
as in any nation, your responsibility as a business. However, we will make
concessions and form specific Purchase Order Requests to Covenant vis-à-vis the
DEVAN-VANUATU (Registered Vanuatu NGO).
Covenant Development will
have a “Board of Directors & Advisors” and on this board will sit either DEVAN-Vanuatu
or Proxies that will represent the voice of the people and what type of
direction and funding this organization will receive outside of any private humanitarian
or philanthropic initial funding.
A revised reconstruction
plan for Vanuatu will require financial resources and time. We strongly urge
you to make a long-term commitment to Vanuatu by supporting this emergency
supplemental request and consider provisions that allow for a two-five year
window to designate and disburse funds based on the revised development plan
created mutually.  As more information becomes available, we will provide
further recommendations on the type of fund that should be created with
oversight mechanisms for the long term. 
We appreciate the immediate
bipartisan concern that the Covenant executive management and all its
associates have demonstrated towards the immense scope of the natural disaster
in Vanuatu. It will take the efforts of a great many people and a great
many resources, to fully recover and in the manner that we need to. We

However, this effort will be used as a Model by which to work with private,

story:
Who are we?

The Debaters' Council of Sri Lanka (http://thedebaterscouncil.blogspot.com) has selected a delegation consisting of five debaters and one Coach/Chaperone (and one mascot so awesome, he doesn't even need the right flag, Chris) to represent the nation at the World Schools Debating Championships 2015, held in Singapore from the 27th of July to the 6th of August.

From left to right in that super cool picture up there, the debaters are: Eran Fernando and Amrita Khandpur from Colombo International School, Devin Hewage of S. Thomas' College, Miriam Alphonsus of Methodist College and Sidath Samarasinghe of Royal College.

Those on the team have been recently selected from a pool containing some of the highest ranking speakers in the school level debating circuit, and are individuals who have committed themselves to the task of representing Sri Lanka at the tournament, among more than 50 other nations.


Sadly, commitment and training alone won't get the team to Singapore. We've launched this campaign to raise the funds we need to send the team for the tournament, as efforts at securing local (government or private) sponsorship have not been productive so far. 


What we need and why

We need to raise the funds necessary to cover the cost of the registrations of the delegation, which comes to S$1,150 per person, which is equivalent to about 835 US Dollars or about 111,000 Sri Lanka Rupees. (http://www.wsdc2015.org/registration.html)

Since there are 6 of us, the registration fees come to a grand total of about 5010 dollars, not including airfare, which the team has decided to pay for on its own as it would be inconsiderate to rely entirely on external support. The $5500 goal is to cover the fees levied through Indiegogo itself.

For now, the plan is for the delegates to provide the necessary funds through any means necessary as there is a deadline that must be met to  assure the registration of the team, and then they will be reimbursed from the funds raised.

Every cent raised beyond our goal will go towards funding next year's team, which will be going to Stuttgart, Germany.


Why this is important

English debate is, naturally, not the biggest field in our nation or the world, but it acts as a medium to propagate critical thinking, discourse and resolution of issues amongst those who are involved in it, unlike any other.

Events like the World Schools Debating Championships serve to propagate English debate across the world, and the more teams take part, the greater the effect is; the delegations take what they learn and experience at the tournament, back to their home nations to be spread in their local circuits.

The people who attend these tournaments and the people in their local circuits will be amongst the individuals tackling the world's issues, either now or later in life. By supporting at least one team (and we urge you to support as many as possible), you are making an immeasurable contribution.



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Get the word out to your friends and let them know what they can do.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for helping us out - you've gotten us that much closer to getting to the tournament!

story:
Jeffrey was an amazing child that pushed all the boundaries in life.  He laughed and smiled making it his mission to make everyone laugh.  He had a rough start with an alcohol abusive father that he struggled dealing with after but his life shone bright when we broke free from that life.  He struggled for a time with drugs and anger, depression enveloped him for quite some time.  Then his light started to shine so bright, his grades went up, he walked around singing and laughing.  He hung out with his best friend Tyler,  got his licence and a snowmobile.  He spent his days fishing, hunting and god help me smoking.  It was OK though because I had my loving happy little boy back...who was taller than me.  The last thing in Jeff life was a kid picking and trying to start a fight.  My hot headed boy turned and walked away I am so proud!  It unfortunately was the last thing he could handle piled on his already heavy heart.  He came home, he cleaned his room (which was always a disaster), wrote a note stating he couldn't take the bullying anymore and finished it with how much he loved us (Jeff writing is awful and illegable but this was written perfectly and neatly.  Then my amazing bright funny laughing smiling child hung himself in the basement.   He is gone, my baby is gone and I can't get him back so why should a bully get to take his words back.  I am making it my mission to stop this bullying, if I can even save one child it will be more than worth any effort because I only wish I could have saved mine.  Don't ever think it doesn't happen to your kid, don't ever think that words and actions of a child doesn't leave scars.  Tell your children you love them and are so proud of them.  Play their silly games, laugh at their jokes and stand up for them, always be on their side.  Don't live the rest of your years with the regrets I now carry.

All I want right now is to bury my son, to give him the funeral he deserves.... to make his bright light shine on in our hearts.


Any contributions maybe be sent etransfer if you wish melissa_econo@hotmail.com and comment password in private message.... ty once again everyone you are all amazing and I cry every time someone donates it's so touching...
