movement grow and be known abroad:


Support
the athletes of today, whom we already have! Guyana does not use “participation”
wild card places in order to appear at championships. We have a 40-strong
representation out in Toronto this summer for the Pan American Games. We send
athletes to the Olympic Games, who qualify through the difficult international
IAAF standards. But we don’t have a sponsor. It shouldn’t be difficult to find
a technical sponsor.


Grow the
athletes of tomorrow. This is where your funding goes! Every year there will be
10 new scholarships, with a duration of 3 years, aimed at growing high school kids
into the athletes and students they need to become in order to qualify for a
free US student-athlete college education. Through an extensive network we will
then get them recruited in college. And change their lives.



Promote
the sports movement in Guyana and its visibility abroad, through constant
collaboration with the Guyana Olympic Association, to which we are advisors.
With part of this crowdfunding, we are setting up websites and media visibility
for the GOA. This sounds like a corn ball thing but it’s actually quite key –
we want to show to the world that Guyana is a fertile and legitimate place to
invest their money, efforts, thoughts and hopes.



What's In It For You!
 

There’s
more to it... we have great perks for your contributions too! Sure, as a
charity project the most important perk will be to see your funded athletes
grow into the Olympians of tomorrow – the 2015/16 class will be 20 years old in
2020, which is prime time for a sprinter to run fast: what a story would it be
if some of those 10 kids end up qualifying for the Tokyo Olympics! Anyway, look
at the perks list, we also have more short-term ways to say thank you!
Let me
also make one important disclosure, which has to do with the return on your
investment in us. We are sure your generosity will help us fully reach our
goal. But it wouldn’t be respectful towards you, our supporters, if were not
prepared to the possibility that we may fall short. In the spirit of full transparency we want to let you know exactly what we will do if that’s the case:

The scholarships will be prioritised, so anything raised up to USD 10,000 (roughly
GBP 7,000) will be channelled into those; we would rather have to cut on our
admin costs (see “other ways you can help” below on how you can actually help
us cut those costs) than to curtail our core goal of giving out 10 scholarships
in September.


In the
(unhappy) event that we won’t reach even the scholarships amount, we will still
launch 10 scholarships but of a reduced amount. USD 1,000/year go quite a long
way in Guyana, and so would USD 800, or 700. Still, we very much hope it will
be US 1,000. But at least now you know what’s in our minds in that eventuality.

 
Other Ways You Can Help 

Alright, we understand that you may like the cause but may not be ready to commit some
of your $$$ to it. The good news is, there are other ways you can help us out
just as much. Please get in touch at info@athleticelevator.org if any of the
below applies:
Traditional
ways


We used
our networks to spread the word about AE’s fundraising. Share with your friends!
Indiegogo has a useful “share” tool which you can use to post on your Twitter
and Facebook.

On July 29th, there will be a Thunderclap! Which means we'll try to reach much further than our network of contacts through a Facebook app that lets us post a promotional pitch for this campaign on your wall. Please register to it and let us use your network to spread the word! Use this link: http://thndr.it/1Kb3IgO (We can only post a one-off message. Thunderclap won't spam. It's a serious service. It's legit. And it works!)


We’d love
to hear your ideas! This is very much a blank canvas project. We shrank our
brains to the fullest, they are rather empty and we’d love some more input.


The above
includes any criticism you may want to direct to us.
Less
traditional but perhaps more intriguing ways


We need
legal advice. If you are a tax accountant or a lawyer or are simply
knowledgeable about charity stuff, and would like to help us pro bono in
setting up a charity organization either in the UK or in the US, pro bono,
please get in touch as we’re looking for you.


We need
media savvy support. If you are into social media campaigns, or digital marketing,
consider this campaign of ours. It is nice but admittedly we could do much more
if we only had more experience and expertise. Help!


We are looking for
technical sponsors for Guyana. If you are into sports marketing and/or athletes
management, and have ideas as to how we can structure one or more technical
sponsorships, the Guyana Olympic Association is looking for partners. These can
be delegation-wide or specific to disciplines; they can be related to the
“athletes of today” or we could build a story and partnership with AE to
support the athletes of tomorrow (e.g. the funded students need kit!).


We want
to figure out a way to exploit the untapped tourism potential of Guyana
combined with the fact that Georgetown now has state-of-the-art sports
facilities. If you organize sports tours or vacation packages, do get in touch
and we’ll have an extended chat on this! It is really easy to fly to G’town
from both North America (direct flights from JFK and Montreal) and the UK
(British Airways flies direct to Trinidad, which is a short flight away).
The Long Story

I figure
some of you might be curious to get a clearer picture on how this whole Athletic
Elevator thing was possibly conceived. So if you have time and feel ready to steer
towards the philosophical edge of this adventure, let me tell you more about
the story that led us here.
As I
said, I am a long distance runner by passion, an energy expert by profession
and a global gypsy by inclination. In prose, this means that I have a career in
energy consulting which led me to travel the globe. I am currently in transit
between London, which has been my base for the best part of the last 10 years,
and Colorado where I am about to take on a new professional adventure. Over
these years I also spent shorter periods for assignments in Washington DC,
Brussels, New York and Houston. For work or simple curiosity, without an actual
plan, I ended up spending time in all continents except Antarctica. Global
gypsy enough? OK. As to running: it has been my second skin for 20 years, and
of the big passions of my life it has been the most elusive; that is, the one I
always was unconditionally in love with, but which I always felt guilty for not
prioritizing enough. This is because I believe in the role of sport as a
metaphor of life, and an enabler for philosophical understanding and education.
As such, it has to be an amateur activity, a side gig, which is why I never pursued
the professional athlete route. At the same time, as work responsibilities and
pressure stacked up, I grew afraid that all this running around in circles on a
track and on the roads was only wasting my time and doing no good to the world.
How exactly would the world become a better place if I clocked 2h15 instead of
2h19 in the marathon? Would anyone’s life get any better if I did? Who else
would benefit, besides my own vanity?But then
something happened. The sort of stuff that makes people say: things fall into
place. Actually, I am a sturdy rational thinker and don’t quite believe they do
so without receiving the correct incentives. You’ve got to work very hard to beat
cosmic entropy, you have to search deep, you have no assurances of success and
you have to accept that the efficiency of your efforts is less, much less than
100%. In other words to catch the right train, even though you don’t know if it will
ever come, you have to at least be waiting for it on the platform. The train I
wanted to catch was something that would make sense of this restlessness, this
feeling that I had a puzzle of a life which could somehow become a beautiful
figure but I didn’t know how. After all I spent 35 years hearing people tell me
that the intellectual and physical dimensions of life are irredeemably separate
things, and although my own experience hinted that it might not be such a
clear-cut story, who was I to challenge such a widespread view? 

Another
complicating factor was that I was kind of good at what I was doing, but
nowhere near good enough for the global competition I had thrown myself in. As
one of many not so talented runners, the solution was not to be sought in the
improvement of my mediocre standard. I looked up at the likes of Wesley Korir –
I know, you haven’t heard this name before; when you live at the margins of
conventional life, you also end up worshipping unsung heroes – and I realised
that winning the Boston Marathon and then moving back to my home country, running
for parliament and changing it for the better was not really in the cards. If I
had a chance, I had to seek it in the mixture of unique experience that I had.
Those strange puzzle tiles, part of which I had been given, part of which I had
built. I had to blend things. Play my best hand. Sports. Management. A cosmopolitan
approach to life.
When you
have these sorts of thoughts, and you are the sort of guy that I am, you end up
browsing Google Maps late at night, asking yourself “What good amid these? O
me! O life!”. There must be a place in the world where even with my limited
means, I can make a difference. What sort of place does it have to be?
It has to
be a place where I can show up and say, here, now, that I have something good
to offer. At the same time it has to be a place where what’s on offer has to
get traction, there has to be a sensibility to sports and there has to be a
fertile ground for the importance of education in improving one’s life
conditions. It took a while of searching. I was perhaps making mistakes in my
approach. I was getting nowhere. But the best thing about making mistakes is
that you perceive a learning curve. Let me tell you a dirty secret about
exploring outside one’s comfort zone: the sheer perception of a learning curve
has its own lifting force. It seems very weak, an uninviting whirlwind, but if
you rely on it, it can keep you in the air for a while, while you try to set up
a more stable lift. And when it comes to the feeling of getting nowhere and
being exhausted and the finish line not in sight, that’s a marathon runner’s
bread and butter: around mile 20, it always feels like that. If you don’t have
a “shit, another 6 to go” moment around mile 20, all it means is you haven’t
pushed hard enough. You can address it in one of two ways: either you quit, or
you shut your demons off and keep going. If you manage the latter, you find
strength you didn’t know existed, you trick your body into getting through
another 3 miles, then you push hard with all your mental power through another
2, then you crawl the final mile, and in the end guess what: the finish line
appears. 
So, exactly
according to schedule, after getting nowhere for long enough, Guyana appeared on
the horizon. A small country, where an individual could make a macroscopic
difference to a population. An English speaking place, which was paramount to
the concept I had in mind (more on this below). A place where education is held
in high respect and actually with a high school attendance rate of over 60%. And
perhaps most importantly for my own story, an Olympic Association which showed
interest in my propositions.After the
unbound nature of my mindset led me to scout as far as the tropical rainforest
of South America, I said to myself, enough for the cosmopolitan side. Now how
could I blend the remaining skills – sports experience and management expertise?

Two ideas
came out. The first was to help the athletes of today. Guyana is not one of
those small nations who use quota places in order to appear at championships.
There are sprinters out there who are capable of low 10” in the 100m and 45” in
the 400m; depending on how much you are into track & field, this will seem
to you between awesome and outright impressive – especially considering that
the first ever proper track in Guyana was inaugurated this April. More remarkably
still, Aliann Pompey won a Commonwealth Games (another one under the chapter of
unsung heroes. Look her up on Wiki). And there is a 40-strong representation
out in Toronto as we speak, for the Pan American Games. Guyana regularly sends
sprinters to the World and Olympic Games who qualify through the difficult
international IAAF standards. But they don’t have a sponsor. It shouldn’t be
difficult to find them a technical sponsor. This was the first idea.
The
second idea is the one we’re crowdfunding for right now. It is also more in
line with the philosophy of my approach to sports. As I said, I am in sports as
a metaphoric journey to a better understanding of life; sports as an enabler to
our truest nature. This is how the “athletes of tomorrow” branch of the project
was conceived. Small digression: my wife has just finished a degree in the US,
as a foreign student-athlete, fully funded by the track&field team to
compete in the collegiate NCAA sports system. She had to train hard and she had
to study hard and those were tough years, but as a result, not only did she
slash her 5000m time by almost half a minute, but she was also able to earn a
US degree for free (and, for US readers who will be sensitive to the topic, no
student loans to repay). From here, the step was short: what if we could grow a
batch of Guyanese kids, during their high school years, so that they reach
their final year, which is the one when they can be recruited for college, and
they have an academic track record as well as sports performance level that
they can qualify for NCAA competition? And then we put them in touch with US
college coaches, who are in constant search for new athletes to fill their
rosters with?
Wow, this
looks like one big window of opportunity. This is also when Athletic Elevator
was properly born. With the help of a few friends, as well as the support of
the Guyana Olympic Association, we structured this project.
And in
the end... What good amid these, O me! O Life!
“Answer:
That the powerful play goes on, and you may contribute a verse.”
This is
the first verse.

Let’s make it a poem. A beautiful one.

story:
It started with cheese. My name is Sacha Laurin, Australian born, with my home and family in beautiful Davis, CA. Cheese AND fashion? Yes they are connected and can thrive together! Apart from both being inspiring and delicious to so many of us, they are both direct products of my love for the art and science of fermentation and pure essence creation. I am head cheesemaker for Winters Cheese Company, (www.winterscheese,com), and 2 years ago I began my own company- Kombucha Couture- developing eclectic sustainable clothing from live kombucha cultures.

Kombucha- a fermented green and black tea that uses a live bacteria and yeast symbiotic culture (SCOBY) to bring sparkle and detoxifying power to the final brewed elixir just as milk uses live bacteria and yeast to become amazing cheese. I have been living, breathing, drinking, growing, drying, sewing, and showing Kombucha as a living probiotic sustainable vegan aquatic leather for the past 2 years. Along with doing all those same things with cheese...except sewing! Kombucha Couture has started creating a buzz* as if it has a life of its own (it actually does). More than what my garage is big enough for. There is nothing like it on the planet. And no one has ever put it on a fashion runway before...and in this past year I have showcased at now 5 fashion shows and have been invited to showcase at Paris Fashion Week September 30, 2015. And, it is currently on a billboard on the walk of fame in Hollywood for an LA bottled water company!

Featuring actor Kristen Renton and model Kayla Swift.

*the buzz: 

Video- http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/02/24/clothes-made-from-tea_n_4846045.html Fox 40 live 2014
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lA6PDSxLVuQ Fox 40 live 2015

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zuGKrcgFi3A IndieFun- Ace of Spades

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0dSCx9JzSoY&list=PLpIUe_p9ff5OZXOh0yTXVMBs1I_N9mzku&index=13- RAW Artists, Ace of Spades 2014

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DRJJxUi6oF8 Celebrate Davis Fashion Show 2015/1

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aCEwjYqNmcE Celebrate Davis Fashion Show 2015/2

Press-http://www.huffingtonpost.com/india-mandelkern/can-kombucha-couture-save_b_4321938.html

http://www.bizjournals.com/sacramento/print-edition/2015/03/06/seriously-clothes-and-jewelry-from-kombucha.html
http://sacfashionweek.com/sacha-laurins-kombucha-couture
We are almost ready for Kombucha Couture to be released on the market as a new vegan aquatic leather- no animals lose their lives to create these clothes!- and the cellulose that is harvested to create the clothing still contains the microscopic probiotics that keep working to make you healthy. I have spent 2 years in research and development, working with microbiologists at UCDavis and breweries such as Nessalla, in Madison, Wi, who have supported and taught me so much through this developmental phase. 

As you will see in the video above (and here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bmFuOLSsizU ) the most strange, bubbly goop in tubs, when treated with love and scientific awareness of what the cultures need, can become truly beautiful clothes. And yet, as far as Kombucha Couture has come in 2 years, I still feel it is a jalopy compared to the porsche and ferrari it is destined to become. It will take time. But I hope you will see the potential and be inspired by what we may be able to produce not only as exquisite creative high fashion but superb durable sustainable urban wear and even highly insulating material for third world countries for clothing and construction. It will be your trust in Kombucha, in the process, and in my work, that will make the difference where this idea goes, and I am so grateful to those of you who have the trust and share my highest vision. 

Kombucha fabric is beautiful- it is light as a feather but has a higher tensile strength than cotton in terms of actual nano-fiber strength. I am working every day to make it stronger, more durable, more water resistant, and there is progress in literally every new batch. It can  mimic wood, canvas, leather, suede, butterfly wings- the range of textures from growing and curing methods is astounding. For the most part, it is like what you would imagine a mermaid would wear if you made her a leather jacket.  It seems to gleam from within, it has an essence of being aquatic although you can't put your finger on what it is that makes it so different. ...it catches light in a special way due to how the fibers line up- it can even resemble stained glass in a way no other fabric can. I have tried to showcase this unique feature as much as possible in the "perks" jewelry available to you.

My vision is to be able to bring Kombucha Couture to the world and say - take a look at this new fabric, put it to the test against everything else, and lets see what it can do that other fabrics can not. I have already discovered so many ways to make it shine...literally. I am passionate and committed to taking Kombucha fabric to the best places in the world that can develop it as the new sustainable paradigm fabric...with your help.  We once thought leather smelled weird and now we love that new leather smell. Kombucha fabric is alive and it can actually smell a lot like honey. No animal loses its life, no acres of fields to water, and one of the highest tensile strength fabrics can be produced with careful urban farming planning. With your valued support I may be able to expand this beyond my home which has already made testament to what is possible starting from one roll-a-door garage.

To make my clothing, the entire process is completely zero waste. I boil green and black tea + sugar + mother culture = amazing drink. Lay drink out in tubs and watch  the bacteria spin tight neat beautiful mats of cellulose in the same way silk worms spin silk. I harvest the mat of cellulose and dry it, using food dyes to color it, and sew it as clothes. The tea from the tubs receives new nutrients and almost no liquid is lost from one batch to the next. I recycle Nessalla (www.nessalla.com) SCOBYS that they would usually compost, and turn them into began leather clothing. 100% sustainable. 100% live. 100% good for you.

Soleil- Kombucha master in training.

Eco fashion is a growing trend that is gaining worldwide attention and credibility and my vision for Kombucha Couture is to not only help bring brand new sustainable fabrics and vegan leather to the fashion world but also be able to help empower developing countries to grow their own clothes from just tea and sugar. Being able to take my vision of sustainable live culture clothing to the world wide platform of Europe means increasing all levels of the company, from growing capability to managing a growing business. I currently have seven designers working freelance and volunteering for Paris Fashion Week, but I'd like to be able to create true employment opportunities for them and so many more.  Together we are creating the 44 pieces for Paris Fashion Week, showcasing at Paris showroom Bakana at 91, rue Faubourg Saint Honoré on September 30, and from there we will begin work on launching our first commercial line.

Meet the team-

It is a huge endeavor but I feel sure that the European market will at some point be receptive to my vision. I would love to have the means to trademark and patent my product, open an online store, commission more research, expand production with more room to grow the cultures, more infrasructure for conditioning, curing and drying, for sewing, designing, for marketing and selling. With these expansions that Indiegogo could help with,  I believe that this new fabric could earn itself a place of world attention and respect.

story:
Applied Behavioral Services (ABS) is a long standing education and treatment provider specializing in services for communication delays, autism spectrum disorders, ADHD, anxiety, behavioral disorders, intellectual disabilities, and social/emotional delays. This campaign is to raise funding for much-needed playground equipment. This new playground needs to be fully accessible to kids ages 2-10, with special needs ranging from Down’s Syndrome to Autism Spectrum Disorder.

All kids need to run around outside, but for our children, it’s so much more than just a playground.  To set our kids up for success, we need to give them the right tools for coping with their special needs. Right now it’s just a black top with no real focus so the kids disperse into their own world. This new playground will act as a safe tool aiding in communication, socialization and sensory issues for kids with special needs. This often means specific physical exercises that help them calm their minds and bodies enabling them to hear and process what we teach in the classroom. You see, this special playground is more than fun. It’s a necessary tool for our kids to learn--and reach their fullest potential.

How You Can Help

Our goal is to begin building the new playground in the Summer of 2015. It’ll cost up to $50,000. Please consider making a donation of any kind. You can even pay for an actual piece of the playground.

Plus, we have a ton of awesome incentives. From an extended cut of our video to personalized social stories and much more, we have a special thank you for everyone who contributes.

We truly appreciate your generosity. And whether you can donate or not, please help us spread the word. Share our video on Facebook, Twitter, all your favorite social media sites. Tell family, friends, neighbors and co-workers. Maybe your company will match your donation. Just keep talking about it. Together, we’ll make this happen.

Thank you!

Applied Behavioral Services (ABS) is a long standing education and treatment provider specializing in services for communication delays, autism spectrum disorders, ADHD, anxiety, behavioral disorders, intellectual disabilities, and
social/emotional delays. This campaign is to raise funding for much-needed
playground equipment. This new playground needs to be fully accessible to kids
ages 2-10, with special needs ranging from Down’s Syndrome to Autism Spectrum
Disorder.
All kids need to run around outside, but for our children, it’s so much more than just a playground.  To set our kids up for success, we need to give them the right tools for coping with their special needs. Right now it’s just a black top with no real focus so the kids disperse into their own world. This new playground will act as a safe tool aiding in communication, socialization and sensory issues for kids with special needs. This often means specific physical exercises that help them calm their minds and bodies enabling them to hear and process what we teach in the classroom. You see, this special playground is more than fun. It’s a necessary tool for our kids to learn--and reach their fullest potential.
How You Can Help
Our goal is to begin building the new playground
in the Summer of 2015. It’ll cost up to $50,000. Please consider making a
donation of any kind. You can even pay for an actual piece of the playground.
Plus, we have a ton of awesome incentives. From an extended cut of our video to personalized social stories and much more, we have a special thank you for everyone who contributes.
We truly appreciate your generosity. And whether you can donate or not, please
help us spread the word. Share our video on Facebook, Twitter, all your
favorite social media sites. Tell family, friends, neighbors and
co-workers. Maybe your company will match your donation. Just keep talking
about it. Together, we’ll make this happen.
Thank you!

story:
I have a vision to share with you...

     Greetings friends! I'm Scott Autrey and I’ve been working with circus performers for over a decade. During this time, as a performer and a promoter, I’ve been blown away by the athleticism, enthusiasm, creativity, and comradery that is so embraced by this community.

    Circus performers flourish in environments that are supportive and offer extensive training, but there’s a huge deficit of these in Alabama. As a result, most performers leave for more performer-friendly cities, leaving Birmingham with a diminishing community of circus professionals! I want to make a home for these circus performers in Alabama, so they will stay in our area and enrich the city with their creative and unique mix of timeless entertainment.



We're bringing the circus to town...

    I’ve spent the last five years building up Birmingham to become an entertainment mecca; having a world-class training facility and a home-grown theatrical circus will help achieve this goal. 

    Circus is everywhere around us. Countless television ads use circus performers as attention-grabbing ways to advertise their products, and events continually hire circus performers to enhance the atmosphere of their events. Millions of people watch online videos of people doing incredible feats every day. We tune into shows like America's Got Talent in order to see people doing amazing things. We are inspired by it. We are wowed by it. Our very lives are enhanced by it. As long as humans are fascinated with and eager to push the boundaries of what the human body is capable of, circus will never go away.

Now we have the unique opportunity to experience the circus in a whole new way...

    Over the past year, I have been writing, sketching, scoring, and drawing the pre-production materials for MIRABILIS: a large scale, immersive, theatrical-fantasy circus experience. MIRABILIS will incorporate storytelling and dream visualization through human movement and circus arts. In order for this show to become a reality, it needs a functional circus space that does not currently exist in Alabama. To meet this need, I am developing the Alabama Center for Circus Arts.

    The Alabama Center for Circus Arts (ACCA) will provide for a multitude of circus needs that are not currently being met in this area, including rehearsal space for local and visiting performers, functional and customizable performance space, and specialized prop retail space. ACCA will offer workshops taught by some of the region’s most talented and respected instructors, as well as teacher trainings and certifications in specific skillsets.

    My dream for ACCA is a grand one, but it's an achievable one. It’s one I believe in, and I think if you can see the vision I see - I think it’s something you will believe in as well.  I’m going to need help creating the ACCA. I need you. You can make the difference.


Are you ready for the adventure?


What Is It?
The ACCA is a professional training facility for circus arts and will include:
• The training gymnasium
• Customized Circus performance space
• A small retail area for purchasing circus props/accessories locally

Who is it for?
• Circus Professionals and Trainers
• Anyone interested in taking circus courses for fun, health, or career
• People of all ages!
• You!

What Will It Offer?
• Rehearsal space for performers and performance troupes.
• Training space
• Circus Arts Workshops
• Circus Fitness Classes
• Community OutReach
• Shows!

Why is it important?
    Birmingham has become a go-to destination for food, touting impressive accolades and rave reviews, but we are so much more. With world class music venues doing their part to bring in more and more music, the ACCA will be doing its part to make this an Entertainment Capital of the south.
• Promotes fitness and health with focused fitness initiatives
• Brings more national and international esteem to Alabama and to Birmingham
• Increases income on an exponential level as interested persons stop leaving the state to take courses elsewhere. This leads to more people coming in to take courses and see shows here.

What We Need

     To get started on our journey we need to raise $272,500. This money covers hard costs and administrative fees, and will enable us to acquire and customize a location, as well as purchase the professional-grade equipment necessary to offer a safe and diverse circus experience.


How You Can Help

     Fiscally, we sincerely appreciate any contribution you can afford. Since we understand it may not always be feasible to give financially, we’re offering a multitude of other ways you can help!

  • Volunteer to help! (i.e., painting, small repairs and alterations, etc.)

  • Donate your expertise! (i.e.,we need help in all areas)

  • Spread the word! (i.e., tell your friends, follow us on Facebook, share our posts,

  • Come to our events – and bring your friends!


What You Get

     We’re offering some pretty cool rewards to people who help us achieve this dream! Here’s what you can get in return for your contribution:

  • Complimentary tickets to ACCA shows

  • Backstage passes to meet the MIRABILIS performers

  • Workshop vouchers so you and your kids can learn circus arts

  • Sweet tax deductions

  • T-shirts, stickers, and other ACCA swag

  • A walk-on role in MIRABILIS (tailored to your individual abilities and comfort level)

  • Circus performance at an event hosted by you!


     On April 3, 1793, America saw its first complete circus performance, and circuses have been giving American audiences jaw-dropping entertainment ever since. Help sustain the circus arts in Alabama so that the next generation can experience that same wild-eyed wonder that you had the very first time you beheld the majesty and fantasy of… the circus.

story:
OUR STORY:

Lentilicious, a deceptively simple complete meal: Red split lentils already blended with exotic herbs and tantalizing spices in perfect balance. Just add water. Cooks in 7 minutes.

Originating in Australia in 2009, we are a company that’s got a spunky brand name and a unique product line.  Lentilicious was created to be “gourmet worthy,” jammed with plant protein, and fantastically tasty, but at an affordable price. Primarily formulated for “camping, gluten-free, vegetarians” somewhere along the way, we realized that Lentilicious truly is a product for our time; healthy for our bodies as well as the planet, and that everyone can benefit from, and enjoy eating Lentilicious.

What are Lentilicious Lentil Meals? 

Red Split Lentils blended with herbs & spices in a pre-packaged bag, ready to cook.

How do you cook Lentilicious meals?

Watch this "kick-ass-ly brilliant video.....
 

 

 

Why Lentilicious Meals?​

 

 

  • Quick & Easy "veg-centric" meals: affordable and quick and portable.
  • The power-packed lentil is both ancient AND awesome.
  • Heaps of health benefits!!!!!!  (...see the graphics).
  • High Protein, High Fiber, 97% Fat Free, GMO Free, High Iron.
  • Embraces all dietary needs, AND helps to keep us "regular."
  • Healthy for the soil AND for our environment.

  • Clean, recognizable ingredients that everyone can spell.

  • Humans on our planet have known about the "fabulous-ness" of lentils for more than 10,000 years.

  • The United Nations is celebrating 2016, as the “International Year of the Pulse" so the entire world can learn about the amazing benefits of lentils, beans and peas. Lentils can help to “Feed the Farm” and “Feed the World” with sustainable food production delivers food security AND “rock-star” nutrition.

 

 

Our Vision

The vision for this campaign is to help any food-insecure college student so that they can focus on their success in the classroom and thrive in their millennial-inspired lives.

Lentilicious is easy to cook, requiring little or no cooking space or skill. This ease of use makes it perfect for dorms, shared kitchens, tiny homes and on collegiate "outdoor adventures."

 We will continue to produce natural, high quality lentil meals that meet the growing consumer demand for quick, easy, cost-effective food and we want to inspire people to seek a healthy lifestyle that leads to a happy life.

We are a fun, yummy, quick, easy, portable, and truly a progress-inspiring millennial product.

Our Connection to College Students

Over the years, our entire team have benefited from exceptional, lifelong connections to universities and college students: For decades, Sonja (Dr. Lil) has taught many college students that she eventually found to be disadvantaged, and hungry.  Both Lisa and Sonja are Penn State alum who have lived and had close interactions with college campuses in Australia, China, and all over the USA; Johnson witnessed his fellow students' latent plight while attending Cal and Stanford; Jamain graduated from Columbia University, clearly witnessing the opulence as well as the potential destitution for students in NYC. 

This year, we have witnessed the national press shed more light on the growing hunger problem and food insecurity on college campuses, highlighting the importance of College and University Food Pantries. This is why we need you and your help.

Can We Do This?

Yes, with your help! We will start small by donating meals to our local college food pantries, then with your support, we will expand our reach across the country.  We already have a solid partnership with UC Berkeley, and we start stocking their food pantry within the next couple of weeks. We also have tentative plans for partnerships with other organizations in the second phase of this campaign. Details will be unveiled with your support.

Whether or not you are able to assist by donating, YOU can help still by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

We want our lentil meals to be available for every food-insecure college student.

 

Rewards

$5 - Monster sized “Thank you!”  

The Lentilicious Ladies will call you live to say "Thank You" for donating a lentil meal to a food insecure college student.  

$25 - Duo Pack (Option 1).

You will receive your very own duo (2) Pack of Lentilicious shipped directly to you anywhere in the USA for FREE.

The Lentilicious Ladies will call you live to say "Thank You" for donating two (2) lentil meals to food insecure college students.  

$40 - Duo Pack (Option 2)  

You will receive your very own duo (2) pack of Lentilicious shipped directly to you anywhere in the USA for FREE!  You will also receive a Lentilicious T-shirt.

The Lentilicious Ladies will call you live to say "Thank you" for donation three (3) of our meals to starving students.

You will get a genuine Lentilicious t-shirt; we’ll obtain your size during the phone call.

$50 - Trio Pack  

You will receive your very own Trio (3) Pack of Lentilicious shipped directly to you anywhere in the USA for FREE.

The Lentilicious Ladies will call you live to say "Thank You" for donating four (4) Lentil meals to starving college students. 

$100 - Six Pack

You will receive six (6) Lentilicious lentil meals of your choice shipped directly to you anywhere in the USA for FREE.  

When the Lentilicious Ladies call you live to say "Thank You" for donating  6 Lentil meals to starving college students.

You will get a genuine Lentilicious t-shirt; we’ll obtain your size during the phone call.

$200 - One Dozen

You will receive a dozen (12) Lentilicious lentil meals of your choice shipped directly to you anywhere in the USA for FREE.  

When the Lentilicious Ladies call you live to say "Thank You" for donating 12 Lentil meals to starving college students. 

You will get two (2) genuine Lentilicious t-shirts; we’ll obtain your size during the phone call.

story: The ETERNITE CARES Team members are notable for their confidence, perseverance, and passion for making the world a better place. You can help the women and youth of Haiti develop these traits today with a gift to the ETETNITE CARES Fund. Your gift makes the difference for all students participating in the ETERNITE CARES iniatives to increase their economic Independence, including 50 students who are attending the Vocational Sewing Training Program. They are getting hands-on experience both on and off the center, thanks to gifts from people like you.

story:
Arbitrage Ed’s mission is to help everyone improve their financial lives through knowledge. We create free financial education materials, and enable you to solidify your knowledge by providing you with or linking you to real-world applications of all our lessons. With your help, we can increase awareness of the need for financial educators, and bring about more companies to our industry who can cater to all preferences, stimulating even more financial literacy!


Check Out Our Lessons

Upcoming Lesson Topics:

1. Private Student Loans         
2. Federal Education Grants   
3. Financial Planning Basics   


The Product:   


We make learning simple by offering everything you need on a single page.


Learn with Short Video Lessons (Rarely over 5 minutes)

Test your comprehension with Practice Questions
 
Apply what you learn with Custom Research Tools

Those three elements compose your lesson page:

                                                                                  

Our Lesson Plans

Our goal is to help individuals become educated on any financial concept they wish. That is why we intend on covering the following topics if you wish it:

 Financial Planning                

 Student Loans                      

Measuring Risk                       

 Asset Allocation                    

 Technical Analysis               

 Quantitative Analysis          

 Equity Securities (Stocks)  

 Debt Securities (Bonds)    

 Commodity Securities         

 Derivative Securities           

 Currency Markets                 

With your help, we can afford to cover each of these thoroughly giving everyone free access to a wealth of essential financial knowledge.


What Your Contribution Will Add

No matter how much you donate, we still want to help you! Financial Literacy is becoming a necessity for having financial security, and regardless of whether you can donate, we believe you deserve access to it.

Contributions will enable us to hire more financial professionals to create world-class video content, and more programmers to create a better website experience. There’s so much more we can provide, and we hope that you can help us create it. You shouldn't have to feel lost when making financial decisions. Rather, let us help you gain the knowledge to navigate your financial life with confidence.


Risks & Challenges

What makes us uniquely qualified to help you is our diversity of financial understanding. Although all our lessons are created by financial professionals, not everyone on the team has a background in finance. This proximity to our intended user base enables us to keep lessons simple enough for everyone to understand. We explain everything clearly rather than skipping important information financial professionals often forget others may not yet know.


We Appreciate Every Ounce of Support!
Please share our mission with your friends and family so that we can help even more people attain free financial literacy!


FAQ

What is the difference between what Arbitrage Ed offers, and what your bank, broker, etc offers?

Banks, and other financial service companies provide educational materials with a conflict of interest. Whenever they create a lesson, they're factoring in the need to increase their sales, and that prevents a lot of good content from being published. Arbitrage Ed doesn't have this conflict of interest, because our main concern is creating free lessons, not making a pretty penny.

How will Arbitrage Ed create an education that I can understand?

We work closely with our users to insure everything is easy to understand. Additionally, every video will have definitions of key words so that you can maximize your understanding of every lesson.

Why is Arbitrage Ed's education free?

You deserve an opportunity to understand how to improve your financial security, and by offering free education we are doing our best to help. To charge you for such an essential education would be cruel, and would honestly break our hearts. 

I already understand Arbitrage Ed's lessons,so when will more complicated videos come out?
Although the first sets of videos will cover fundamentals, we know how frustrating it can be to be limited by basic information. We are constantly developing new beginner, intermediate, and advanced topics so you always have the opportunity to quench your thirst for financial literacy.

If I know nothing about personal finances, is Arbitrage Ed for me?
Most definitely, yes! Our first initiative is to help the personal finance newcomers with learning the basics. If you looked at the infographic you will see how many people need to learn the basics (70% of Americans), which is why we definitely won't skip that step. 

Where should I start my education?

Pick any video topic that sounds appealing and go from there! Thus far, none of our content surpasses foundational. Anything on our website should be helpful for beginners. If it's not, please tell us. In the coming months we will be developing a recommendation engine based on past performance to let you know the best way to proceed.


What do we we mean by "research tools"?

Research tools are what we call the tools we create to enable instant application of a lesson. For example, if you watch one of the Khan Academy videos we've listed on our website you see a CPI Calculator on the lesson page. That calculator allows you to apply your education on inflation to the real-world by letting you test it against inflation data from 1913 to the present.

What are "additional resources"?
At the moment, we don't have the ability to create research tools for every lesson. That's why we created the Additional Resources section- to link you to other websites that allow instant application of lessons. Additionally, it's where we post links to definitions of key words from each lesson.

Why do we have Khan Academy Videos on our website?
Khan Academy created a fantastic series on inflation, and we are still developing our library of video lessons. We are currently seeking funding (from kind people like yourself!) so we can create a vast resource of lessons and research tools, and not use material created by others. Nevertheless, we respect Khan Academy immensely, and constantly refer to them as our inspiration. We perceive hosting their content as an honor.

How frequently do we publish new content?
At the moment, we are doing our best to produce at least two or three videos a week. That's because videos are expensive, and we don't have the manpower to move significantly quicker. Ultimately, once we can afford a video editor, we expect each content creator to produce approximately 10 videos per week, or possibly more.

 Commodity Securities         
 Derivative Securities           
 Currency Markets                 
With your help, we can afford to cover each of these thoroughly giving everyone free access to a wealth of essential financial knowledge.




What Your Contribution Will Add
No matter how much you donate, we still want to help you! Financial Literacy is becoming a necessity for having financial security, and regardless of whether you can donate, we believe you deserve access to it.
Contributions will enable us to hire more financial professionals to create world-class video content, and more programmers to create a better website experience. There’s so much more we can provide, and we hope that you can help us create it. You shouldn't have to feel lost when making financial decisions. Rather, let us help you gain the knowledge to navigate your financial life with confidence.

Risks & Challenges
What makes us uniquely qualified to help you is our diversity of financial understanding. Although all our lessons are created by financial professionals, not everyone on the team has a background in finance. This proximity to our intended user base enables us to keep lessons simple enough for everyone to understand. We explain everything clearly rather than skipping important information financial professionals often forget others may not yet know.
We Appreciate Every Ounce of Support!Please share our mission with your friends and family so that we can help even more people attain free financial literacy!

FAQ
What is the difference between what Arbitrage Ed offers, and what your bank, broker, etc offers?
Banks, and other financial service companies provide educational materials with a conflict of interest. Whenever they create a lesson, they're factoring in the need to increase their sales, and that prevents a lot of good content from being published. Arbitrage Ed doesn't have this conflict of interest, because our main concern is creating free lessons, not making a pretty penny.

How will Arbitrage Ed create an education that I can understand?
We work closely with our users to insure everything is easy to understand. Additionally, every video will have definitions of key words so that you can maximize your understanding of every lesson.

Why is Arbitrage Ed's education free?
You deserve an opportunity to understand how to improve your financial security, and by offering free education we are doing our best to help. To charge you for such an essential education would be cruel, and would honestly break our hearts. 


I already understand Arbitrage Ed's lessons,so when will more complicated videos come out?


Although the first sets of videos will cover fundamentals, we know how frustrating it can be to be limited by basic information. We are constantly developing new beginner, intermediate, and advanced topics so you always have the opportunity to quench your thirst for financial literacy.


If I know nothing about personal finances, is Arbitrage Ed for me?

Most definitely, yes! Our first initiative is to help the personal finance newcomers with learning the basics. If you looked at the infographic you will see how many people need to learn the basics (70% of Americans), which is why we definitely won't skip that step. 


Where should I start my education?

Pick any video topic that sounds appealing and go from there! Thus far, none of our content surpasses foundational. Anything on our website should be helpful for beginners. If it's not, please tell us. In the coming months we will be developing a recommendation engine based on past performance to let you know the best way to proceed.




What do we we mean by "research tools"?
Research tools are what we call the tools we create to enable instant application of a lesson. For example, if you watch one of the Khan Academy videos we've listed on our website you see a CPI Calculator on the lesson page. That calculator allows you to apply your education on inflation to the real-world by letting you test it against inflation data from 1913 to the present.

What are "additional resources"?
At the moment, we don't have the ability to create research tools for every lesson. That's why we created the Additional Resources section- to link you to other websites that allow instant application of lessons. Additionally, it's where we post links to definitions of key words from each lesson.

Why do we have Khan Academy Videos on our website?
Khan Academy created a fantastic series on inflation, and we are still developing our library of video lessons. We are currently seeking funding (from kind people like yourself!) so we can create a vast resource of lessons and research tools, and not use material created by others. Nevertheless, we respect Khan Academy immensely, and constantly refer to them as our inspiration. We perceive hosting their content as an honor.

How frequently do we publish new content?
At the moment, we are doing our best to produce at least two or three videos a week. That's because videos are expensive, and we don't have the manpower to move significantly quicker. Ultimately, once we can afford a video editor, we expect each content creator to produce approximately 10 videos per week, or possibly more.

story:
A Pair Of Happiness:

Thousands of elementary school students across rural Anatolia are facing kilometers long cold and bumpy roads regardless of unfavorable weather conditions just to get an education.

“A pair of happiness” project came to life to provide resistant shoes to low-income students who can't afford a pair of shoes, attending rural schools across Anatolia, where 7000 village roads were closed on January 2015 due to snow.

We are aiming to GIFT a total of 10.000 pairs of resistant shoes to 75 elementary school students in severe need across 33 cities of Anatolia. This project is the first global project aiming to support poor children in Anatolia, therefore it will be a breakthrough if we achieve our goal.

Road Map:

The Need:

Students from 1st to 3rd grade were chosen as our target age group as they are amongst the most vulnerable to harsh weather conditions and long commutes to schools. Children who will be granted with these 10.000 resistant shoes, were already determined by the collaboration of school officials, teachers and local municipalities. We have received physically stamped and signed forms from 75 schools and we categorized them by shoe sizes in a spreadsheet.

The Fund:

By $100.000 pledged funds and via other sources, we will mass produce and deliver 10.000 shoes to 33 cities directly by our team. Photos and videos will be available upon deliveries on www.insaninternational.org/apairofhappiness

The Shoes:

The resistant shoes, feature sturdy soles and are all water-proof. Sections of them up front and in the back were hardened through injection molding to resist deformation. They were designed with velcro straps so that children can easily put them on and off. Straps were strengthened with an additional layer of leather. Inner-lining of the shoes were made from "tartan" fabric that's used in seasonal shoes, which provides sweatproof comfort during the months of Spring.


Each $10 means 1 pair of Shoes. 

Each donor’s name and donation (if he/she accepts) will be listed on project website which will be alive even after the project mission is completed. We will also share the name of the donors to school teachers for them to share and remember.

If we can't reach our goal, the funds will be donated to Insan non-profit organisation to save the lives of 20 children listed in www.insaninternational.org 

Who we are?

The brain team of the project includes:

Kivanc Kilicer: INSAN Non Profit Org. Chairman: Graduated from ITU Faculty of Management with a Management Engineering degree in 2000. He has completed his post graduate studies in Management Information Systems and is continuing his education in ITU Remote Sensing doctorate program. Having worked in managerial and director positions at several leading multinational companies for 10 years, he started his own business on media investment and has been successfully running it for the last five years. Having observed the needs-gap in different parts of the society and consumption habits of individuals at different income levels, he was actively involved with development of the project with the goal of sharing his experience in relativity of the concept of “value”.

Seda Diren: INSAN Non Profit Org. Vice Chairman: Graduated from Kadıköy Anadolu High School in 2005 and from YTÜ Faculty of Architecture with a City and Zone Planning degree in 2009. Currently continuing her studies in YTÜ, FBE City Landscape Organization and Design post graduate program. Having an opportunity to reside in several different cities across Anatolia during her education and observing first hand the condition of education of female students in particular, she was actively involved with development of the project with her motivation to contribute to improving conditions of those girls.

Can Gokceatam: INSAN Non Profit Org. IT Director: Graduated from Bowling Green State University, USA with a Visual Communication Technology degree in 2009. He has completed his internships at Rockwell Automation software department working on user interface and experience and various photography studios in Texas and Colorado. While he has a vast knowledge of many facets of visual communication technology, he has chosen to specialize in photography, web design and programming. Can had vast contribution on the technological part of the project including the setup of one of the first database-run charity sites serving for Anatolia.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing the project video or the project website in social media is invaluable. To make a massive effect, please add your support here:

https://www.thunderclap.it/projects/28445-a-pair-of-happiness

story:
EXPONYMI - EDIBLE EXHIBITION

EXPONYMI will bring to milan the experience of NYC community gardens and rooftop farming. We will build a small pavilion and a vegetable garden as a small prototype of community garden. We will also use the pallets as the structure for the graphic of the exhibition where we will leave many "seeds for the mind" to leave to citizen of Milan and visitors of EXPO2015. Using QR codes we will link the physical structure of the pavillion in Milan to our website where it will be possible to explore the NY urban agriculture practices.



BUDGET

  • In case we won't reach out goal we will still make the installation in Milan.  We designed the pavilion as a modular structure. This allows us to have enough flexibility to adapt the project according to the final funds we will receive. Don't worry your contribution won't get lost in any case. 
  • To thank you for your contribution we set up a series of perks according to the amount you will donate: from stickers, to seeds packages, key chains, t-shirts, and making your name  part of the installation. For the very generous donators we offer the invitation to a private party with the New York team of Exponymi making fresh pizza cooked in brick oven in Brooklyn this summer! 
  • All the names of contributors will be present on our website!

PARTNER IN MILAN

We found the perfect partner and location in Milan for our project.


NYC SUPPORTERS

EXPONYMI is a collective effort to present at the International World Fair the exiting green food practices currently under development in New York city. With a long history in this field, starting in the '70s with community gardens, New York now represents one of the more complex reality in the US and the world. More than 600 community gardens, more than 500 farmer markets and CSA, the bigger rooftop farm in the world. Together with private citizen associations during the years has grown an interesting network of public institutions and  research institutes.
We are in constant communication with the main organizations of NYC, and our project is supported by some of them:


EXPONYMI TEAM

I moved in NY in 2010 as an architect, and quickly I got involved with the urban agriculture particular to the dynamic melting pot that is New York.  First, I was a member of my neighborhood community garden; then I volunteered as architect in realizing some gardens for the non-profit organization Bed-Stuy Campaign Against Hunger.  I was looking for a place to grow my own veggies, but later I started to understand the value of these experiments and practices not only for the creation of a healthier food system, but also for education and the creation of community.  

EXPONYMI is born this winter from my desire to combine my experiences in New York and the unique opportunity of having the International World Fair in my hometown Milan in Italy. Since then our team has kept growing and now we have 2 sister teams in Milan and New York dedicated to this project.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We are looking for volunteers who will help us in this exiting project. We need web and graphic designers in New York and architects or students to realize the installation in Milan under the my direction. 
  • Help us sharing this campaign through all you social media connections. Spread the voice and make stronger the great green communities of New York City

story:
What Is Notum

Notum is a project that seeks to promote new forms of communication and cooperation among reporters, newspapers and independent companies interested in spreading and improving information, through a thoughtfully designed platform that will make the process easy and accessible to everybody.

We believe technology could help newspapers and alternative media afford top-tier original stories, while at the same time allowing journalists, photo- and video-reporters to make a living out of their passion.

In 2004 Philip Meyer, Professor emeritus of Journalism and pioneer of data journalism, made headlines for his ominous predictions about journalism. Notum’s ultimate goal is to reverse this downward trend and lead the way in the new generation of journalism that Meyer himself looks forward to welcome.

What We're Asking & Why

We thought about it, and we decided to ask for £ 60'000, which is exactly what we need to start our journey knowing we can last for at least one year before being fully able to take care of ourselves. We need:

  • Research & Development – realizing Notum online platform, where reporters, newspapers and independent companies will interact, will cost: £ 10'000;
  • Reporters – finding, keeping and cultivating quality reporters from all over the world (we hope to have at least 10 full-time reporters during our first year) will cost: £ 20'000;
  • Staff – to ensure quality contents, smooth and easy experience with both our services and our platform, and continuous satisfaction and growth of our reporters, we need: £ 10'000;
  • Startup costs – we've obviously been having a lots of 'startup' expenses, which we tried to cover with our own savings, but we were unable to afford all the legal help we need to make sure we can offer the best servie possible, and to do that we need: £ 20'000.

If you decide to contribute to our project, we know you are probably not doing it for the perks, but rather because you share our hopes and ambitions and want to help us make the world a better-informed place. That's why we like to think of these perks as ways to help you keep your Notum enthusiasm going!

Don't forget to keep checking this page as well as our social profiles (Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Google+) to discover what other perks and initiatives we are planning for you during our 30 days on Indiegogo!

Why Notum

This project not only channels our disappointment as readers and viewers, but also – and more importanly – draws from everyday experience and problems of both reporters and the newspaper and information industry. During our University years in Pavia, we met so many talented young reporters trying to get paid (at all) by the newspapers commissioning them, or just trying to save local and University newspapers from shutting down; at the same time we came across 'big' publishers who couldn't keep up with the constant changes in the field (especially technology-wise) and had to drastically trim their editorial staff to keep afloat.

We know we're not the first to try and address this problem, but no-one ever proposed a solution like Notum before, and everytime we've shared our idea with someone in the field, they've been esthatic about it! We only founded the company a little over a month ago, and the platform is set to be out (thanks in advance to all supporters who are making it happen!) in August, so we didn't think we would receive any commission until then; but the response from both reporters – who can't wait to 'be the first to join the Notum challenge' – and newspapers / companies was so positive that we decided to give it a try, and find out how Notum would do in real life!

We decided our first commission (since it was 'promotional', we didn't actually take any revenue from our client) would be the coverage of a cultural event at the University of Pavia, Italy; our client, the organizer, was one of our early supporters, along with the University, and the event was about the importance of new and more ethical solutions in economics and politics, a theme quite in line with our own values!

Along with the video reportage of the event and interviews to speakers, we arranged a live streaming to give online viewers the opportunity to interact with speakers and ask questions, and the whole event was an incredible success: we received amazing feedback from the client (who says he will definitely use our platform once it's active) and several participants, and this was exactly what we needed in order to start our Indiegogo campaign with the right energy and confidence!


Notum staff members are currently scattered across Europe, which has made us really good at distance work and at setting goals and deadlines (and sticking to them). Through our social profiles (Twitter, Instagram, Google+ and Facebook), we will keep our supporters regularly updated on what we're working on and where their money is going, and we look forward to interacting with you to come up with ways to further improve and promote Notum.

For those who have the financial means to contribute more, you will be able to explore Notum even further by accessing all contents on our platform for one (Notum explorer) or six months (Notum hero). Also, we have exciting additional perks in mind, and hopefully we'll be able to share them with you soon...

Risks & Challenges

Despite the positive feedback and the meticulous attention we put into this project, we know success is never to be taken for granted. Our biggest challenge will be getting people aware and involved, as even the most perfectly-engineered platform can do very little if it has no users to populate it.

That's why we came up with a few initiatives that we will share with you over the course of the  campaign and that will help spread the Notum virus across the web. Who will get to access Notum platform in beta and who will have to wait a whole month to explore it?

Keep checking our Indiegogo campaign and social pages to learn about new Notum initiatives as soon as they come out, and if you have suggestions on how to get more people involved don't forget to share them with us for a chance to win free access to all stories on Notum!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love the project but don't have the financial means to contribute, don't worry – no-one could understand you better than us!

Luckily, Notum needs visibility and enthusiastic people just as much as it needs funding, so spread the word with your friends, relatives, colleagues, professors, students, annoying neighboors, favorite waiters/waitresses, you name it!

Also, we love receiving feedback and believe it is another great – and often under underrated – way to help, so if you have comments – both good and bad – please don't keep them to yourself, we can't wait to hear what you have to say!

story:
Your support for the Collegiate Mentoring Program has the power to matriculate high-achieving, underprivileged youth into college. You can help narrow the gap in U.S. education access and build strong socioeconomic diversity in the U.S. higher education system.

Currently led by Jennifer Tran (Trinity College '17) and Uyanga Battulga (Brown University '19), The Collegiate Mentoring Program is a virtual mentoring program that matches high-achieving, underprivileged mentees with a volunteer undergraduate mentor who can guide them through the college admissions process. 

Thus far, we have successfully placed more than 100 high-achieving, low-income students in colleges like Harvard, Yale, Columbia, and Stanford, Williams, and Trinity. In the past two years, we have expanded our international presence, drawing mentors and mentees from the U.S., Mongolia, Canada, Brazil, Ghana, Mexico, Singapore, Pakistan, South Korea, and Israel. 

We are not yet non-profit, but we hope that your contribution will help us continue with our work. We currently are in need of funds to:

  • Support our college admissions resources website at The Collegiate Blog.
  • Start the IRS application process for non-profit status.
  • Provide marketing materials to recruit volunteer mentors.
  • Offer merit scholarship support to our 40 mentees for costs, including transportation, laundry, books, and laptop, that are not covered by financial aid and college sponsored scholarships.
  • Provide our staff and mentors the opportunity to attend college access conferences to expand our skills and networks.

Our cohort of about 40 mentees are motivated low-income students who are the first in their families to go to college and come from environments where college is not encouraged. For many mentees, the mentoring program is their only support system for the college admissions process. Our volunteer undergraduate mentors walk our mentees through the college admissions process over Skype, email, phone, and other technologies.  Mentors fill in the gaps that counselors, families, and friends cannot.

Despite our mentees' brilliance, talent, and motivation, the odds are stacked against them. According to Stanford educational economist Caroline Hoxby, the vast majority of high-achieving low-income students to do not even apply to a single top college. Your support enables us to help these students realize their full academic potential.
story_txt:
Your support for the Collegiate Mentoring Program has the power to matriculate high-achieving, underprivileged youth into college. You can help narrow the gap in U.S. education access and build strong socioeconomic diversity in the U.S. higher education system.Currently led by Jennifer Tran (Trinity College '17) and Uyanga Battulga (Brown University '19), The Collegiate Mentoring Program is a virtual mentoring program that matches high-achieving, underprivileged mentees with a volunteer undergraduate mentor who can guide them through the college admissions process. Thus far, we have successfully placed more than 100 high-achieving, low-income students in colleges like Harvard, Yale, Columbia, and Stanford, Williams, and Trinity. In the past two years, we have expanded our international presence, drawing mentors and mentees from the U.S., Mongolia, Canada, Brazil, Ghana, Mexico, Singapore, Pakistan, South Korea, and Israel. We are not yet non-profit, but we hope that your contribution will help us continue with our work. We currently are in need of funds to:
Support our college admissions resources website at The Collegiate Blog.
Start the IRS application process for non-profit status.
Provide marketing materials to recruit volunteer mentors.
Offer merit scholarship support to our 40 mentees for costs, including transportation, laundry, books, and laptop, that are not covered by financial aid and college sponsored scholarships.
Provide our staff and mentors the opportunity to attend college access conferences to expand our skills and networks.
Our cohort of about 40 mentees are motivated low-income students who are the first in their families to go to college and come from environments where college is not encouraged. For many mentees, the mentoring program is their only support system for the college admissions process. Our volunteer undergraduate mentors walk our mentees through the college admissions process over Skype, email, phone, and other technologies.  Mentors fill in the gaps that counselors, families, and friends cannot.Despite our mentees' brilliance, talent, and motivation, the odds are stacked against them. According to Stanford educational economist Caroline Hoxby, the vast majority of high-achieving low-income students to do not even apply to a single top college. Your support enables us to help these students realize their full academic potential.

story:
Creating Deaf Yoga Teachers

Since 2008 the DeafYoga Foundation (DYF) has organized volunteer sign language interpreters for the Sivananda Yoga Teacher Training Course in upstate New York. To date, 21 Deaf and Hard of Hearing yogis have graduated from this course and 3 Deaf students are participating this June 2015!

This is the only yoga teacher training offered in American Sign Language (ASL). 

DYF is fundraising to pay for the volunteer interpreter's travel and hopefully a small daily stipend ($50 per day) for their time and efforts.

This course can only happen with a team of volunteers as it runs consecutively for 30 days, following traditional monastic schedule 6am - 10pm. There needs to be 3-5 interpreters per day who are willing to offer their services in exchange for this unique experience and room & board.

We need your help to recruit more interpreters!

By donating to our cause, we will be able to secure ASL interpretation for 3 Deaf yogis who desire to become yoga teachers by offering the interpreters paid travel arrangements and a small stipend of $50 per day.

Course Details: 3 Deaf to take TTC 2015

Here's a quick summary of our program and needs:

  • DeafYoga Foundation is a 100% volunteer-based 501c3 nonprofit organization.
  • Since 2008 DYF has been interpreting the Sivananda Yoga Teacher Training Course TTC into ASL.
  • 21 Deaf people have graduated from this course TTC & are yoga teachers.
  • 3 Deaf yogis are participating in this year's TTC May 31- June 28, 2015.
  • 15-20 interpreters are needed throughout this month-long training. To date, we only have 5 signed up to volunteer. That means we need funds to help offer interpreters financial support.
  •  60+ interpreters have volunteered their time and travel expenses previously. This year we are fundraising in order to offer something back to the interpreters.
  • There are said to be some 30 million Deaf and Hard of Hearing people in the U.S. alone, and there are less than 30 Deaf yoga teachers to serve this large community.

Funding Details: 100% allocated to Interpreters

We promise to allocate 100% of the funds directly to the TTC ASL interpreters!

$50/day x 4 interpreters per day = $200 total stipend per day

$200 per day stipend x 30 days = $6000

$100 towards travel x 13 interpreters = $1,300
     2015 Interpreters from New York, Mass, Illinois, N Carolina, Ohio, & California

TOTAL = $7,300

The Impact

Your contribution matters towards being a part of the growing number of Deaf Yoga instructors in the U.S..

  • By donating today, you are assisting our efforts in securing qualified and available sign language interpreters for the Sivananda yoga teacher training course. We already have 3 Deaf students signed up, but only 5 interpreters right now. So we need funds to get more interpreters!!  :)
  • By donating, you are assisting 13-15 people to become a part of history, by volunteering time to interpret the only yoga TT offered in ASL.
  • You know the impact yoga has on the body, mind and spirit. The more Deaf yoga teachers out there, the more access Deaf people across the planet will have access to Yoga...and that's a win-win situation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Wish to contribute in ways besides financially? Please share our information below and we will be just as grateful!

  • "Share" our need for ASL interpreters in your social media channels. Have them visit deafyoga.org for more information.
  • "Share" and encourage your social networks to donate and help to fundraise for our campaign. Remember, its a way to give back to a volunteer who is creating access for a Deaf person to become a yoga teacher. 
  • HOW GREAT IS ALL THIS?!?!!    :)
Thank you for your consideration and your possible donation!
We are deeply grateful for you and your contributions!!

story:
I am a recent BSc psychology graduate from Durham University, UK. My dream is to become a neuroscientist (very biologically-minded scientist dealing with how the brain and body work in contribution to cognition).

This February, I was accepted to King's College London, UK, to one of the best MSc Neuroscience programmes in the country. However, I don't have the money to pay my tuition fees (£9,960) for a course starting this September. I am in the process of deferring my course offer for financial reasons (related also to some family problems, with my parents bordering on divorce) but even starting the process has proven simply heartbreaking because this course is a dream of mine: it encompasses all the knowledge foundations not covered by my BSc course and a possibility to move from more behavioural to more laboratory science which is my dream (for more details, consult the KCL Neurosci programme website).

I would like to raise £11,000 so that it would cover the Indiegogo fees, so that I could pay for additional checks required by my university, related to working in the laboratory, and for travelling expenses related to travelling from Poland to London and spending some time in London at the start when setting up all the matters related to starting my course. Any money over the £9,960 would basically go towards helping me become fairly independent in London asap, given how expensive this place is.

How do you know I wouldn't spend all this money on partying in Camberwell and is there any proof that I am really dedicated? Well, I started helping with research in year 1 of university (explaining to people the details of a study for a PhD student at Durham University, and recruiting participants), then I conducted a study for Dr D Sanderson, a neuroscientist at Durham, and then, this year, I completed a dissertation on how brain asymmetries relate to verbal intelligence (language ability), and it got a mark of 75%. I worked hard not only to get more well-rounded with research, but also to learn how to express it better. I completed multiple extracurricular courses at Durham on academic writing. I was a finalist of the competition Undergraduate Awards for best course work in two categories last year (Philosophy, on an essay in philosophy of science, and Psychology). On top of it, to see how being a scientist among other scientists works in real life, this June I made it to Milan, Italy, to give my first paper presentation (on body perception) at an international conference Fashion Tales (see the conference website, I am in the programme under no. 36, Ada P. Kepinska), funded by a travel grant from my alma mater college.

Feel free to contact me with any questions (at my e-mail, adrianna.kepinska@gmail.com, or via my LinkedIn). Thank you kindly!
