story:
The Limerick Spring Festival of Politics and Ideas celebrates the role of the citizen in the political life of Limerick and beyond. To celebrate the 100 year anniversary of the Easter Rising  the theme of the Limerick Spring 2016 will be ‘State of Us’.  We have planned a series of events that both remembers and celebrates the principles enshrined in the 1916 proclamation but also questions-whether these are the values that are important to us in 2016 and whether we can imagine what the responsibilities of the citizen are in ensuring that the vision is fully realised over the next 100 years.

The first year of the festival, part of Limerick City of Culture 2014, was a huge success with high levels of participation and support from the citizens of Limerick and beyond. 

We are really excited to bring you our programme for 2016, from film screenings, big debates, protest music and spoken word to theatre, art and comedy events and conversation. There is truly something for everyone. This is Ireland’s only Festival of Politics & Ideas so make sure you have your say!

Why Fund Us?

We are a group of interested citizens, non party political and feel passionately that 'we the people' must become active in shaping the future of our city, county and planet. We are all volunteers and are working in our spare time to make this festival a reality. We need your support to make it work! 

We believe that crowd funding is the most transparent and honest way to fund The Limerick Spring and this is why are calling for your help to develop this festival into an annual event that Limerick and Ireland can be proud of.

Your contribution will go directly to funding the cost of putting on this festival while also allowing the opportunity to purchase your tickets online.

We have amazing in kind support from local businesses and volunteers. We have received some funding from the Limerick Commemoration Committee allowing us to keep more than half of our events free.  But we also need funding in order to pay for accommodation, printing, photography, hosting our guest speakers and recording the festival. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding in advance of the festival to ensure that we can provide for our guests and plan for the festival properly. 

We need to raise €2000. In short, we are asking you to be our investors! To invest in The Limerick Spring and help us to make it a reality. 

These are the options:

Level 1: €10 euros donation gets you a thank you and a lovely Limerick Spring tote bag

Level 2: €15 donation gets you a Saturday All Day Pass plus a tote bag

Level 3: €30 donation gets you a weekend pass.

Level 4: €50 donation gets you a weekend pass and a SUPER SUPPORTER tote bag, State of Us T-shirt and a major thank you from the volunteer committee on our festival website. 

Level 5: €100.00 donation gets you  2 x festival weekender tickets plus tote bags, State of Us t-shirts.  You also get a big thank you on our web site and social media. 

Level 6. €300.00 donation gets you 4x festival weekender tickets plus tote bags and State of Us T-Shirts, brunch passes and a major thank you on our web site and social media. 

All funds collected on this campaign will go directly to The Limerick Spring. Should we not reach our target we will still get what we have raised. Your money will definitely be collected and used very wisely to enure that the events we can afford to run will take place. 

All our funding /accounts will be available at our AGM later this year and will be open to public scrutiny. 

What impact will The Limerick Spring have?

If our festival inspires you to take part in democracy or think how you can effect change locally, nationally & globally then it has worked!

Risks & Challenges

We are delighted to have received some funding from the Limerick Commemoration Committee but it will not be enough to cover our full costs. We believe that crowd funding and tickets selling in advance is a positive and transparent way of developing this festival. 

If we don't raise the funds we need we won't be able to invite the international guests we hope to attract.

Our overall aim is to make this the gold standard of citizen led politics festivals in Ireland. Your funding will help us to build our reputation and to develop our brand, capacity and reputation as a festival not to be missed!

Should The Limerick Spring become a success it will be another positive story for Limerick and will hopefully inspire other towns and cities to put on their own local events that engage people in politics in ways that are fresh, fun and inspiring. 

Don't worry if you have no money!

More than half of our events are free and if you want to volunteer your time or energy instead you can talk to us too. 

Please do share our festival campaign with your friends and family and let's aim to work together to make The Limerick Spring - Festival of Politics and Ideas happen in 2016!

story:
Short Summary

The third Annual Dia De Los Muertos Carpinteria Festival 2016 consists of a month of Youth Arts Outreach followed by a 3 day community Festival. All events are free and for the entire family. Youth Arts Outreach participants are Canalino School, Family School, Rincon High School, Carpinteria High School, Boys & Girls Club, Girls Inc. and People's Self Help Housing in partnership with Bellas Artes. Students will work hands on with artist in residence, Carlos Cuellar and several other artists creating floats, murals, life size papier mache Calaveras and Altars for the Closing Celebration and Parade. We served approx. 500 Carpinteria youth for our first event in 2014 and each year we have grown.

New this year we will be working with several after school programs from Santa Barbara. Also new is an international component collaborating with artists from Mexico and Peru. 

PROMOTIONAL VIDEO LINK - https://youtu.be/0k9QKqBoZR4

The three day Festival will be held on October 28, 29 and 30th, 2016 and  includes "Meet Our Artists Kick Off Party" showcasing many artists'  work on Friday evening. On Saturday, October, 29th, an Aztec Dance Troupe will give a presentation on the history of Dia De Los Muertos and a ceremonial performance at noon on the beach and there will be an afternoon of arts and crafts at the Carpinteria Arts Center. Sunday, October 30th there will be a parade and Closing Celebration at the Carpinteria Arts Center. 

Please join in helping to support by being a part of our wonderful small town  "community" with whatever you can to support this cultural artistic family, community event!!!

Our Committee -

Lisa Thomas - Founder/Director, Educator, Event Coordinator, Artist

Carlos Cuellar -Associate Director ,Artist in Residence , Summer Solstice

Benjamin Aparicio - Director of Aztec Dance Group, DDLM Historian

Riccardo Morrison - Artistic Director of Summer Solstice Parade, Educator, Dancer

Susan Meismer - Board of Directors Carpinteria Art Center, Artist, Educator

Kathleen Ford - Founder / Director of Bellas Artes  

Iver Petersen - Community Liaison and Advocate

Candace White - Board of Directors Santa Barbara Mariachi Festival

Cesar Trujillo - Dancer for Aztec Dance Group, DDLM Historian

Kiona Gross - Carp Chamber of Commerce, Women’s Board, Carp Sea Glass Festival

Suzan Duval - Artist, Educator

Desiree Miceli Fegette - Artist, Educator

Lark Bateau - Director of the Children’s Festival Summer Solstice, Dancer, Educator

Diane Stevenette - Muralist, Installation Artist, Educator, Artist - Summer Solstice

Le Anne Iverson -  Owner / Director Woods Art Studio, Artist, Educator

The  project is made possible through the Community Enrichment Grant (CAE) made possible through a partnership with Arts Commission the Santa Barbara Bowl Foundation and its Education Outreach Committee. Our Partners - Carpinteria Arts Center, Santa Barbara Summer Solstice Celebration, Bellas Artes, Giovanni’s Carpinteria, Delgado’s, Bellas Artes, Reynaldo's and The Woods Art Studio.

With your contribution we can purchase / fund;

 1. Materials for the month long Arts Outreach to hundreds of children and youth  in the Carpinteria Valley. 

2. Staff stipends for ongoing free workshops with materials available for families & individuals of the community to make a costume, build a papier mache Calavera or mask for the parade.

3. Provide stipends for musicians for the Closing Celebration.

4. Provide artist stipends for the presenters and dancers for the month long Youth
Arts Outreach and Closing Celebration. 

Impact 

  •  I have seen the power of the arts to bring people and communities together. I have been a Social Worker for children in foster care, the director of positive youth development for the Channel islands YMCA, and an expressive arts therapist. 
  • My hands on work and experience with the Santa Barbara Summer Solstice Parade and Celebration has provided Dia De Los Muertos Carpinteria with several highly qualified and experienced staff from the Solstice parade to our event each year and they serve on our committee.
Other Ways You Can Help

Volunteer!

Provide stipends for musicians for the Closing Celebration.4. Provide artist stipends for the presenters and dancers for the month long Youth Arts Outreach and Closing Celebration. Impact 
  I have seen the power of the arts to bring people and communities together. I have been a Social Worker for children in foster care, the director of positive youth development for the Channel islands YMCA, and an expressive arts therapist. 
My hands on work and experience with the Santa Barbara Summer Solstice Parade and Celebration has provided Dia De Los Muertos Carpinteria with several highly qualified and experienced staff from the Solstice parade to our event each year and they serve on our committee.   Other Ways You Can Help Volunteer!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brian, I am the father of two sweet little girls and a husband to a wonderfully strong woman who is my constant inspiration and anchor.

The election loss to Donald Trump has been difficult for so many us because it was fundamentally about moral values as Americans.

Like many of you, we believe there is great strength in American values like diversity, compassion, truth, honesty, hard work, tolerance, science and love.

And like many of you we view Donald Trump clearly as a man with a bankrupt set of moral values very much like his failed and bankrupt businesses.

So we came up with an expression and logo that anyone can display in support of our American values which are in clear opposition to President Elect Trump.

Your contributions will fund the first phase of this project that will allow us to spread our message by manufacturing T-shirts, protest and yard signs, buttons and decals,  anything that can be publicly displayed and will remind us that we are a community that rejects the deplorable moral values of Donald Trump and his presidency.

Road-map to Activism - We will also begin building a road map to activism to oppose the the Trump Administration.  Our goals will be to partner with other National movements that are defining small local activist groups across the country to aggressively influence  their Members of Congress(MOC).

The Logo

The logo is a satire showing the orange head and comb-over hair which personifies Trumps vanity.  The message "Not My Values" indicts Donald Trump as having values that are in complete contrast to our American Values.

What We Need & What You Get

If we can raise $15,000 we can manufacture various sizes of T-shirts , protest and yard signs, buttons, car magnets and decals.  Anything that can be visible and will remind us that we are a community that rejects the deplorable moral values of Donald Trump and his presidency.

Our Top 5 requests for new products that we want to build are: Yard Signs, T-shirts, Interior Static Cling(outward facing), Car Magnets, and Rally Signs.

We have several "perk" levels for those would would like to receive printed goods back so that you too can show your opposition to Trump's values.

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use the proceeds to get as many products manufactured with the funds that were accumulated.

The Impact

It is our hope that when others see this message, it empowers them in an everyday way to create awareness and support for a safer and saner community for all of us, especially for those who may be fearful or who may suffer under a Trump Administration.  

If successful, we will use some of the profits to support those causes that are most in jeopardy under a Trump administration like The ACLU, The Environmental Defense Fund, Planned Parenthood, Glad and Everytown. 

Past Experience 

In the 6 months prior to the election, we created a similar, but smaller scale project called Stop the Donald, stddonald.com,  with a message comparing Donald Trump’s rhetoric to a spreading disease that was infecting America.   We had so many thankful supporters who told us we were making a difference with this past message, so we are making every effort to build on this sentiment.  We have the experience, website and road-map, just not the funding.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute with a donation, we completely understand, but if you still want to support our message, please share this campaign madly using the share links right below the Campaign Title on this page.

 It is fact that we are the majority, and if we stay true to our values we can never be defeated.

story:
Hello, and thanks for visiting our campaign page! We are Emerging African Entrepreneurs (EAE), a social enterprise based in Vancouver and Kampala, the capital of Uganda. We work with people in the informal economy as they build their entrepreneurship skills, develop their businesses and break out of subsistence level poverty. 
 


 

Action Plan:

May 24th, Founder, Orianna Lacey will be flying down to be in Kampala and sorrounding rural areas - with her team of volunteers for five weeks. We will be meeting with key players in the entrepreneur industry in microfunfing, mobile companies, inspirational speakers, and other highly influential industry disruptors. During that time, we will tour churches and schools to help light up the eyes and hearts of potential youth entrepreneurs. Furthermore, we will be building partnerships between local micro-businesses and we will also offer micro financing to as many micro businesses who show potential and passion. The EAE team is currently in the final stages of building the teaching and business partnership building itinerary in Uganda and Kenya - when we have a set itinerary - you will be the first to know! 

 

Our Mission: 

Promote collaboration, sharing of ideas and resources amongst the 52,6% of the African population who are self employed, cultivating a network of people working with a common set of values and approaches, equipped with the skills required to succeed in a small business. 

Partner with as many local entrepreneurs in business, contributing our skills in marketing and business to theirs, creating employment, improving household incomes and generating EAE funding.

Our Vision:

Launched in February 2017, our strategic goals is to be 100% self-funded by the end of 2 years. We will do this by narrowing our focus to developing strategic partnerships with entrepreneurs in the following countries:  Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya countries. Repayments will refuel our working capital, which will in turn provide us with the abilities to fund bigger, more audacious projects that can provide even more job opportunities to local Africans.

 

 

We need to raise $7500 in order to develop our entrepreneurship program and support emerging African micro businesses, to develop our School Program, and to expand our Business Partnership Program. I understand that you may be donating to a bunch of charities and you may be just plain tired of people stopping you in the street and asking you for a life-long contribution. We promise that we are worth the second look and by offering a one-off donation you will be offering an African Entrepreneur the opportunity to do what they love and be able to actually make a living for them and their families. The buck does not stop with your contribution, we will continue to send you updates and let you know exactly what kind of impact you have had.

 

 

Uganda and much of Africa yield a similar demographic pyramid with a bulk of the population  being youth. Quality education is required to accelerate the country’s socio-economic development through making the young population functionally literate and productive.  
 

 

 

Self employment constitutes 45.6% of employment for men and 60.9% of employment for women between the ages of 14 and 64 years of age. The average lifespan in Africa is 60 - 64 years.  Teaching entrepreneur skills is what the people asked for during our research of the informal sector. Your contribution will help prop up the foundations of this emerging new model of international social development work. 
 


 

Africa’s education crisis seldom makes media headlines or socio economic summit agendas and this needs to change. With > 68% of the population hovering at a primary education or below, progress towards universal enriched primary and secondary education has come to a dead standstill. It is up to our young, fresh-faced, knowledgeable team members at Emerging African Entrepreneurs to change that! #TheEntrepreneurGivingEffect

 

 

Africa is changing faster and more furiously than anyone imagined. Africans are eager to rise to the occasion and take their seat in business and a clean government. They deserve a place at the table, and increasingly they are getting one. A new nickname is starting to catch on for Africa: the "mobile continent" with researchers predicting internet use on mobile phones will increase 20-fold in the next five years – double the rate of growth in the rest of the world. Why is this happening? It is because smart phones have replaced the computers in informal economies. Laptops are a luxury that only a sliver of the population has access to, while smart phones enable Africans to engage to further specialised education, business development, collaboration of ideas with a wider audience, and marketing and co-branding through social media platforms. What does this mean to Emerging African Entrepreneurs? It means that now, more than ever, creating an online presence, even one as simple as a Facebook page is now accessible to more Africans. 

 

 

With such incredible potential and your ability to help thousands of struggling entrepreneurs bring their ideas to market and support their families, how can you possible say no!
But keep reading! We are just getting started!

 



 

 

1) Building Strategic Local Partnerships


One of our founding principals in building a social enterprise is the importance of building local partnerships.Partnerships may be formal or informal, involve networking or detailed relationship-building, and create grass-roots relationships and/or strategic alliances. Developing partnerships is critical to the success of any community initiative.  We already have a local team members developing strategic partnerships at the grass roots level.  Partnership will provide both an improved income for our business partners as well as an income stream for our program.

 

2) Community Training & Outreach 

 

Our values include local ownership of change, using funds responsibly, and working with long-term sustainability in mind. Our vision is to build a creative and powerful informal economy, filled with people that are equipped with the knowledge, the skills, and the money to succeed in their micro businesses. After consulting with local micro entrepreneurs, marketing/business development, business planning, financial skills and affordable microfinance as their barriers to success. acilitate knowledge sharing, networking and collaboration in business. Our mission is to be the hub of micro business in Uganda and East AFrica, creating an uproar of entrepreneurship.

 

  
 

The team behind Emerging Entrepreneurs have the passion and experience needed to understand the complex nature of informal economies, business resources, and minimal finances and we know how to get things done! We are all so committed to creating real and lasting impact. When this campaign ends, we don't just go back to our day jobs. A slice of each and every day will always go towards Emerging African Entrepreneurs.  


         

Orianna Lacey
(Founder & Business Program Designer and Facilitator)

Orianna has worked in the marketing and business sector for the last 10 years on digital campaigns, design, social responsibility, leadership training, micro financing programs and resource fundraising. This project has a been a dream for Orianna for years.

                                

 

          

Hanif Rehemtulla
(Uganda Grassroots Program Facilitator) 

Hanif has owned and operated Yujo Izakaya, a very successful Japanese Fusion restaurant in Kampala, Uganda. He offers us his in depth knowledge of informal economies, connections with critical change makers, a Grassroots team in Uganda to work and countless hours of enthusiasm and solutions for which we are eternally grateful. 

 

 

Hendrik Berns

(Partnership Growth & Community Manager)

Hendrik is a student from Germany, who applies and amplifies his knowledge in digital campaigns, social responsibility, design, and resource fundraising. He is passionate about supporting Emerging African Entrepreneurs.

 


 

Our work to date, with minimal funding, has enabled entrepreneur programs to carefully designed to suit inform market place and emerging economies with little to no access to computers, government grants, or bank of mom and dad (or mom and mom in my case). With our help, we intend to help micro businesses and small businesses increase sales, triple profits and hire new staff. It has also enabled. But all of this is just the beginning. We know our approach works because we've tested it, and we are ready to expand our entrepreneur classes, increase our micro loans and broaden our reach. But we need you help.

 

As aid budgets shrink and with donor countries' increasing unwillingness to prioritise the needs of the global poor, social enterprise offers an exciting and financially viable alternative. It is social enterprises like Emerging African Entrepreneurs that offer students of life and entrepreneurial-minded folks like yourself a relevant and worthy cause to reinvest your hard earned dollars into and watch grow into a thriving entrepreneur or community project that supports small and micro businesses in Africa. 

We pride ourselves on our transparency and will send you an email, showing you and telling you exactly where your contribution has really made a difference. If you donate $50 and pay for 37% of a loom so an Emerging African Entrepreneur can produce her sweaters, we will send you a photo of the project and information about the costs of a loom and a bit about the entrepreneurs background. It you choose to donate a 'I believe in you' entrepreneur package: one landing page + one all-day workshop + $20/month for one year 

We're a young, energetic and nimble social enterprise with the passion and the skills required to succeed. Come and join as we pass by milestones and look to the future. 

 

 

Long after this campaign has ended, your generous donations will still be sustaining the micro entrepreneurs you have supported. We will post on our social media regularly and help you stay connected with the projects you are funding and other donors if you wish to join our community!

 

     
 

Wow! We are so grateful that you have made it this far! Thank you! We know very well that sometimes, no matter how amazing the cause and how badly you would like to donate - you just can't. If you think that Emerging African Entrepreneurs looks like a gamer changer, but cannot spare $3.50,  could you possible invest a wee bit of time into:
 

Sharing this page on Facebook and Twitter

Liking and sharing our Facebook page 

Inviting all of your friends and family to like our Facebook page [pretty please]

story:
Un poco de historia

El Trío Nueva Colombia es considerado por expertos como punto de quiebre en la música colombiana de la región andina, y como referente ineludible en la historia musical del país. Desde su creación hace 30 años, ha estado integrado por Germán Darío Pérez Salazar en el piano, arreglos, composición y dirección, Ricardo Pedraza Medina en el Tiple  (cordófono típico colombiano) y Mauricio Acosta Avellaneda en el Contrabajo. Son innumerables los conciertos que han ofrecido en más de 15 países de Europa y América a lo largo de su carrera artística. Su director ha recibido en repetidas oportunidades homenajes en vida, como uno de los músicos más destacados de la música colombiana de la región andina. Su obra compositiva ha sido ampliamente premiada, alcanzando a la fecha 23 primeros puestos en composición en los más importantes certámenes y festivales del género. 4 de estas obras premiadas están incluidas en el presente trabajo discográfico. Otras más fueron escritas especialmente para este proyecto por su director, y otras son bellas obras de grandes compositores colombianos, como Adolfo Mejía, León Cardona, Francisco Cristancho, Jesús Alberto Rey y Santiago Medina. En total el disco consta de 15 cortes.

El Sello Hoot/Wisdom Recordings de  “Florida Atlantic University”de Boca Ratón, Florida EEUU, escogió este proyecto musical para apoyar todo el proceso de grabación, edición, mezcla y masterización. Allí el trío pudo contar con los mejores equipos posibles, un piano incomparable, pero sobre todo, un equipo de colaboradores comprometidos y del más alto nivel humano y técnico, además de muy talentosos a nivel musical, encabezado por Alejandro Sánchez-Samper, profesor asociado de la universidad. Cada detalle se tuvo en cuenta y el Master es una pieza realmente impecable. Estamos seguros de tener hoy en nuestras manos, listo para prensaje (copias) un trabajo cuidadoso, delicado, pulcro y de un altísimo nivel musical.   Con este nuevo album, los melómanos de todo el mundo se podrán acercar con deleite a las músicas de la región andina colombiana, ya que la propuesta presentada es muy colombiana, y al mismo tiempo muy universal.

Background

Piano, Tiple (typical Colombian chordophone), and Contrabass; an interesting format in Andean Colombian music. The resulting sound mixes a classical, jazzistic, and universal flavor of the piano and the contrabass, with the ancestral and very Colombian Tiple, a sound that reinforces the essence of the music interpreted in an academic and modern way, but with a prominent Colombian flavor.

A new music for Colombia, a new sound; a new look at the traditional rhythms of the Andean region, sustained with coherent compositions that use a harmonious rhythmic language and a renewed melodic one; a proposal that has been accepted, respected and considered a pattern to be followed by other musicians and several other Colombian ensembles, and which has converted the “Trio Nueva Colombia” and its director into important referents in the musical history of Colombia.

Considered by experts as a group of the highest artistic level,  we find in the trio´s music the excellence,  interpretative sensibility, good taste in the arrangements and mastery in the execution of each instrument.

¿Por qué necesitamos tu colaboración?

Con el respaldo del sello Hoot/Wisdom Recordings de  “Florida Atlantic University se realizó todo el trabajo de grabación, edición, mezlcla y masterización del álbum “Mi Camino”. Con tu apoyo, el Trío Nueva Colombia podrá realizar el prensaje (copias) del trabajo discográfico, producir un concierto de lanzamiento, y la promoción de este nuevo disco. Para esto esperamos recaudar US 5.000 ¿Nos ayudarás a realizar nuestro sueño?

Si tienes algún inconveniente para realizar tu contribución por este medio, bien sea porque no tienes tarjeta de crédito, no quieres usarla aquí, tu banco no aprueba el pago, u otra razón, por favor contáctanos al correo olgace18@gmail.com, germandariopiano@gmail.com o info@latinoamericadeconcierto,  para indicarte cómo podemos recibir tu aporte de otra manera.

¿Qué obtienes a cambio?

Gracias a tu apoyo recibirás el album online o en físico, podemos hacerte llegar partituras de las obras de Germán Darío Pérez que tu escojas, te enviaremos también fotografías autografiados, pero si quieres darnos un apoyo mayor, incluiremos tu nombre o el de tu empresa como patrocinador en la contraportada del estuche del album. Si tu gusto por nuestra música es aún mayor, y quieres ofrecernos aún más apoyo, tendrás un concierto privado nuestro en un escenario que pactaremos posteriormente. Si crees que nuestra música va bien a algún proyecto audiovisual tuyo o de alguien que conoces, y quieres apoyarnos, te daremos la autorización de sincronización si deseas incluir algunas de las obras de Germán Darío Pérez S., en un video, programa de TV o película.

Otras formas de apoyarnos

Si por algún motivo no puedes realizar un aporte económico a nuestra campaña, tu ayuda será muy valiosa si nos das una mano compartiendo la información aquí presentada con tus contactos.

Necesitas más información?

En el año 1986, cuando Germán Darío Pérez S. tenía 17 años de edad, sintió la necesidad de comenzar a ensamblar y a divulgar sus propias composiciones, algunas de las cuales ya habían obtenido reconocimientos en concursos nacionales de composición. De esa manera convocó a Ricardo Pedraza M. y a Mauricio Acosta A. a que lo acompañaran a integrar una agrupación conformada por Piano, Tiple y Contrabajo respectivamente. Dada la naturaleza novedosa y revolucionaria, en términos musicales, de las obras que empezó a interpretar esta naciente agrupación, el nombre surgió casi de manera obligada: Trío Nueva Colombia. 

Comenzaba así una de las más importantes renovaciones de la música de la región andina Colombiana. Los bambucos, guabinas, pasillos, danzas (ritmos típicos colombianos), empezaban a sonar diferente, con armonías novedosas,  alusiones al jazz y a la música académica, La música colombiana, con los aires oxigenadores y renovadores que le inyectó la sonoridad del Trío Nueva Colombia, y las composiciones innovadoras de Germán Darío Pérez, empezaría a llamar la atención de nuevas generaciones, que notaban con interés cómo se podía hacer música colombiana para los siglos XX y XXI. Era indispensable que una agrupación de adolescentes en ese entonces, como el Trío Nueva Colombia y específicamente su director Germán Darío Pérez S., rompiera estándares, con una transgresión aquí, otra allí, para empezar un estilo que definitivamente marcaría el inicio de una nueva etapa en esta música.

¿Quién es Germán Darío Pérez S.

 Pianista y compositor ampliamente premiado en la historia de festivales de música colombiana de la región andina. La combinación de su ancestro familiar arraigado a las tradiciones musicales colombianas, y sus estudios académicos, sumados a su creatividad lo llevó a la búsqueda de un nuevo lenguaje musical, con una gran riqueza rítmica, tímbrica y armónica, dando como resultado un estilo propio que abrió el camino hacia nuevas perspectivas en la Música Andina Colombiana. Es uno de los iniciadores de la principal renovación de esta música en los últimos 30 años. Sus composiciones son interpretadas permanentemente por solistas y ensambles de Colombia y del exterior, algunas de ellas en escenarios tan emblemáticos como el Southbank Centre de Londres y el Carnegie Hall, entre muchísimos otros. Su obra lo ha convertido en un referente ineludible en la historia musical de Colombia.

He has composed copious Andean Regional Colombian music, and has received many awards. He is one of the initiators of the renewal that this music has had in the last 30 years. His works are interpreted continuously by soloists and groups in Colombia and abroad in . He is also the arranger for several other national artists.

Algunos datos importantes:

*Respaldo de la Orquesta Filarmónica de Bogotá para la realización del proyecto denominado “Germán Darío Pérez Salazar, cinco obras de cámara” CD y libro de partituras.

* Artista incluido en la propuesta que permitió la declaratoria “Bogotá, Capital creativa de la Música”, año 2011 por la Unesco.

* Director artístico del Festival Internacional Latinoamérica de Concierto en sus versiones 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014 y 2015 (Bogotá, Colombia) http://latinoamericadeconcierto.com/ .

* Desde 1981 hasta la fecha, concertista en Colombia, en Europa y Latinoamérica, como solista y con el Trío Nueva Colombia, además de incontables colaboraciones para otros artistas.

* Docente área de Piano en la Universidad Pedagógica Nacional desde 2012 hasta la fecha.

* Docente ensambles de Música Colombiana, Universidad Nacional de Colombia, 2014.

* Desde 1886 fundador, director, arreglista y compositor para el Trío Nueva Colombia

* Artista homenajeado en el año 2003  el “Festival del Pasillo” en Aguadas (Caldas, Colombia)

* Artista homenajeado en el año 2008 el X Festival Antología de la Música Colombiana en Paipa (Boyacá, Colombia)

* Artista homenajeado el 17 de noviembre del año 2010 por el Banco de la República, mediante el ofrecimiento de un concierto monográfico en su nombre, en la Sala de Conciertos de la Biblioteca Luis Ángel Arango (Bogotá, Colombia).

* Jurado Calificador a los más importantes certámenes de Interpretación y de Composición en todo el País:

story_txt:
Un poco de historia
El Trío Nueva Colombia es considerado por expertos como punto de quiebre en la música colombiana de la región andina, y como referente ineludible en la historia musical del país. Desde su creación hace 30 años, ha estado integrado por Germán Darío Pérez Salazar en el piano, arreglos, composición y dirección, Ricardo Pedraza Medina en el Tiple  (cordófono típico colombiano) y Mauricio Acosta Avellaneda en el Contrabajo. Son innumerables los conciertos que han ofrecido en más de 15 países de Europa y América a lo largo de su carrera artística. Su director ha recibido en repetidas oportunidades homenajes en vida, como uno de los músicos más destacados de la música colombiana de la región andina. Su obra compositiva ha sido ampliamente premiada, alcanzando a la fecha 23 primeros puestos en composición en los más importantes certámenes y festivales del género. 4 de estas obras premiadas están incluidas en el presente trabajo discográfico. Otras más fueron escritas especialmente para este proyecto por su director, y otras son bellas obras de grandes compositores colombianos, como Adolfo Mejía, León Cardona, Francisco Cristancho, Jesús Alberto Rey y Santiago Medina. En total el disco consta de 15 cortes.El Sello Hoot/Wisdom Recordings de  “Florida Atlantic University”de Boca Ratón, Florida EEUU, escogió este proyecto musical para apoyar todo el proceso de grabación, edición, mezcla y masterización. Allí el trío pudo contar con los mejores equipos posibles, un piano incomparable, pero sobre todo, un equipo de colaboradores comprometidos y del más alto nivel humano y técnico, además de muy talentosos a nivel musical, encabezado por Alejandro Sánchez-Samper, profesor asociado de la universidad. Cada detalle se tuvo en cuenta y el Master es una pieza realmente impecable. Estamos seguros de tener hoy en nuestras manos, listo para prensaje (copias) un trabajo cuidadoso, delicado, pulcro y de un altísimo nivel musical.   Con este nuevo album, los melómanos de todo el mundo se podrán acercar con deleite a las músicas de la región andina colombiana, ya que la propuesta presentada es muy colombiana, y al mismo tiempo muy universal.BackgroundPiano, Tiple (typical Colombian chordophone), and Contrabass; an interesting format in Andean Colombian music. The resulting sound mixes a classical, jazzistic, and universal flavor of the piano and the contrabass, with the ancestral and very Colombian Tiple, a sound that reinforces the essence of the music interpreted in an academic and modern way, but with a prominent Colombian flavor.A new music for Colombia, a new sound; a new look at the traditional rhythms of the Andean region, sustained with coherent compositions that use a harmonious rhythmic language and a renewed melodic one; a proposal that has been accepted, respected and considered a pattern to be followed by other musicians and several other Colombian ensembles, and which has converted the “Trio Nueva Colombia” and its director into important referents in the musical history of Colombia.Considered by experts as a group of the highest artistic level,  we find in the trio´s music the excellence,  interpretative sensibility, good taste in the arrangements and mastery in the execution of each instrument.¿Por qué necesitamos tu colaboración?Con el respaldo del sello Hoot/Wisdom Recordings de  “Florida Atlantic University se realizó todo el trabajo de grabación, edición, mezlcla y masterización del álbum “Mi Camino”. Con tu apoyo, el Trío Nueva Colombia podrá realizar el prensaje (copias) del trabajo discográfico, producir un concierto de lanzamiento, y la promoción de este nuevo disco. Para esto esperamos recaudar US 5.000 ¿Nos ayudarás a realizar nuestro sueño?Si tienes algún inconveniente para realizar tu contribución por este medio, bien sea porque no tienes tarjeta de crédito, no quieres usarla aquí, tu banco no aprueba el pago, u otra razón, por favor contáctanos al correo olgace18@gmail.com, germandariopiano@gmail.com o info@latinoamericadeconcierto,  para indicarte cómo podemos recibir tu aporte de otra manera.¿Qué obtienes a cambio?Gracias a tu apoyo recibirás el album online o en físico, podemos hacerte llegar partituras de las obras de Germán Darío Pérez que tu escojas, te enviaremos también fotografías autografiados, pero si quieres darnos un apoyo mayor, incluiremos tu nombre o el de tu empresa como patrocinador en la contraportada del estuche del album. Si tu gusto por nuestra música es aún mayor, y quieres ofrecernos aún más apoyo, tendrás un concierto privado nuestro en un escenario que pactaremos posteriormente. Si crees que nuestra música va bien a algún proyecto audiovisual tuyo o de alguien que conoces, y quieres apoyarnos, te daremos la autorización de sincronización si deseas incluir algunas de las obras de Germán Darío Pérez S., en un video, programa de TV o película.Otras formas de apoyarnosSi por algún motivo no puedes realizar un aporte económico a nuestra campaña, tu ayuda será muy valiosa si nos das una mano compartiendo la información aquí presentada con tus contactos.Necesitas más información?En el año 1986, cuando Germán Darío Pérez S. tenía 17 años de edad, sintió la necesidad de comenzar a ensamblar y a divulgar sus propias composiciones, algunas de las cuales ya habían obtenido reconocimientos en concursos nacionales de composición. story:
Siamo un gruppo di femministe, impegnate come studiose e operatrici del diritto nel contesto dell’associazione IAPH-Italia (Associazione Internazionale di donne filosofe) a ripensare diritto, diritti e giustizia da una prospettiva femminista.

Il femminismo giuridico italiano ed internazionale ha affrontato con approcci diversi il rapporto tra le donne, i diritti, la giustizia e la legge, concentrandosi sulle strategie e il posizionamento anziché solo sulle metodologie, con l'obiettivo di affrontare la questione politica del soggetto e la legge, con l'obiettivo di praticare la ricerca e le professioni giuridiche a partire da un approccio legato al femminismo.

Il nostro progetto ha la finalità:

- Di ridefinire il significato e la portata del femminismo giuridico come metodo, come approccio e come sapere critico per risignificare all'origine lo stesso diritto, sia sul piano della ricerca che sul piano delle professioni legate ad esso.
- Di diffondere la conoscenza e di valorizzare le opere sul diritto di studiose femministe italiane e internazionali.
- Di esplorare e sviluppare nuovi percorsi di ricerca e analisi del femminismo giuridico.


I fondi raccolti sosterranno la nostra attività di ricerca per realizzare:


1. Nuovi contenuti all'interno di una pagina web, un atelier di femminismo giuridico, dove poter raccogliere e rendere accessibili articoli, studi, recensioni e ricerche già in corso;
2. Un volume in lingua italiana, per far conoscere le ricerche e le opere di studiose che hanno incoraggiato un'analisi femminista del diritto in Italia e su scala internazionale nel corso del Novecento e nella contemporaneità; 
3. Un workshop internazionale, con  pubblicazione finale open access, per diffondere e discutere i più recenti sviluppi teorici ed empirici del femminismo giuridico che vorremmo fare invitando studiose europee e non presso l'Università degli Studi di Roma Tre.

story:
Short Summary 

 

As an F1 team, we believe we are pretty unique: five culturally diverse girls in a very male dominated field. But you know what? We don't want to be unique. We want to be one of a massive number of girls and women from all walks of life participating in STEM careers. We want to be leaders for other girls, and be the visibility and success stories that they can look to for inspiration.

 

To get to the national finals, it will cost us around $10 000 to cover the costs of accommodation, flights, food and transport, as well as our uniforms, creating the booth and making our F1 model car. We are very passionate about getting there and hopefully winning, proving to everyone that girls in STEM can race and win - against any competition.

 

We also want to show the world that being culturally diverse has no effect on how successful you are, No matter where you are from, or what religion you believe in or what your traditions you have, you can still achieve anything  if you work hard enough, maintain your integrity and authenticity.

 

There are many challenges that we have to overcome, one being trying to convince people that just because we are girls, doesn't mean that we are any less capable than the boys. Another challenge we have is trying to reach our goal, of being able to afford to get to the National Finals, as there are huge expenses for our families.   

 

We appreciate any support that we can get, not only the money donations, but the shares, the Facebook likes and just spreading the word about our team and the cause that we are trying to raise awareness for.  We ask you to come with us on the journey as we race for F1 gold and stand on that podium for girls everywhere.

story:
How can You Help Your Community Where it Counts the Most?

"Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself."
- John Dewey

"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world."

- Nelson Mandela

| Who is behind Discipline?

Thank you for reading my first crowdfunding attempt! My name is Daniel Waddington. I am 34 year old handyman-entrepreneur and I have had the privilege of enjoying a lifestyle that has taught me the value of gratitude, fitness, nutrition, yoga and meditation. I have always been passionate about helping and teaching people and I would like to give back to the community by empowering the next generation. I am assembling a team of mentors and volunteers and together, with your generous donations, we are going to teach the science of success to young people!
 

 

| What are our Goals?
It's our belief that public education is failing to provide young people with skills in areas vital to success. Such areas as personal finance, food production/nutrition, physical fitness/martial arts as well as physical, mental and emotional well being are being overlooked as young people are prepared for a life in a corporate, consumer driven world. 
I believe that times are changing and the young people of today would benefit from learning time-tested techniques for achieving success. Hard work, honesty, personal excellence and perseverance have - and will continue to - earn success for the people who choose to practice these habits. 
 

 

| Why Crowdfunding?

Crowdfunding will help give economically disadvantaged young people the tools they need to learn positive, life changing habits that will help them succeed in any endeavour. 

I intend to purchase the equipment a person would need to begin to earn a living and put into practice some positive, life affirming habits that the younger generation could put into practice for the rest of their lives. 

  • work gloves (~$10)
  • backpack (~$150)
  • safety glasses (~$10)
  • hiking/work boots (~$140)
  • branded uniform t-shirt (~$30)
  • yoga mat / meditation pillow (~$40)
  • thermos (~$20)
 

             

 

                        

 

| How We Plan to Succeed

I am able to provide guidance, mentorship and employment for 4 young adults, initially. I hope to crowdfund the equipment they will need to be healthy and active and the tools they need to earn a living. 
Once the successful applicant has all of the tools they need to succeed, myself and other mentors enrolled in the program will provide guidance in areas of our expertise. 
 
  • Home Maintenance / Renovation
  • Yoga / Fitness / Martial Arts
  • Outdoor Activity / Survival Skills
  • Nutrition / Food Production
 

 
I hope to enrol four applicants in this program. The $1600 will be spent allocating a budget of $400 to each successful applicant for tools and equipment needed. 
The more donations that are received, the more people we can help! We'll post regular updates on Facebook, YouTube, Instagram (@discipline.dan) and on our Website. 
 

| Make a Real Difference Today

If young people can learn self-sufficiency and discipline early in life then they have a much better chance of achieving any goal they decide upon for the rest of their lives. I believe that encouraging personal growth, honesty and hard work can have a positive effect on our economy, our communities, our country and our planet. 

 

| Risks & Challenges

Challenges in establishing this enterprise:

  • Lack of interest 
  • Shortage of work
  • Ineffective leadership
I believe we are qualified to handle any challenge that may arise. I am a professional handyman and I have been serving the community for over a decade. I have personally trained many novice apprentices over the years. I am also a licensed real estate agent and investor and I am eager to use my skills to help young people learn, earn and invest. The founding members of this organisation also have training and expertise in:
 
  • Nutrition
  • Yoga / Fitness
  • Hiking / Survival skills 
  • Home Maintenance / Renovation
  • Real Estate
  • Business / Investing / Marketing
  • Music

| Other Ways You Can Help

 

Visit http://www.WhatIsDiscipline.ca/ to donate, volunteer or mentor!

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read my pitch! Together I know we can help to make a difference to end the cycle of poverty many young people in the community struggle with!

story:
Short Summary

It is my belief that the NHS is being forced into crisis in order to give justification for ever increasing privatisation of the service for ideological reasons.

In order for this to happen the current government are on a crusade to belittle the great work of the staff of our NHS and undermine their hard work and vocation both financially and emotionally.

The intention of this page, and the associated website is to offer a mouthpiece for the staff of the NHS to share their stories and experiences with the general public and for us to share fact-checked resources about the actual health of our national health service.

So if you're waiting to be seen, or waiting to see what happens to this great institution then why not get the inside scoop.

www.whileyouarewaiting.com

What We Need

This campaign is aimed to raise the funds for a clear and concise real world campaign to prevent the need for our Junior doctors to strike.

The funds raised here will cover the costs of the following:

A banner to be posted outside every A&E in the country as a 'virtual picket line' asking the public to consider the true cost of our doctors being forced to strike

A short run of fliers detailing the dangers of backdoor privatisation of the NHS and pushing for the government to understand the value of a well funded and well staffed health service

The Impact

Just £1 can make a massive difference to our intended goal.

  • A well informed public will support the right decision on paying our NHS staff what they deserve
  • We will create a highly visible and tangible counterpoint to the right wing press
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

We are a small movement with big goals and high hopes in the intelligence of the British public. The squeeze on the NHS is just the start of a broader dismantling of the welfare state which was created in a time of abject austerity and cannot be allowed to be swept away

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Like the While You Are Waiting facebook page and share your experiences of the NHS
  • Visit www.whileyouarewaiting.com and learn ways you can show your support to the real people keeping the NHS, and your loved ones alive.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Quel est notre projet ?

Le comité formation du Mouvement Allaitement du Québec (MAQ) prépare actuellement une journée de réflexion sur la formation initiale des professionnels de la santé en matière d’allaitement, qui se tiendra le 29 avril 2016, à l’Université de Sherbrooke, campus de Longueuil. Pour nous aider à financer la prestation théâtrale de la troupe Parminou, qui ouvrira ce colloque, nous lançons une campagne de socio-financement majeure, faisant appel à toutes les communautés de la province du Québec. En mettant en scène plusieurs situations vécues par des mères allaitantes, nous souhaitons sensibiliser les participants du colloque aux difficultés reliées au manque de formation en allaitement des professionnels de la santé. Ainsi, en combinant l’art à la science, la troupe Parminou nous aidera à transmettre notre message et contribuera à la réussite de notre projet.


Pourquoi cette journée?

Depuis plusieurs années, de nombreux acteurs et organismes, comme l’Organisation Mondiale de la Santé (OMS), dénoncent le manque de formation des professionnels de la santé en matière d’allaitement. L’impact de cette situation sur l’allaitement au Québec est réel. Par exemple, alors qu’environ 85% des mères québécoises allaitent leur enfant à la naissance, seule la moitié d’entre-elles allaitent de manière exclusive à leur sortie du lieu de naissance. Et le plus important est que cela se produit souvent à l’encontre de l’objectif initial des mères. Le soutien qui leur est offert est trop souvent insuffisant ou inadéquat, les professionnels de la santé étant bien intentionnés, mais peu préparés à fournir des soins pertinents pour un allaitement réussi. Les femmes, qui manquent de soutien et reçoivent souvent des messages divergents de la part de ces professionnels, ne sont donc pas dans les conditions favorables à une bonne expérience d’allaitement. Il en résulte beaucoup de souffrance physique (e.g. mamelons douloureux, gerçures) et psychologique (e.g. anxiété, sentiments de culpabilité). De meilleures pratiques professionnelles pourraient éviter ces souffrances aux mères et améliorer leur expérience d’allaitement. Nous organisons donc un colloque sur la formation en allaitement des futurs professionnels de la santé au Québec.


Comment se déroulera-t-elle?

Cette journée réunira plusieurs professeurs, enseignants et responsables des programmes de formation des professionnels de la santé des universités et cégeps du Québec - soit des médecins, infirmières, nutritionnistes, sages-femmes, dentistes, pharmaciens - ainsi que des représentants de différents ordres professionnels. Pour les participants, ce colloque sera une occasion d’échanger et de réseauter pour améliorer les programmes de formation des professionnels de la santé en matière d’allaitement, au bénéfice des familles du Québec.

Pour cela, divers conférenciers de renommée nationale et internationale en formation et pratique professionnelle en santé, ou détenant une expertise sur la collaboration interprofesionnelle en tant que moteur de changement, prendront la parole au cours de la journée pour outiller les participants et les aider à mener cette réflexion.

Pour plus d’informations sur le colloque, vous pouvez consulter le site suivant : http://www.allaiterauquebec.org/formation


À quoi servira votre contribution ?

Nous avons besoin de vous pour garantir la réussite de cette journée de réflexion et assurer la pérennité de nos activités!

Votre précieuse contribution nous servira:

  • Principalement à financer l’activité ludique qui entamera la journée : l’intervention de la troupe Parminou. La création sur mesure de scénettes de théâtre est associée à des frais qui varient selon la durée de l’intervention et le nombre de comédiens y prenant part. Votre contribution servira donc principalement à couvrir ces frais. Nous vous encourageons par ailleurs à aller visiter le site de cette troupe talentueuse : www.parminou.com.
  • Elle servira aussi à assumer divers frais associés à l’organisation de la journée, comme la participation des conférenciers, ou encore les boîtes à lunch des participants.
  • Enfin, elle permettra au comité formation, dont nous faisons partie, de poursuivre les activités reliées à sa mission.


D'autres façons d'aider!

N’hésitez pas à diffuser notre campagne autour de vous. Partagez le lien Indiegogo à vos collègues, dans votre réseau, à vos amis, ou postez-le sur les réseaux sociaux!

Voici le lien de la campagne: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/mauvais-depart
et celui de la vidéo: https://youtu.be/HOxI1doicfU

Et pour toute question ou tout commentaire, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter : formation@allaiterauquebec.org


Qui sommes-nous ?

Le Mouvement Allaitement du Québec (MAQ) veut contribuer à rendre les environnements favorables à l’allaitement, et ce, dans un contexte de développement optimal des jeunes enfants et de bien-être des femmes, des familles et de la société. Ces environnements (lieu de travail, milieux hospitaliers, etc) se doivent de respecter toutes les femmes et toutes les familles.

Le MAQ est un lieu de concertation indépendant ouvert à l’ensemble des personnes et des organisations qui adhèrent à ses principes.

Le comité formation du MAQ, dont nous faisons partie, s’intéresse plus particulièrement aux environnements d’ordre institutionnel, c’est à dire les cégeps et les universités. Plus précisément, notre comité travaille dans le but que tous les professionnels de la santé possèdent un bagage de connaissances minimales en allaitement à la fin de leurs études, et ce, peu importe leur spécialité.

Pour plus d’informations sur le MAQ, n’hésitez pas à consulter notre site web : http://www.allaiterauquebec.org/


Merci de votre soutien!

story:
You can have a DIRECT and IMMEDIATE effect in the lives of those that need the most help. Do you know a family that has been affected by autism?  Odds are you do. The sad truth is that affordable, accessible, and effective autism therapy options have not caught up with the alarming autism diagnosis rates.  Some people are fortunate enough to live near an autism therapy center. Some can afford the $50-$150 per hour rates for therapy.  Sadly, most cannot.  Autism therapy can cost families up to $5,000 a month.  Just ask the families of autistic children. They will tell you the same. Kairos online will be bring effective, affordable autism therapy to families for just a few bucks a day.  Please join our cause today and help us bring Kairos Online to life!

There is no one in the world who is not personally affected, or soon to be affected in some way, socially or financially, by autism.

Autism not only has a financial cost to families (upwards of $60,000 per year, Autism Action Partnership, June 9th, 2014), but there are also social costs to helping autistic individuals throughout their lives.

There is however good news!

Autism does not have to be a life sentence. Studies have shown that early detection and intervention, along with effective therapy may drastically improve the quality of life for autistic individuals and their families.

The joy offered by knowing there is hope is oftentimes short lived. 

Knowing the correct therapy to choose, and figuring out how to pay for it when you finally make the choice, is when things get both confusing and complicated for families.

That is why we need your help to create Kairos Online; a platform that provides customized proven therapies, access to trained professionals, and community support at a cost anyone can afford. 

Most Families cannot afford the recommended amount of autism therapy.

 

Therapies are not always customized to meet individual needs.

Families are oftentimes unsure about the correct course of treatment for their loved ones due to the number of different therapy types and options.

 

Access to differing therapies are not always available at the same location, which could limit the amount of therapy given and/or raise the cost of treatment for families.

Quality therapy is not accessible to everyone in need.

 

 

Kairos Online uses a method built on proven therapies and regular feedback, along with consistent re-evaluation and therapy customization to optimize every child's progression. The tools, videos, training and therapies necessary are delivered to families via an interactive online platform.

Kairos Online makes custom, quality autism therapy and training affordable for everyone.

Kairos Online gives families and individuals access to proven autism therapies in areas where the availability of quality treatment may be limited.

Kairos Online empowers the families and caregivers to aid in the treatment of the Autistic individual.

 

 

Every child or their care giver is given an entrance evaluation questionnaire.

Based on the results of the questionnaire, a customized therapy schedule, complete with suggested videos and activities, will be provided for the individual and the family to complete at home.

 

The therapy program will outline the what, how, why, and when of each activity and session, and a calendar of suggested therapy dates will be provided.

Frequent progress and use reports will be generated and provided to the families.

A re-evaluation will be completed quarterly and used to suggest changes in the customized therapy plan to ensure the child is constantly receiving the right therapy in the right moment.

 

Throughout the entire process, the user will have access to Kairos Online, and its staff to ensure a positive experience.

 

There are a great number of moving parts to accomplish this amazing online therapy system.

 

We have assembled web developers, designers, video production teams, therapists, and industry professionals in order to make our vision a reality.

 

Upon funding, work will begin immediately on the construction of the website along with the production of our Phase 1 video library, which is estimated to contain over 150 therapy and training videos.

It is anticipated Phase 1 will take between three and four months to complete. After which, a marketing plan will be implemented and we will look to launch the official website and platform in spring of 2017.

 

 

 

For Every $2500 above our initial funding goal, we will make a one year scholarship available to a family in need. So, when we have hit our goal, please do not hesitate to contribute. Additional funding will help us reach many more people in need.

There is no one who  will not soon be personally affected by the epidemic that is Autism Spectrum Disorder. Your financial contribution is vital to bringing this incredible platform to thousands of autistic individuals and their families.

Your support will change lives! 

Join us as we fight back against this disorder in a battle we believe we can win....

Thank you for your help!

Risks and challenges

During the development stage of our project, we will have the challenge of producing many quality, effective videos in a relatively short amount of time. We are trying to get this platform built as quickly as possible because there are so many that will benefit from it. We have given ourselves 3 months to produce the first 150-200 videos. We feel we are able to meet this self imposed timeline; however, video production and editing times may cause delay. 

During the production of the videos, we will begin an aggressive marketing campaign. We will be begin by target-marketing autism groups through social media. As we grow, we will also make use of traditional marketing channels. 

With over 3.5 million autistic Americans, there is a market opportunity that allows for early profitability and rapid growth in the near future. The viability of this project depends on how many families use our unique and much needed services. Our goal is to keep overhead at a minimum, while still providing quality, effective autism therapy. Because of the large market size and existing needs, our business model will thrive and grow if we can sign up a very small fraction of autistic individuals in the US. 

Another challenge we will face may come from some in the Autism Community. We are changing the way autism therapy is done, and some might see it as a threat to "the way things have always been done". 

Change is not easy, and many families feel they are on the right path and don't want to mess with the progress they have made. We respect that and love that they are making progress with their children. However, there are hundreds of thousands of families that need what Kairos Online will offer. We are here for them.

 

THE TEAM

Scott Pryor is 42 years old and grew up in the greater Seattle area. After graduating from Brigham Young University with a degree in Psychology nearly 20 years ago, he began working with the Autism community and, has worked with numerous families throughout the West as an Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) consultant. In 2003 Scott created Pryor Consulting, specializing in working with parents and schools to develop and maintain effective ABA programs for families in Utah and the surrounding states. Scott currently works with families throughout Utah, Idaho, and Montana. While seeking to improve the quality of programs offered to clients, Scott discovered the Relationship Development Intervention (RDI®) program. After researching RDI®, Scott received training and became a Certified RDI® Consultant in 2009. Scott sees Kairos Online as a way to help as many people as possible receive life changing therapies for their themselves and their autistic loved ones.

Scott Lomu is 41 years old and resides in Utah with his wife Andrea and their 4 children. He is a graduate of University of Utah and specializes in marketing and business development. Scott's youngest son Kai was diagnosed with autism while Scott and George were in Africa filming their show "Jungle Gold" for Discovery Channel. Ever since that day Scott and his wife have dedicated their lives to making autism therapy effective, accessible, and affordable for everyone.

Brandt Helm is 37 year old entrepreneur and father of six. He holds a business management degree from The Marriott School of Business at Brigham Young University and specializes in marketing, business development, and design. He has helped to start a number of different companies, and has spent a great deal of time and effort in helping his son, also named Kai, as he participates in the countless hours of therapy needed for his ASD.

George Wright is 33 yrs old and originally from California. He currently resides in Utah with his wife and 5 children. George is a multi-faceted business man with expertise in marketing and video production. As business partner of Scott Lomu's for almost 7 years he became a dear friend of the family and remembers clearly the first time Scott told him that he suspected his son may have autism. George has seen the hardship and struggle as well as the victories and hope his friend Scott has had with their little son Kai. He's a friend of somebody affected by Autism, and he wants to help.

The sad truth is that affordable, accessible, and effective autism therapy options have not caught up with the alarming autism diagnosis rates.  Some people are fortunate enough to live near an autism therapy center. Some can afford the $50-$150 per hour rates for therapy.  Sadly, most cannot.  Autism therapy can cost families up to $5,000 a month.  Just ask the families of autistic children. They will tell you the same. story:
Introduction

Our names are Anjana Nair, Brianna Broderick, and Catherine Chen and we are participating in our local "SkillsUSA" competition in an attempt to raise awareness and funds for the Alzheimer's Association. We also hope to prevent Alzheimer's disease by educating others about the risks and impacts of the disease on the victim and those closest to them.

One of our team members, Anjana Nair, has lost her grandfather to this devastating disease, and we want to make sure that no other family experiences this horrifying illness. Victims of Alzheimer's slowly lose their memories and forget the ones they love the most. They lose themselves and this disease ultimately makes them a skeleton of who they once were. They can no longer remember who their children are, who their true love is, and what they have done throughout their lives. This illness splits families and causes immense suffering for caregivers and close ones; we need to stop this disease and end this devastation.

With your help, we can eradicate this disease once and for all. Your donations and funds can help us get in front of lawmakers and Congress members, so we can put Alzheimer's disease as a top priority in the White House; they can help us get the tools to educate future generations about Alzheimer's and spread prevention techniques to elders at nursing homes; they can increase our popularity in our community, so we can host several events to promote our cause; they can help us fund new research to find a cure within the next 20 years. We need your help. Without it, Alzheimer's will continue to be a disease that wrecks and kills the lives of your friends, family, and you. An estimated 14 million people will die of Alzheimer's in 2050. We need to act now.

About The Wish of Jellyfish

Our team name is "The Wish of Jellyfish" because recently, scientists have found that a calcium-binding protein in jellyfish called aequorin has the ability to protect nerve cells in the brain. They are now testing the aequorin protein's effect in young animals and hopefully, it can finally lead to a cure for Alzheimer's. Our team is promoting and participating in new research being done to cure Alzheimer's and we hope with our project, we can inspire the next generation to investigate the disease and eradicate it for good.

First, we plan to raise awareness and educate our classmates and peers about the true meaning of Alzheimer's. Many have heard about the disease, but they do not understand what people with Alzheimer's suffer through. By conducting experiments in the class and allowing peers to get a hands-on experience of Alzheimer's, we hope to invigorate not only the students, but also their families and friends to help this cause. Previously, our group had set up a booth at our school's Back-to-School Night and we were fairly successful in raising some donations and awareness among the parents and students there. We wish to do more for the cause in the near future, including: 

1. Holding an ALZ day at our school in which we educate our peers and teachers about the impacts of Alzheimer's disease and what Alzheimer's really is

2. Meeting with our local representative in Congress and advocating for Alzheimer's

3. Attending support groups and understanding what caregivers of Alzheimer's disease patients have to go through

4. Holding fundraisers and awareness events around the community 

5. Holding musical performances at nursing homes in the county because music is found to stimulate brain activity and prevent neurodegeneration

6. Introducing pet therapy to patients with Alzheimer's at nursing homes, so we can let patients know they are not alone

7. Attending the Alzheimer's Association International Conference in Toronto, Canada to meet with qualified scientists and professionals from all over the world

We have all mourned for those who can no longer recall their greatest memories after the onset of this disease as well as the caregivers who devote so much time and effort to look after them. One of our teammates, Anjana, has lost her grandfather to this devastating illness and we hope to honor him and all other Alzheimer's patients as we embark on a journey to truly understand what Alzheimer's is.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you choose not to donate to our cause, you can spread awareness about Alzheimer's throughout your community and all over social media. Start your own campaign and help out this cause that is dear to our hearts.

Thank you all so much :)

story:
UAU – Universal Association of Ufologists 

#UFOlog

We hold these truths to be self-evident … that we are not the only intelligent race in the Universe. So why haven’t we established strong intergalactic affairs between our civilization and those from other planets? We assume, the only answer is – the Humanity is just not ready for this yet. Probably, many of us are personally ready, however not all together. The goal of our project is to enroll 30% of the entire Earth’s population, in order to move closer to the ‘day X’ which stands for such a long-awaited meeting with aliens.

Our goal is so global that it’s worth of just thinking about it in a quiet environment…. Well, besides uniting of at least 30% of the Earth’s population, is to popularize and develop any UFO-related research. 

We’ve done with just sitting there and waiting for the ‘day X’, so we have decided to unite all those who believes aliens exist by creating 

Universal Association of Ufologists.

#UFOlog

We consider ufologists all those who believe aliens exist and wish to join our community. No matter an alien (and some say they’re among us already) or a human being – everyone will get their own unique ID number with the verification available at our official webpage www.uau.cool

Alien civilizations are watching us from out there. So let’s make clear for them we are ready for the contact!

We can come closer to inevitable meeting with aliens by demonstrating that the humanity is ready for this. We hope we can see this meeting ourselves. We are planning to become the most numerous community of our planet, so when aliens will notice this, they most likely will contact our civilization via representatives of our community, as they’ll see we are the one who is ready.


According to our calculations (and we consider this a self-impact prophecy) the inevitable meeting with an alien civilization is going to happen as soon as about 30% of the Earth population will join us. That is approximately 2,190,000,000. This is our self-impact prophecy! We adequately estimate our opportunities here, so for the beginning we are lowering this number 1,000 times – down to 0.03% - and that’s still 2,190,000! We really need your support; everything depends on how well you start it. If you believe alien civilizations exist – join our assocoiation.

In Universe, nothing happens unnoticed. Our association is just a little step towards more people to believe in aliens. People meeting aliens – that’s VERY meaningful, not only for the world history, but also for the history of the civilization, which will contact us. Realizing the importance of this upcoming event, we’ve decided to start new era and count the year UAU was created as Year 1. Oh yeah, it’s been awhile since the last time a new era was started! So from now on, let’s count 2016 as year 1.

Attention! CREATIVE Contest!

Authors of 10 best works will win the title of the Father (Mother) Founder of Universal Association of Ufologists + UAU official logo badge. All participants will be granted the title of Co-founder of UAU. 
We Accept your creative works with our UAU logo, hashtag #UFOlog, our website name www.uau.cool, our name (UAU, Universal Association of Ufologists). It can be a picture, a drawing, a graffiti, a video, a poem, a song, a tattoo or a body-art with the use of our symbols. 
The best works will be published in our fb public (https://www.facebook.com/groups/480636825473625/), on our Instagram and Google+, and also on our official website as soon as we launch it. You can e-mail your works to creativeuau@gmail.com or post it in our fb public with 'creative' mark. Tell about our contest to all creative people you know. 
Moreover - top 10 reposters will also get the title of the Father (Mother) Founder UAU + UAU official logo badge. Repost link is here:https://igg.me/at/uau/x/13162696


Our Association will be functioning even after the most meaningful event in history will happen. We will most likely have joint infrastructure, culture and social project together with aliens.

Alien civilization are watching us. So let’s make it clear for them – we are ready for the contact! Get that bright day closer – become an ufologist!

If 30% of Earth population will join us – the meeting with aliens will happen!
