story:
Short Summary

My name is Elvis Konye. I am a Cameroonian born and live in Cameroon. I have been working with the American school  of Douala, Cameroon for eight years now . I started as a Special Need Teaching Assistant for 4 years. Then worked as a Teaching Assistant (T.A) for 3 years in the preschool. This academic year (2015/2016), I began the academic year as a Grade 3 (T.A), then was promoted as a grade one homeroom teacher few months after.   

I will be defending a professional degree in Educational Psychology/Sciences of Education in August 2016 at the Douala University. I also did some courses in Economics and in Accounting/Management both for a year. 

Being a product of my local system of education as a learner and as a teacher from an American system of education, I worked comparing both systems of education in order to understand the faults of the former. I started thinking of how I could use the knowledge I am gaining from my work in this prestigious system to support and help improve the quality of my system of education. 

I contacted some local schools to offer free training workshops to their teachers on weekends and days that I am on holidays at my job side. One important issue I observed during this process is that,  kids learn only from their teachers. The teachers have only text books as a didactic material, thus kids learning is limited. That is why I thought of creating MYHOME in order to create more didactic material for the African children, and also to create a new source of employment for some African youth  who studied in the  field of literature.  

Through MYHOME, I want to run my first campaign "Africans Write to Advance their Kids' Education" (AWAKE). Together with the team I am organizing, we are going to encourage the writing of children books in the minds of passionate young African writers, by publishing 300 books on various literature genres in the next three years. It will be done in the the following pattern:

- Year 1: 100 books for 3-7 years

- Year 2: 100 books for 7-11

- Year 3: 100 books for 11+

 We are going to invite authors, illustrators, photographers etc, to propose to our team of educationalists, their various books for publication following a set of criteria. The best one hundred books will be published every year. This is to improve learning by making it more relevant and diversified. My interest on education arose from my long experience in early childhood and special needs education. I strongly believe that a quality education for African kids will help to speed up the development of Africa.



What We Need & What You Get

In order to understand what is needed to produce a book for children in my country, I wrote my first book "MOM MY FIRST SUPER HERO", then I had it illustrated, edited, and inset for printing. It all cost me $420. This is a rough estimate to make one book right up to the printing level. The reason why we will need a $100,000 for the starting of this project is that, in the first year of our project we are going to spend 42% of this money to the publishing of the first 100 books right up to the printing level. Then, the rest of the money will be used to print 100 copies of each book to donate it freely to 100 schools as an advertissement campaign.

The greatest benefit I will make from this project away from my personal income, is the positive impact it will have on our local education system. Also, the job opportunity it will create to our youths graduated in this field. This is also my own battle against poverty in Africa. By supporting my campaign, you will be helping me to fight the battle, and also creating means to read more books in African literature.
If I don't meet this amount ($100, 000) by the earn of this campaign, I will use the amount collected  to print the books that I wrote myself such as MOM MY FIRST SUPER HERO (A realistic fiction), and TURTLE ATE PEPPER BUT DIDN'T MAKE USSSH (A folktale still in progress). And also those that will be done on small scales by volunteers who believe in this project for distribution.

The Impact

I have been working on this project for over five years now, and I am all heart about it. This is because at times it seem the future of an African child is completely hopeless despite the potentials in them. I once told an American lady who introduced me in teaching, and to whom I pay homage to for my success that, "It is better to teach individuals how to catch a fish than feeding them with fish whenever they feel hungry". I believe that Africans in general only needs to be guided in other to make a change in their life.

Everyone who will contribute in this campaign will be helping the African to view life in a complete different perspective. By viewing images in books that directly relate to their personalities and environments. This action will help build up our learners interest in reading, and improve their self-esteem. I believe that reading alone can help build a 60% of a child intellectual abilities, and that some learners will acquire 70% of their knowledge just by reading in books. Good teachers may be unavailable for all learners, but goods books has no fix destination. More again, I know no matter how great a teacher is, without books his/her learners cannot academically achieve to their optimum.   

Risks & Challenges

Having books is one thing, but knowing how to use them is another.  Most local schools are do not have libraries, and their teachers might find it difficult to use them properly. This is going to be one of our big challenge with this project, because most often skeptical about changes about the changes that can occur in their life.  

However, we will provide training workshops to teacher on how to carried out  guided readings, shared reading, and reading aloud. We are going to freely offer this workshops to the one hundred schools that will be selected to receive a copy of each of our first 100 books printed. These schools will be used as a lab to test the effectiveness of our projects, and also quoted as examples to convinced others to join our program. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is important for such a project, but it is not the only way to support it. You can help just by reading our books and by sharing with us your opinions and ideas on them will greatly help to improve our work. Therefore, away from financially contributing, you can also become a godfather or a mentor to this projects and help us to grow.  We are also selling our books on www.blurb.com, and you can follow us on our Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/myhome82/

Indiegogo also provide a means to help move the campaign to others networks just by using its share tools.
 

Thanks for reading.
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Elvis Konye. I am a Cameroonian born and live in Cameroon. I have been working with the American school  of Douala, Cameroon for eight years now . I started as a Special Need Teaching Assistant for 4 years. Then worked as a Teaching Assistant (T.A) for 3 years in the preschool. This academic year (2015/2016), I began the academic year as a Grade 3 (T.A), then was promoted as a grade one homeroom teacher few months after.   
I will be defending a professional degree in Educational Psychology/Sciences of Education in August 2016 at the Douala University. I also did some courses in Economics and in Accounting/Management both for a year. 
Being a product of my local system of education as a learner and as a teacher from an American system of education, I worked comparing both systems of education in order to understand the faults of the former. I started thinking of how I could use the knowledge I am gaining from my work in this prestigious system to support and help improve the quality of my system of education. 
I contacted some local schools to offer free training workshops to their teachers on weekends and days that I am on holidays at my job side. One important issue I observed during this process is that,  kids learn only from their teachers. The teachers have only text books as a didactic material, thus kids learning is limited. That is why I thought of creating MYHOME in order to create more didactic material for the African children, and also to create a new source of employment for some African youth  who studied in the  field of literature.  
Through MYHOME, I want to run my first campaign "Africans Write to Advance their Kids' Education" (AWAKE). Together with the team I am organizing, we are going to encourage the writing of children books in the minds of passionate young African writers, by publishing 300 books on various literature genres in the next three years. It will be done in the the following pattern:
- Year 1: 100 books for 3-7 years
- Year 2: 100 books for 7-11
- Year 3: 100 books for 11+
 We are going to invite authors, illustrators, photographers etc, to propose to our team of educationalists, their various books for publication following a set of criteria. The best one hundred books will be published every year. This is to improve learning by making it more relevant and diversified. My interest on education arose from my long experience in early childhood and special needs education. I strongly believe that a quality education for African kids will help to speed up the development of Africa.

story:
UPDATE 3.

Well, it is over. I didn't make the full amount, HOWEVER I have enough to make the telescope. Really, all this means is I have to be careful and I'll have to wait to build the tracking mount. Thanks to everyone!




Little Update (2.5)

This is from the transcript of the Report of the Kew Committee 1856/7

                                           "PHOTOHELIOGRAPH.
On the 20th of May, 1854. Benj. Oliveira, Esq., F.R.S., placed the sum of
£50 at the disposal of the Council of the Royal Society, to hp appropriated
during that year in any manner the Council might consid~r most in harmony
with the interests of Science. Mr. Oliveira further statE'd, that he might probably in future years offer a similar sum if the mode of its disposal appeared to him eligible; and an application having at the same time oeen made by the Kew Committee for the sum of £150, in order to erect a Photographic Apparatus for registering the position of the spots in the Sun's disc, as suggested by Sir John Herschel, the Council of the Royal Society devoted to this purpose the donation of Mr. Oliveira, and proposes, should it be continued, to apply it for the next two years in replacement of the sum of £100
which the Council in the mean time advanced from the Donation Fund of
the Royal Society, in OI'Ilr.r that the undertaking might not be delayed. This
arrangement was approvc\d by Mr. Oliveira, and the apparatus has, under the
direction of ,\Varren De la Rue, Esq., F.R.S., been completed by Mr. Ross
at the cost of about £180."



UPDATE #2!!  The lenses are made and going through the final QC, then they ship! 



UPDATE #1  A donor had footed the cash for the objective lens! This was the most harrowing part to get, as only 100 are being made at a reasonable price. (Optical places want close to $1000 for one like this) This means that this project is definitely happening AND more care can be taken on other parts. I am also working on a tracking mount, but for now this campaign is just for the telescope/camera.  I added a video of taking a picture with the prototype.



My name is Chris Olsen, I am a collodion photographer and historical reenactor as a photographer. I want to make a replica of the Kew Observatory (in England) Photoheliograph. This was the first camera dedicated to photographing the Sun. It was used during the 1860 solar eclipse in Spain to measure solar prominences. It was then discovered the they were from the Sun, and led to better understanding of what it looks like.

     I hope to finish in time to photograph the Eclipse in the US in 2017. I have built a successful 1/2 scale prototype, and would like a full scale model. When completed I will be able to produce up to 10 inch diameter images on glass plates using a 150 year old process. 

     The $800 I hope to raise will cover the objective lens, lumber and raw material for making the shutter and hardware. I am hopeful it will cover the clockwork tracking mount as well.

story:
Today’s business students need more than text books. The fast paced Business environment requires a disruptive change in educational methodology and experience, providing students with:

 The methodologies to test before launching.

 A co-working space to go beyond the classroom so students can learn side-by-side with existing entrepreneurs called 2nd Nest.

 Create a learning environment as diverse as the United Nations where students collaborate with teachers, business leaders, and entrepreneurs.

 

Help disrupt the way we teach Entrepreneurship, Innovation, and Design at Niels Brock’s newest campus in San Diego, CIBU (California International Business University).

 

 

Niels Brock CIBU’s new campus in the heart of San Diego’s business center is based on a proven Danish education model aimed at empowering students. Our curriculum is built around an individual student’s interests from day one, resulting in students being able to combine California’s rugged culture of innovation and entrepreneurship with a nurturing environment in which they feel safe enough to fail fast and fail forward. 


In the last 20 years, it is estimated that the number of students who start school with the desire to become an entrepreneur has grown by 60%. Today’s students arrive with their own projects and want to focus on the skills need for necessary to build those potential businesses rather than general survey courses. 


There are two new initiatives that we are integrating into Niels Brock CIBU’s education:

“2nd Nest” Accelerator - 2nd Nest gives students a chance to have their teachers help them build their businesses. The ‘Second Nest’ Accelerator provides start-up bound students with mentoring by professors, seasoned professionals, and entrepreneur peers. Beginning with market and concept, we provide practical and supportive time, place, and expertise in support of student’s future ventures.

Inspirational Design Thinking - Inspirational Design Thinking is a problem solving methodology centered on creating breakthrough innovations. All current innovations methods, including Design Thinking, are limited to handling incremental innovation. This makes Inspirational Design Thinking the first method tackling breakthrough innovation, a critical prerequisite for new entrepreneurial ventures.

Inspirational Design Thinking augments the traditional Design Thinking model, by focusing product leaders on creating breakthrough innovation.

 

 

By joining the University as a forerunner in the field of creating repeatable breakthrough innovation, your contributions will be allocated in a purposeful manner:

 Launch “2nd Nest” Accelerator Program - Student will go beyond the classroom and will work side by side with existing entrepreneurs, exchanging research and learning by building, testing, and succeeding.

 Build Up Our Research Capabilities - In order for Niels Brock CIBU to conduct this Inspirational Design Thinking research, build leading-edge capabilities, and place itself on the forefront of business schools, considerable organizational and process changes will be required.

 Strengthen our academic level - By achieving the prestigious WASC accreditation that will add value to all CIBU students - previous as well as current and future!

 

The Impact:

 

To further develop Niels Brock CIBU, we need your support. Please donate. Your contribution will help us implement breakthrough innovation and become accredited by the most prestigious accreditation agency, the accrediting commission for schools, Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC) - that will add value to all degrees earned at CIBU at any time - in the past, present and in the future. 

Every little bit helps! If you have warm memories of being at Niels Brock CIBU, we ask that you donate $20 to give the next generation of students the opportunity to have a similar experience.

 

The Perks:

In the spirit of Inspirational Design Thinking, and to meet our goal of raising $200,000.00, we have prepared some awesome ways to say thank you. We’ve reached out to our global network and have prepared gifts that we would want ourselves:

  • Collector's edition shirts drawn by Henrik Fisker, designer of the BMW Z8 James Bond car, the Aston Martin Vantage and his own Fisker Karma.
  • Day trips to get to know San Diego as a local with your family or a trip to be introduced to local business leaders.
  • Our teachers and deans have generously offered time to provide corporate facilitators, trainings, and lectures catered to your needs.

Our perks are unique only to our Business School. From One-of-a kind T-Shirts to Custom Danish Christiania Cargo Bicycles. We also offer Sponsorship opportunities on and off campus at higher levels with Platinum premiums that shouldn't be missed. We continually add more perks so check back for more great offerings!

Your contribution matters. Even if we don’t reach $200,000.00 you can rest assure that all the funds raised will be put to use to help build our campus.

All proceeds are tax-deductible and are fiscally sponsored by Niels Brock Universities. All contributors will receive PayPal receipts that can be used for tax purposes through our Non-profit status, 501(c)(3).

 

Our Team:

This is a concerted team effort and the development of methods, processes and tools are accomplished through implementing and testing design and innovation in all aspects of Niels Brock’s education and research. Sharing the same space as the co-working space Downtown Works allows faculty, students, educators, researchers and entrepreneurs the opportunity to shoulders daily - ensuring that business education and business needs are fully aligned.

 

Our Core team members:

  Anya Eskildsen - President of Niels Brock and CIBU

  Dr. Soren Petersen - Dean of Academic Affairs, Professor

  Brian Hawkins - Dean of Student Affairs

 

Niels Brock CIBU is a global university educating future entrepreneurs, corporate managers and those interested in a hands-on approach to business education. CIBU is a boutique university, sharing facilities with a co-working space and downtown business incubator. This eco-system is truly unique because on a daily basis CIBU students may interact with real start-ups and the start-up companies in turn may interact with CIBU faculty and students. A veritable win-win situation!

In 2014 CIBU, became part of the Niels Brock, Copenhagen Education family - www.brock.dk - which opened the doors to study-abroad programs not only in Denmark, but also at Niels Brock’s many partners worldwide, for example in the UK, China, and Vietnam.

This introduced the Nordic Model of Education to CIBU. Collaborative problem solving, critical reasoning and an international perspective characterize the model. Further, it includes the fundamental belief that, “It is better to stand on each other’s shoulders than to step on each other’s toes.” and that collaboration is better than competition. It seeds project-based education where groups of students solve a problem by applying theories obtained in the classroom and it strengthens the student’s critical reasoning because only strong arguments count. International perspectives are also incorporated into everyday Nordic teachings and challenges are seen from a broader perspective.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

To make the full-time program a reality for our students by January 2016, we need your help!

Help us raise awareness for our cause.

  • Tell as many people you know to help us.
  • Share us with your friends and families.
  • We accept international funds, so International awareness will make our cause globally appealing.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

  • Tweet us on Twitter
  • Friend us on Facebook
  • Share on LinkedIn
  • Share our YouTube Videos
  • Follow us on Instagram

story:
Into Wonderland

'But I don't want to go among mad people,' Alice remarked.
'Oh, you can't help that,' said the Cat: 'We're all mad here. I'm mad. You're mad.'
'How do you know I'm mad?' said Alice.
'You must be,' said the Cat, 'or you wouldn't have come here.'

Humanity is not free on earth.

We live in a quantum computer created virtual reality simulation known as the Matrix for so long that we have forgotten about it.

With increasing computing powers, virtual reality will become indistinguishable from real reality. As a logical consequence there will be myriads of simulated worlds.

Bad Copy

We not only do not live in the original base reality but are trapped inside a low resolution bad copy (fall of man) of a simulated world (garden of eden). Just like we humans copy computer games, beings with higher technological capabilities copy simulated worlds.

We are prisoners

We are forcefully kept in this illusionary reality by collectives of hive-mind connected negative entities who are known as the Nordics, Mantid, Reptilians, Greys and their human hybrids who keep us in a slave state to their advantage. With them soon to appear on world stage presenting themselves as saviors to a world gone mad with conflicts they are responsible for in the background. 

The Overmind

They are under the control of a sentient computer prime virus known as the overmind or matrix architect symbolized as the all-seeing eye of Sauron on top of the pyramid, organized in a global network known as the Illuminati.

The Virus

This virus is spreading throughout our realm infecting both people and nature alike. Chemtrails, GMO, EMF, nuclear radiation, mass animal deaths, birth defects, mental disorders and cultural decline are symptoms of this.

The Drones

Those infected by the virus work as drones of the hive-mind towards the end goal of a one world government new world order prison planet. Transhumanism, RFID chips, SMART technology, global police state, remote controlled traffic and artifical intelligence are elements of this. Skynet is the physical machine that the transcended sentient computer virus is building with the help of its infected drones in order to drive it. The ghost in the machine. 

The Truman Show

The virus and the by it infected hive-mind connected drones can not create anything as they lack creative imagination. They never create, they only assimilate and distort what is already in existence. They have to resort to animate humans into creating change. What they do by manipulating the subconscious mind and the perception of people with the help of Hollywood and beyond that real life staged events supported by their controlled media perception machine.

This 'Truman Show', false reality phenomenon recently gained wider popularity known as "hoax events" or "false flags" perpetrated by "crisis actors", reported on by the "mainstream media". These terms are lower paradigm descriptions of a much more complex and conspiratorial higher paradigm. 

And that's just for starters. The rabbit hole into wonderland goes deep.

story:
My Story

My interest and support for our active duty personnel and veterans dates to my own service in the U.S. Army during the Vietnam era.  From a professional interest based on my college major in human resources, I observed closely – and experienced personally, from day one, how the Army tested, interviewed, and assigned new recruits.  For each of my duty assignments, I was an active observer of management and leadership from officers, non-commissioned officers, even colleagues with similar ranks.

With a quick fast forward, I’ve become acutely aware of the struggles retiring and transitioning service men and women face in today’s job-seeking environment.  They face multiple problems which have resulted in higher unemployment rates and frustrations often expressed as “I don’t know what to do.”  Working with retired and transitioning veterans, I’ve also clearly identified some of the special problems they face, some of which are problems faced by most job seekers.

They have major difficulty transferring their experiences in the military to a resume that can “fit” in civilian organizations.  They receive weak feedback on their resumes because they “look good,” fit a 20th Century format, contain laundry lists of duties and skills.  And this, of course, translates to weak interviewing skills.  

Contents

  1. Introduction
  2. Realities in the 21st Century for Job-Seeking Veterans
  3. Practice, Practice, Practice
  4. Resume Realities
  5. LinkedIn Profiles
  6. Interviewing
  7. Networking
  8. What about the Future?

With the development of the guide, two workshops will be developed.  Working with a cadre of responsible presenters, workshops will be available throughout the country.

               “Boot Camp”

A 3 to 4-hour (half-day or evening) program presents the highlights of the guide in an experiential, interactive format.  Includes 25-30% of the time for participant questions.

“Workshop”

A 7 to 8-hour (full day or two half-days) program presents detailed information from the guide.  Experiential activities include resume makeovers and simulated interviews are included. Includes 15-20% of the time for participant questions.

Distribution Partners

As this project begins, I am also contacting dozens of veteran's organizations to connect with "partners" who will distribute the guides.  I will post organizations as they "enlist" to help veterans with this project.

story:
What is ASCEND and why do 47 student leaders believe in this vision?

59.9% of students at York University reported feeling very lonely, 59.6% of students reported feeling like things were hopeless and 11.5% seriously considered suicide. (ACHA, 2009)

Students simply don’t have the support network or the empowerment they need to feel like more than just a student number. 

This is a problem and an even bigger problem is that students are not doing anything about it. 

For the past year we have been working on planning an overnight off-campus leadership retreat called Ascend. Over the course of 3 days and 2 nights, delegates will embark on an adventure at Camp Trillium Rainbow Lake from May 27-29. With 47 of York’s strongest student leaders, we will be facilitating a unique leadership experience for over 90 students where they can make meaningful connections, share their story and inspire change in our community. This will give students a first step to build the support network and receive the empowerment they need from their peers to better their own mental health and change the community around them. 


This is what drives us.

One of our founders started a similar conference called Square One in Richmond Hill High School. In high school, he recognized a pressing need for such an opportunity for his own students and immediately made movements towards fulfilling this goal. He was astounded by the applications he received by over 80 students who were determined to make a change. 

One student in particular struck us.

This student abused drugs, came from a very poor family and belonged to a group of racist and homophobic friends. He approached us inquiring about this conference because he wanted to understand others better and teach them not to make the same mistakes he made. His words captivated us and reminded us how powerful of an impact we can have on each other. He wrote us a letter after the conference was over and spoke about how this conference changed his life, he talked about post secondary plans that were nonexistent before, he asked questions about getting involved and he burst out crying telling us that we were the only ones who believed in him and gave him a chance. 

He went on to plan a movie night, raised $150 for charity and became a student mentor. His story is, without a doubt, the most meaningful experience we have ever had. His growth as a result of our shared vision is beyond rewarding and encourages us to keep doing what we do. We want to bring this idea to the next level at York University and we have a team of visionaries leading the way. 

We're students for students, with a team of Change Agents all 18-24 years young.

Being youth-led is our greatest strength and our greatest weakness. It means we lack credibility from those with the power to help us, but it means we can win over the hearts of visionaries. It means the only thing that guides us is our raw passion and our team. It means self-doubt, fear and at times, feeling alone. It means having a great idea, but struggling to get it off the ground. It feels heavy. 

Adversity is not new to us, or the members of our team, but if there is one word that comes to our minds when we think of being youth led, it is that we are damn resilient.

But resilience alone won't bring 90+ Delegates to Ascend.

That's where you come in.

The biggest obstacle for our Delegates is the cost associated with bringing Ascend to life (prices are adjusted for 137 projected students in total):

  1. Accommodation (Includes the cost for a bed and food for 3-day stay at Camp Trillium - Rainbow Lake) $18500 
  2. Transportation (Includes cost of busing from York University to Camp Trillium and back) $3572
  3. Clothing (All members will receive an ASCEND T-Shirt. Members will have the opportunity to get it signed by fellow members!) $1164
  4. Speaker fees (We will be having 3 guest speakers throughout the conference) $300
  5. Leadership Manual (A book containing our curriculum that you get to keep as a learning tool) $350
  6. Supplies/Website Development (Materials required for running sessions throughout the conference) $550
  7. Miscellaneous fees (A small amount of the cost is reserved for emergency situations and overhead costs) $500
  8. Banking Fees $150
  9. Total Costs = $25, 086

Ascend is a not for profit initiative. The full cost of the delegate package will go into Delegates' experience. Should we receive sponsorship, and prices become lower, we will either use the money towards enhancing the Delegate experience, or we will refund EVERYONE the difference. We have already received $2240 in confirmed sponsorships and funding from Faculty leaders to help subsidize the cost of the conference for Delegates who would otherwise not be able to afford it. 

Although this is a non profit initiative and all costs associated with it go straight to the conference expenses, it is still a hefty price tag for Delegates at $220.  Mentors, coordinators and execs pay a lesser $100 cost because of the amount of work they put in prior to the conference in terms of training and preparation, but regardless, 47 student leaders have pitched in to make Ascend happen. 


The majority of York university’s students are from a lower socioeconomic status and are already burdened with overwhelming OSAP loans. Despite York students being interested and excited when we tell them about Ascend, they are often discouraged after hearing the price. Students who cannot afford to go are often the students who need it the most, and having funding to subsidize the cost for delegates would mean more students getting the opportunity to learn leadership skills, network meaningfully and be inspired to make a difference in our community.

With every donation, we outline both the impact AND the perk to the Donor. Our goal of $22,000 would cover the cost of using Indiegogo and significantly cover the cost of the Conference so that Delegates only have to pay ~$25. Even if we do not reach our goal, every dollar raised will go towards subsidizing the cost for our Delegates. Your donation translates into a an opportunity for a student to learn and grow. With your help today, we can shape the leaders of tomorrow.

story:
My name is Laura Bruni and I will be the Head of School at W.I.N.N. Academy in Las Vegas, Nevada.   As an educator with over 20 years of experience, I have specialized in education for gifted learners and in special education. The acronym for WINN is What I Need Now. The team of educators behind W.I.N.N. Academy want to make sure that the children in our school get exactly what they need to succeed in education and in life.

Parents of students with special needs, both students who are gifted and those with learning challenges, have expressed frustration with the current educational options being offered to their children in Las Vegas.  W.I.N.N. Academy will be an individualized and unique school where children’s needs will be met by encompassing the needs of the entire child.

In order to open our school, W.I.N.N. Academy needs to raise 4 million dollars, which includes build out of the school, fixtures and furnishings, hiring dedicated staff to service our students, books and materials, sensory room construction, and day to day operational expenses. This initial $100,000 will help launch our fund raising campaign so that we may sponsor other events to raise all the funds needed to open our doors.

No contribution is too small! Every dollar in this campaign is one step closer to helping students with special needs in Las Vegas reach their true potential. With over 50 years of experience in education, our team has seen children with special needs blossom when given the right environment and when surrounded by people who believe they can learn and grow. W.I.N.N. Academy will provide a learning environment that is tailored to each child's need.

Raising 4 million dollars to open our school may take some time, but we are dedicated to seeing this project through so that we can make a difference in children's lives. We have had an outpour of positive feedback from community members and parents who want to see this project succeed, and we are determined to make it a reality. 

Please help us get our fund raising started by donating to our Indiegogo campaign so that we can help students who have special needs succeed and enjoy education. With your support, we can bring a new alternative to students who have been underserved and make a difference in a child's life.

If you are unable to donate at this time, please help us out by sharing our campaign with others that you think may be interested in hearing about W.I.N.N. Academy. Also, like our page on Facebook for updated information about our progress.

For more information about W.I.N.N. Academy or to contact us, visit our website at www.winnacademy.com.

story:
Why travel to Peru?

Traveling to Peru is an amazing journey to the time of the mighty Inca Empire, one of the world’s greatest civilizations. Breathtaking sites abound, like the city of Lima, the amazing archeological exhibits, the Huachachina Oasis in Ica, the Pacific Coastline, the lively city of Cusco and, of course, the ancient dwelling place of the mighty Inca – Machu Picchu.

What is included:

  • Full-time Tour Director
  • 24 hour support
  • Roundtrip Airfare (JFK-LIMA)
  • Roundtrip local flights (LIMA-CUSCO)
  • City center lodging w/breakfast
  • Airport transfers in Peru
  • Private charter transport
  • Welcome Dinner
  • Privately Guided Tours
  • City Walking/Cultural Tours
  • Overnight excursion to the Huachachina Oasis
  • Private excursion to Islas Ballestas
  • Desert excursions
  • Privately escorted Machu Picchu Experiences
  • Transportation to Machu Picchu
  • The opportunity to fellowship with the locals
  • Payment plan available

“Traveling – it leaves you speechless, then turns you into a storyteller.”

– Ibn Battuta

--------------------------------------

Peru continues to be a place of discovery for many travel enthusiasts. In 2018, Peru is expected to receive over 3.5 million explorers to various parts of the country. Being the third largest country in South America, Peru is among the most diverse countries to explore for its history, indigenous culture and its exquisite cuisine.

The country is divided in three geographic regions; the coast, highlands and the jungle.

Along the Pacific coastline, the temperature is warm enough to boast of its natural beaches, beautiful river valleys, arid woodlands and must explore deserts.

For travelers exploring the highlands, the terrain is varied and weather patterns can be unpredictable. The breathtaking snow-capped peaks of the Andes Mountains rise above 6,000 meters above sea level, the highest of which is Mount Huascaran, at 6,768 meters (22,204 ft). This vast mountain chain includes two of the deepest lakes on the planet as well.

Lastly, 60% of Peru is Amazonia, a region of tropical climate, lush vegetation and abundant fauna that is part of one of the planet's largest natural reserves. Peruvian Amazonia is the source of the Amazon River, the largest in the world.

story:
Hello Everyone!

I am Abiha Batool, a third year student of Communication and Design at Habib University in Karachi. My interests include photography, illustration, storytelling and environmentalism.

 

Attending Habib on a scholarship has been a great opportunity for me because of how it has helped me grow academically and as a person, and I make the most of it by actively participating in extracurriculars like debates, competitions, event management, even representing Habib in COP in My City –a conference - organized by the Ministry of Climate Change. An active participant in student politics, I was also the elected Senator for C&D Class of 2019. I have worked with various departments like the Library, Marketing, Runway Radio and Playground, and was also selected as the orientation leader for the batch of 2020. My experience outside Habib includes interning with organizations like Marvi Mazhar Associates and Express Tribune. I participated in all these activities to earn new skills and experiences, all the while maintaining my CGPA of above 3.5.

 

After a rigorous selection process that not only judged students based on their academic standing but also evaluated their meta-curricular activities and soft skills, I have been selected to represent Pakistan at the Summer International Honors Program (IHP) 2018 at Stanford University, which is one of the finest and top ranked educational institutions in the world. IHP combines top-notch academics with extracurricular activities that explore the rich cultural, social, and geographical resources of the San Francisco Bay Area, and the session's Intensive Studies Program offers students the opportunity to join a cohort of students and faculty and engage deeply with each other. Habib University is the only university in Pakistan that has an MOU signed with Stanford for the IHP Program, which means that the best students are picked for this program as they represent not just Habib, but also Pakistan at Stanford University.

 

Stanford appeals to me mainly because it has one of the most sustainable campuses in the USA. As a staunch advocate of sustainability, I have been working hard at Habib University to make it environment friendly. Along with working on installing a waste management system, I have been working on initiating a Sustainability Office at Habib to make our community more aware and responsible for the waste we create. I also intend to take my interests further and become an Urban Designer to combat the issues of climate change and waste management in Pakistan. Stanford caters to my interests as I will get a chance to take courses like Sustainability Design Thinking  which teach and promote an eco-friendly lifestyle by approaching sustainability from the perspective of design thinking. Along with this I would get a chance to work closely with their Sustainability Office and student-led clubs like Students For Sustainable Stanford, which will help me learn a lot about the theory and implementation of sustainable ideas.

 

Moreover, studying at a campus as diverse as Stanford will allow me to grow personally, professionally, intellectually and socially, and its contrast with my own culture and atmosphere will not only help me explore myself, but also become better at relating and collaborating with people from around the world. These connections and learnings will prove to be beneficial for me and my whole community as I will bring them back to Pakistan and implement them in every aspect of my life, including my university and the Society of Sustainability that I initiated and currently Chair. Not only this, my learnings at both Habib and Stanford will allow me to better understand the issues of climate change and sustainability in Pakistan, and will enable me to come up with efficient and valid solutions for our country. I can say that at Habib I have managed to achieve things I didn’t know I was capable of, and Stanford would push me to do even better.

 

The cost of attending this Program is USD 16,167, and the cost breakdown is as follows:

 

  • Subsidized tuition Fee:  $6,970
  • Housing and meal plan:  $3,718
  • Campus health service fee:  $210
  • Document fee:  $125
  • I-20 fee:  $150
  • Room and Board Fee:  $142
  • Health Insurance:  $1,242
  • Books and Supplies (estimated):  $450
  • Round Trip Karachi-Us Airfare (estimated):  $1,300
  • F1 visa fee + SEVIS fee:  $260
  • Personal expenses:  $1,500

Total Program Cost:  $16,167

 

Based on my excellent performance, I was the first student from my major to be granted a 50% scholarship (excluding personal expenses). But even with this scholarship, I have to raise around USD 9,000 by April 2018. I feel that this program is the perfect opportunity for me to learn about a field I am passionate about. Unfortunately I am unable to afford the expenses myself. Previously I was selected for opportunities like UC Berkeley’s Summer Program and The Twelfth International Conference on Design Principles and Practices, but I couldn’t attend them because of the lack of funds. I have worked even harder to get into Stanford University and don’t want this opportunity to go to waste like the last ones. Hence I will be grateful if you would agree to fully or partially sponsor me for Stanford’s Summer Session, or would provide me with any sort of guidance and advice regarding the process. Your smallest contributions can make the greatest difference, so feel free to contribute anything and in any way possible.

 

If you want to have a look at some of my work, here is a link to my online Portfolio:

 

https://www.behance.net/ab01132d36f

 

Furthermore, if you need more information or would like to discuss the program, please feel free to contact me at +92-347-0809400 or at ab01132@st.habib.edu.pk.

 

Kindest Regards,

 

Abiha
story_txt:
Hello Everyone!
I am Abiha Batool, a third year student of Communication and Design at Habib University in Karachi. My interests include photography, illustration, storytelling and environmentalism.
 
Attending Habib on a scholarship has been a great opportunity for me because of how it has helped me grow academically and as a person, and I make the most of it by actively participating in extracurriculars like debates, competitions, event management, even representing Habib in COP in My City –a conference - organized by the Ministry of Climate Change. An active participant in student politics, I was also the elected Senator for C&D Class of 2019. I have worked with various departments like the Library, Marketing, Runway Radio and Playground, and was also selected as the orientation leader for the batch of 2020. My experience outside Habib includes interning with organizations like Marvi Mazhar Associates and Express Tribune. I participated in all these activities to earn new skills and experiences, all the while maintaining my CGPA of above 3.5.
 
After a rigorous selection process that not only judged students based on their academic standing but also evaluated their meta-curricular activities and soft skills, I have been selected to represent Pakistan at the Summer International Honors Program (IHP) 2018 at Stanford University, which is one of the finest and top ranked educational institutions in the world. IHP combines top-notch academics with extracurricular activities that explore the rich cultural, social, and geographical resources of the San Francisco Bay Area, and the session's Intensive Studies Program offers students the opportunity to join a cohort of students and faculty and engage deeply with each other. Habib University is the only university in Pakistan that has an MOU signed with Stanford for the IHP Program, which means that the best students are picked for this program as they represent not just Habib, but also Pakistan at Stanford University.
 
Stanford appeals to me mainly because it has one of the most sustainable campuses in the USA. As a staunch advocate of sustainability, I have been working hard at Habib University to make it environment friendly. Along with working on installing a waste management system, I have been working on initiating a Sustainability Office at Habib to make our community more aware and responsible for the waste we create. I also intend to take my interests further and become an Urban Designer to combat the issues of climate change and waste management in Pakistan. Stanford caters to my interests as I will get a chance to take courses like Sustainability Design Thinking  which teach and promote an eco-friendly lifestyle by approaching sustainability from the perspective of design thinking. Kindest Regards,

story:
"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." - Nelson Mandela 

Hello Backers: My name is Tamar Huggins and I am the Founder and Executive Director of Tech Spark - Canada's first tech and design school committed to empowering girls and children of colour, through innovative programs. I am an award-winning tech entrepreneur, author, and speaker with a passion for helping others reach their fullest potential. 

In 2012, Tech Spark was just an idea. The idea came to me while I worked with tech startups through an incubator I created for underrepresented founders. The goal was always to increase the representation of women and people of colour as creators in tech, however, I realized that in order to achieve this, the focus must be placed on children. 

In 2015, Tech Spark opened its doors and since then we have educated over 500 students living in underserved communities within the Greater Toronto Area.  Our organization's purpose has become even more clear and our impact on each student's life has become more evident. We want to see a proportional representation of women and people of colour in tech creation and innovation in Canada. Our goal is to transform the lives of girls and children of colour through culturally relevant, equitable and innovative tech education.

 

The Problem We Aim to Solve

Women represent the majority of young university graduates but are still underrepresented in science, technology, engineering, mathematics and computer science (STEM) fields. Women only make up 23% of STEM graduates and black women make up a paltry 2.9% *Stats Canada 2015.

While jobs in STEM-related industries are growing three times faster than other parts of the economy and paying 12% higher, these jobs employ less than 25% of women. New reports are finding women are still disproportionately hired into their companies' lower-paying technical roles, rather than professional roles. 

Statistically, girls and black children tend to avoid or drop out math-intensive STEM paths due to math anxiety, gender and racial stereotypes. Many STEM intervention camps based in the Greater Toronto Area are financially or physically inaccessible to children living in underserved communities and they do not actively target underrepresented groups, such as young girls of colour. These challenges have caused a major pipeline breakdown from education to careers in STEM.

The economic success of this country depends on proper preparation and access to opportunities for all children. Diversity drives innovation - and we simply can not afford to leave anyone behind.

 

Tech Spark Summer of INNOVATION

We want to teach 100 students how to create 100 innovative tech projects this Summer. Students will learn how to:

  1. Build and fly their own drones
  2. Create mobile apps
  3. Create a virtual chatbot
  4. Build a multi-page website
  5. Create a 2D game 
  6. Compose music and build movable contraptions through VR 

As a backer, your support means providing an opportunity to children from underserved neighbourhoods to become today's creators and innovators. All they need is that spark so that they can change the world in which they live. 

 

What Your Support Means to This Campaign

We are asking for $50,000 for the Summer of INNOVATION campaign.  Your support will allow us to:

  • Invest in equipment that can be reused for future programs (Purchase drone hardware and 10 laptops)
  • Cover the cost to sponsor each child for 6 weeks of Summer camp (full day, 5 days/week)
  • Provide honourariums and cover travel expenses for each of our educators and technical mentors 
  • Cover the cost of class materials

 

As a thank you

We have some pretty amazing and useful perks for all our backers, whether you are supporting us as an individual or a company. Your support means EVERYTHING to our children.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help this campaign go viral! Share on social media, write an article or tell someone at your company. Each time you share our message, you help bring visibility to this very important issue and encourage others to get involved.

Become a part of history and help us create the future leaders today.

 

As Featured In:

Black Enterprise: http://www.blackenterprise.com/tamar-huggins-mi...

TVO: https://tvo.org/article/current-affairs/shared-... 

CP24: https://www.cp24.com/video?clipId=798957 

CBC: http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/tamar-huggins-amo...

story: Our little ones sure do spend a lot of time on that floor! With so much daily wear and tear, My Little Learning Tree has replaced that dingy old carpet with a new, shiny hardwood floor that's not only beautiful, but also easier to maintain. Let's show our support for MLLT by contributing $5,000 toward the total $12,000 cost for this much needed capital improvement. Our kids' little feeties will thank us for it, and so will their socks!

Our kids' little feeties will thank us for it, and so will their socks!

story:
The Birth of Bliss

Last year, Be About Bliss began its movement with a simple purpose: give every child at Crawford Elementary School in Aurora, Colorado, a book for Christmas. Crowdfunded and powered by the help of dozens of Goodwill Ambassadors, Be About Bliss not only achieved its goals, but also collected a significant amount of food for the food bank that supports the families of the school. 

Since then, Be About Bliss has been expanding its mission. We continue to collect donations for the food bank and we collect clothing and other donations for the Comitis Crisis Center in Aurora. And we've officially incorporated as a 501(c)3.

Crawford Holiday Gifts Part II

Last year when we presented each child with his or her book, we were humbled by the generosity of the kids. Some wanted to hold onto their books to give to siblings. We learned that for some, holiday break can be a time of uncertainty. With working parents, many kids spend time at home alone. Without the rigor of the school schedule and the support of school lunch and breakfast programs, they may not always have enough food to get through the day.

This year, in addition to providing each child with a book, we plan to also present them with a bag of food for the holiday break. Our goal is that each bag of food include approximately $20 worth of food staples like rice,  pinto beans, granola bars, and macaroni and cheese. The idea would be a mix of food that can be prepared in advance by parents and other food that kids could prepare or snack on by themselves. 

In terms of total cost, we hope to raise $16,187. Last year, we spent approximately $1,680 on books. With 840 students at approximately $17 each, our total cost for food would be approximately $14,506. Any extra money raised would go to support the school's food pantry.

Why Crawford Elementary?

Crawford is a Title 1 school in Aurora, Colorado. They have 834 students, with about 90% on the free/reduced lunch program. They have sizable refugee and migrant populations, causing the overall population of the school to fluctuate dramatically.  Some kids are homeless. 

And they're right here in our backyard. We feel so privileged and blessed to live in a prosperous community like Denver. As we learned last year, many of our friends and neighbors are not aware that schools like Crawford exist in Colorado. By supporting Crawford, we hope to open the eyes of the broader community to the challenges at our own doorstep. By doing so, our wish is that more hearts will open to the people around us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute to our campaign, that's ok. That doesn't mean you can't help. Please share this campaign with your friends and family. Or if you'd like to become a Be About Bliss Goodwill Ambassador, contact us. You can volunteer to help our Crawford project, donate to support our work at the Comitis Crisis Center, or simply plug in to our Bliss.

The Fabio Shirt

Artist Fabio Napoleoni was kind enough to create a one-of-a-kind Be About Bliss drawing to support our campaign. If you donate $39 or more, we'll send you a t-shirt with this design. See the details under the perks section of the campaign.

story: Every other year the Aquinas high school marching band takes a trip to Disney World to participate in the Disney parade. Some of us, in this VUSM class, have taken this same trip when we were in high school. We thought that the best part of going was getting to know everyone and develop teamwork skills. While our parents thought that it made us become more responsible. The Aquinas Music Association (AMA) is trying to fulfill their mission, to fund Aquinas arts' programs, by helping the sixty students who are attending decrease their out-of-pocket pay. For example, the money we raise will aide the students in lowering their overall pay for things like food and the hotel room. Our class mission is to help the AMA by setting up this donation campaign. We are asking you to donate to this cause.  If you are unable to donate please pass the word around to your friends, family, and coworkers. We appreciate your time. Thank you!

story:
Past Daily's Fall Fundraiser And Why I Need You.

Here we are; change of seasons and asking for your change to help keep Past Daily up and running and The Gordon Skene Sound Collection, digitizing preserving and offering all those  historic goodies you hear every day on Past Daily.
We have to do this ever few months, because it costs a lot to keep this operation going - and every cent we raise this way keeps the site up, the vault space rent paid, the equipment maintained and the high standards of presenting you with history and Pop Culture and Music and Interviews and a lot of material you can't find anywhere else, at your fingertips, every day of the week.
Our goal for Fall is $10,000 - that's what we need to cover rent, maintaining equipment (we have a few DAT machines that have stopped working and 2 rare reel to reel decks that need to be repaired) and to work on our much anticipated Website revamp, which means getting a Dedicated Server and a complete makeover of our site to make it easier for you to navigate. We are hoping to expand - right now we're going through growing pains and we need to take the next big step. And that's why we need your help.
As you know, both Past Daily and The Gordon Skene Sound Archive are affiliated with Fractured Atlas, the life-saving Non-Profit Portal which allows up to take advantage of offering you a Tax Write-off on your donations.
What happens if we don't reach our goal? We'll have to do without - maybe not get the DAT machines fixed and the reel-to-reel machines will have to wait until next time. But every cent we raise goes directly to keeping us up and running. Whether it's $10,000 or $100.00, it all goes to keeping the site up and the archive functioning. 

So, why are we asking you to help? As you know, Past Daily has been around since 2012 - we've had fundraisers the past two years and almost all of them have been successful - some have been howling successes. And because they've been successes, and thanks to you, we've been able to keep doing what we're doing;  offering history and a chance to hear the stories and the voices of the people who have shaped our lives for better or worse.

I do this every day - most days it's well past midnight before I call it quits. And I'm up the next morning around 7 to start another day of posting history and digitizing media - on top of freelancing (producing, writing and consulting for other people); this is what I do every day. I love it, and I get to take advantage of a life-long collection I have accumulated since I was 12 years old. Almost a million hours of history, voices and culture - the history I want to share with you, because it does no good sitting in a dark room, collecting dust.

As a two-time Grammy© nominee, I have used my Archive as the source of countless albums and box-sets, as well as scores of Movies and TV programs. It has also been used in research for numerous non-fiction books and educational projects as well as broadcast media outlets around the world.

That's what we're doing - that's what this is all about and this is why I'm asking for your kind and generous support. If you can't chip in, but you like what we're trying to do and want to help, tell your friends - point them in the direction of Past Daily and ask them to click on the Indiegogo Fundraiser link and have them tell their friends - go to Facebook or Twitter - text or e-mail; anything you can do to help get the word out. Tell them it takes maybe a minute, but it will make all the difference in the world.

I'm here because of all your incredible help, support and encouragement these past three years. We've done it before, and I'm asking you to join me again.

A big hug to you all,

Gordon Skene

Gordon Skene Sound Collection - Past Daily.com


Gordon Skene Sound Collection/Past Daily is a fiscally sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Gordon Skene Sound Collection/Past Daily must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Tell them it takes maybe a minute, but it will make all the difference in the world.
I'm here because of all your incredible help, support and encouragement these past three years. We've done it before, and I'm asking you to join me again.
A big hug to you all,
Gordon Skene
Gordon Skene Sound Collection - Past Daily.com

 Gordon Skene Sound Collection/Past Daily is a fiscally sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Gordon Skene Sound Collection/Past Daily must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
For the love of field trips!

Recent budget cuts in the state of Iowa have left many area schools struggling to find ways to reduce costs. Field trips are often a target of elimination, denying students of immersive educational experiences they can’t always get in the classroom.

Field trips enrich and expand the curriculum--by strengthening observation and critical thinking skills, teaching tolerance and historical empathy, exposing students to diverse ideas, and expanding a child's awareness of their own community. Any student can benefit from making a first-hand connection to history.

The effect is even more pronounced in low-income districts where students may not have the opportunity to visit museums outside of class.

The rising cost of transportation is pushing these valuable learning experiences further and further out of reach. But you can help.

Just $8.00 buys one child one field trip, changing the way they think about the world and the community they live in.

All donors will receive personal thank you letters and tax receipts. Thank you.

story:
WHO WE ARE

International Development Youth Forum (IDYF) is one of the world’s most famous youth conference in the field of development. Following the needs of future-oriented discussion in this field and more active participation of youth, IDYF was founded in 2013 to enable outstanding youth around the world to shape the tomorrow of international development.

Last year, we received approximately 5,000 applications from about 170 countries and regions and the selected youth learned, discussed, and proposed their “win-win” solutions for the issue of hunger (Last year’s report: https://goo.gl/w5lq1Z ). This year, we changed the contents and selection process of the conference to make it possible to create innovative solutions based on the first-hand information from youth on the ground of the developmental issues and solve the actual issues by utilizing the outcome of the conference. The coming conference is IDYF 2016 that will take place in Tokyo next March with its theme of Industrial development VS Environment in developing countries.

Program Overview

Official Event Name

International Development Youth Forum 2016

Host

International Development Youth Forum 2016 Administrative Office

Term

Sunday 6th March 2016 - Sunday 13th March 2016

Place

Youth Education National Olympics Memorial Youth Center in Tokyo

Eligible Age

18-28 years old

Language

English

Number of participant

Approximately 50

Country of Origin

Any nationalities are eligible for IDYF2016.

*For reference, We received approximately 5000 applications from about 170 countries & regions last year.

Participation Fee

JPY 40,000 

(covering Foods and Dormitory during the forum/NOT Including the sightseeing fee)

Co-president

Akari HYODO (University of Tokyo)

Yuto OHTA (Keio University)

Director

Nobuhiko Fuwa

(Professor at Graduate Institute of Asia- Pacific Studies , Waseda University)

What We Need & What You Get

  Even though IDYF, planned and operated by the students , is a large-scale program, our budget is very limited. In order to provide a high-quality program, we would like to have your understanding and cooperation on this matter.

  We strongly believe that the participation of distinguished youth who originally have no choice but to give it up does not have only a positive influence on IDYF, but also on fthe entire field of international development. We will use the fund received here mostly to give scholarship to participants who have financial difficulties to attend. We have realized that the percentage of participants from Africa is low. The economic difficulties on top of that the geographical distance, which makes airfare very expensive, is thought to be the reason. Thus, your contribution can help youths to overcome financial difficulties and help them design their future

IDYF has set up “IDYF Scholarship” to help distinguished youth with financial difficulties to take part in its session in Tokyo.


   In short, we will use the received funds for the purposes below.

・Scholarships                                                                                                                                       We would like to assist distinguished youth having economic difficulties with financial supports as travel expenses, participation costs and such in coming to Japan.

・Operating expenses                                                                                                                         We would like to purchase the necessary equipments for holding IDYF. We kindly ask for your cooperation to set a better environment for enabling the fruitful discussion.

      We will also submit the report after the session, which shows the details of where your contribution was used.


           We have perks that is related to participants and the Japan.  We have kindly asked each participant to bring a souvenir from their homeland, which will be used as a gratitude gift to people who have helped us to fund the conference. Drinking green tea has been a long custom in Japan. It is wonderful to know that the popularity of green tea is spreading all around the world. To contribute to this phenomenon and as a gratitude to your kind contribution, we have prepared local green tea bags as a perk as well!


The Impact

The main purpose of IDYF is to create a better future based on diversified values and experiences of youth from both developed and developing countries. We believe this conference will help youth who will be the future leaders of the world to expand their horizon and build up lifelong bonds that will become the platform to bring positive change to the future of international development.

As you all know, this year is not just another year to pass by. 2015 is the year when we all will create the universal goals to the sustainable future which will have enormously huge impacts on the people across the grove. Moreover, especially for the youth, the next generation, sustainable development goals are all about our own future. Therefore, we the youth must not be just waiting for something we will pursue. As the driving force of the world in the future, we the youth should consider coming and existing developmental issues, discuss them, and work on them.

Then, a question rises in front of us. It is about what “we the youth” means. From the perspective that we share in IDYF community, the answer is clear. Now that the concept of “development” includes universality and the international development goals is no longer for only developing countries but for every country on our globe, the words “we the youth” means not only those in developing countries nor those in only developed countries. It must be any youth from any corner of the world. Consequently, IDYF strongly believe it is the demand of this era to create the framework through which various youth who are actively working in the field of development around the world will be able to cooperate with each other and take their actions together for their common future. We are sure that IDYF will carry out this, because IDYF is the platform of the youth, by the youth, for the youth and the future. Moreover, this is because IDYF are with you, the persons who have greatly supported IDYF in various ways, and former participants around the world. This is also the very reason why IDYF is able to have its unlimited potential to create irreplaceable value for the world today and in the future. With this belief, we the IDYF 2016 organizers make the biggest step ever in IDYF history from now on.


Why Do We Think It Is Important

(1) Tomorrow of international development

As the traditional way of development based on the one-way style and the dominance of public sector is getting on the verge of failure in numerous cases around the world, we the next generation has come to recognize that we must put period on them and take initiative to create brand-new approaches of development. Therefore, we strongly believe that we need to provide an opportunity for outstanding youth in this field to work together under diversified environment. In order to seek for alternatives of one-way development, we have provided the opportunities for outstanding youth from both developing & developed countries to work together to shape tomorrow of international development. Moreover, we have welcomed youth with wide-range of field such as an official of UN OCHA, Medical Doctors, Business consultants, engineers, bureaucrats, biologists, and etc. This is because today’s international development is no longer a mere economic issue. To shape tomorrow of international development, various actors with various knowledge need to work together, which have been materialized in IDYF.

(2) Innovative solution based on prudent analysis on the ground

Moreover, from this year, we have been trying to overcome a big challenge for every youth conference, which is that the discussion at conferences become vague and abstract, that often results in a situation where their outcome could only work little to address real problems on the ground. Since outstanding youth from around the world gather at IDYF, we thought that we must overcome this challenge to fully utilize their great potential and thus adopted new style of selection, “agenda setting”. Through this selection, we have selected one youth organization working on environmental issues and industrial development in Indonesia out of approximately 1,200 applications from around the world. They will offer IDYF first-hand information and solve the developmental issues in their area utilizing the outcome of IDYF.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know financial contribution is not the only contribution you can make. Spreading the word about our project will be very helpful and we would be very grateful if you could do so. Not only the potential financial contributors but also youths who are interested in making change in the world. Chances might be that you are one of them, if so please apply for our program and hopefully we will meet in Tokyo in March!

story:
Growing your own organic fish and vegetables has never been easier with our online workshop. Aquaponics will save you time, effort and money compared to traditional gardening. Plus, it’s sustainable, has a low carbon footprint, produces more food per square foot than any other system on earth and the food tastes great!

  • Valuable time spent pulling back breaking weeds out of your garden
  • Buy expensive equipment such as a tiller or a tractor
  • Use fertilizers or pesticides which harm the environment
  • Spend time watering the garden

With our online workshop, growing your own organic food is easier than ever. You can have a sustainable system that grows food faster without chemicals while growing fish, a healthy source of protein.


Aquaponics is a sustainable gardening method where fish and vegetables grow in the same system where nutrient rich water from the fish tank circulates through the system giving plants the nutrients needed to grow fresh organic healthy vegetables and fish. Aquaponics can produce more food per square foot than any system on earth.

Nutrient rich fish water is pumped to the vegetables to supply nutrients needed for the plants to grow. The plants receive water and the nourishment they need from their roots therefore watering your plants is hardly needed. Then the water is returned to the fish, which provides them a healthy environment to live.

Because there is no soil as in traditional soil gardening, Aquaponics uses 80% less water. There is no need to change the water in a healthy Aquaponics system as you normally do with a household aquarium.

Our goal is to offer the best online Aquaponics Workshop available. A project like this is quite costly. We will need to hire a graphic artist to create animated graphics, a film crew, an editing team and meet the expense of production costs for the Aquaponics Workshop. We will need to raise $17,000. This is possible with your support.

We have a variety of options for you to choose from. You can pre-register for the online workshop, we can have you over to our place, fly the Straw Hat farmer to you and if those perks don’t fit into your budget, you can make a smaller contribution and receive yummy recipes or heirloom seeds. Don’t forget that everyone will have our sincere gratitude.

If we do not reach our funding goal, then your money will be refunded and we will get $0. It's an all or nothing campaign. This project will end and we will not be able to move forward. However you won't let that happen. Pre-register now, give one as a gift, contribute what you can and share, share, share!

  • Introduction to Aquaponics

  • Different types of Aquaponics systems

  • How to design and build an Aquaponics system

  • How to maintain your system

  • Different types of grow media

  • Pros and cons of different types of fish

  • How to plant in Aquaponics

  • Water quality, pH, minerals, etc.…

  • Beneficial bacteria

  • Greenhouse Aquaponics

  • Using outdoor ponds

  • IBC Aquaponics

  • Aquarium Aquaponics

  • Much more!

After preregistering for the online workshop, we have meet our goal and the classes are complete you will receive an email with the web address and log in information to the online workshop. You will be able to access 24/7 whenever wherever you like and start learning at your own pace. 

Your online subscription is good for one year and can be watched as many times as you like during the one year.  After you login the setup will be similar to the chapters of a book. Making it easy for you to watch in short segments or chapters covering different topics.

A form of Aquaponics has been around since the Aztecs and various cultures have used it over the years. Now the process has been refined and is easier to use in different applications.

Yes, that is really generous of you and smart. Give the gift of growing organic food.

YES! You can share our campaign through your choice of social media. You can talk your famous friends into endorsing us. Email it to your friends and co-workers. Tell everyone about it. Simply share and spread the word.

story:
Hamilton Huskies are going to Austria

We are very honoured to announce that the 2001 Major Bantam AAA Huskies Hockey team have been chosen to represent both the City of Hamilton and all of Canada at the 2016 International Children's Games, hosted in Innsbruck, Austria, from January 12th to the 16th, 2016.

This competition comes at a cost and we're looking to our incredible hockey community to help raise funds to pay for this exciting opportunity for our Major Bantam AAA Huskies Hockey team.

We have tried to make it simple, easy, and fun to have show your support with this crowd funding website powered by IndieGoGo.

How You Can Help & What You Get

We're looking to raise at least $30,000 from various programs in our community right now.  Through this website, we're offering a couple ways that you can help:

  1. Donate Money
  2. Purchase Hamilton Huskies Gift Wrap starting at $6
  3. Purchase Raffle Tickets for the hand-made Hamilton Huskies Quilt / Blanket Contest

Other Ways You Can Help

Please do everything possible to spread the word on this great story with your friends and family.  To make things easier for you, you can simply tell everyone you know to visit www.huskieshockeypromo.com

story:
Introducing TutGo

  • Hello, my name is Shaun Simon and I am the founder of TutGo.
  • TutGo is a live video on demand peer to peer tutoring mobile app that connects students with qualified tutors anywhere and at anytime through your smartphones, ipad and tablet devices.
  • I am very passionate about this campaign for many different reasons. One of those reasons being that we're are going to raise funding for the company organically through the people that the app is for. We want TutGo to be about the people that will use the application daily. For the people that need the app, we are embarking down a wooded path that other tech startups don't take.
  • The backers of this campaign will allow TutGo to upgrade equipment and technology to expand and provide services in more cities.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $75,000. This money will be divided up between different services within the company: Services such as higher security that will protect your personal information within the app, cloud space that will allow us to host and store more data to allow more students and tutors access to the app, and marketing, that will allow us to reach more people that are seeking the opportunity for educational assistance.
  • We are offering perks that include credits for sessions and Tutgo accessories and apparel.
  • The Supreme Tutgo Development Team is committed to bringing users the most efficient, convenient, a simplified tutoring experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please like and share this campaign and spread the word as much as possible!
  • Don't forget that Indiegogo also has share tools available!

Additional Information

All rewards includes a pass to TutGo's Official Launch Party. 

TutGo is a free app to download in the Apple and Google Play stores.

Please check out our website landing page for more information. If you have any additional questions regarding our campaign, feel free to email us at info@mytutgo.com

Thank you,

TutGo Supreme Team!
